Michigan Scholarships


50 Years Of Service Scholarship
Established in honor of those faculty and staff members who have served the college for 50 or more years. Those recognized include Mustafa Munem and William Metz (2013); Louis Baltman and Richard M. Daugherty (2014); and Norman Cure and Shirley Glass (2016); Jim Jacobs and Thomas Cook (2017); Sylvia Polowniak and Donna Schouman (2019); and Steve Rybicki (2020).
students who do not qualify for assistance through Financial Aid office
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.5 or higher
student must write a brief essay on future goals
award is for tuition, fees, books and other educational expenses more...

A Grand Day At A Time Scholarship
This scholarship was intended to provide financial assistance to students who otherwise would not receive help with the cost of their education at Grand Valley State University.
Must have been accepted or enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
Must be enrolled full time in any declared major
Financial need may be considered as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

A. Albert Sugar Memorial Annual Scholarship
The A. Albert Sugar Memorial Annual Scholarship is available to students at Wayne State University, Law School. You must have taken a leadership role in the Jewish Law Student's Association, demonstrate strong academic achievement and be committed to the betterment of the community in order to qualify for this award. more...

A. Bruce Clarke Senior Award
Scholarship for seniors attending Western Michigan University who are majoring in Statistics or Mathematics. Selection based on high academic achievement. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

A. Donald Vroon Scholarship For Physcial Education
Scholarship for full-time juniors or seniors attending Calvin College who are majoring or minoring in Physical Education. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and financial need. Due date may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

A. Edythe Mange Distinguished Scholarship In History
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Western Michigan University who are majoring in History. Selection based on academic achievement. Preference given to female applicants. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

A.M.D.G. Scholarship
Scholarship for sophomores, juniors or seniors attending Calvin College who are pursuing a major in Pre-Architecture. Preference given to female, minority, and international students. Nonrenewable. more...

Aafmcc Adjunct Family Scholarship
The Association of Adjunct Faculty of Macomb Community College (AAFMCC) represents over 1,300 Adjunct Faculty at the college. On October 30, 2015 the AAFMCC Executive Board approved an annual $1,000 scholarship ($500 each fall and winter term) for one child of an adjunct instructor to take classes at MCC.
• at least one of the recipient’s parents must be a full member of the AAFMCC and be on the current seniority list*
• the recipient must be a resident of the State of Michigan
• the recipient must have a GPA of 2.5 or higher
• the recipient must be enrolled a minimum of a half -time load (6 credits or more)
• scholarship includes the cost of tuition, fees, books and other MCC expenses more...

Aafmcc Community Scholarship
The Association of Adjunct Faculty of Macomb Community College (AAFMCC) represents over 1,300 Adjunct Faculty at the college. On October 30, 2015 the AAFMCC Executive Board approved an annual $1,000 scholarship ($500 each fall and winter term) for one (1) resident of the local community to take classes at MCC.
• the recipient must be a resident of one of the following Counties: Macomb, St. Clair, Oakland, or Wayne
• the recipient must have a GPA of 2.5 or higher
• the recipient must be enrolled a minimum of a half -time load (6 credits or more)
• scholarship includes the cost of tuition, fees, books and other MCC expenses more...

Aaia-Gene Gardner Annual Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Northwood University-Texas majoring in Automotive Marketing. Students must demonstrate financial need, academic achievement, be U.S. citizens, and pursuing a career in the Automotive Aftermarket. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Aaron M. Desrocher Memorial Chemistry Scholarship
This scholarship is designed to support a junior-level chemistry major at GVSU.
Candidates must be entering their junior level undergraduate year having more than 55 credits and 2 remaining years of course work required to complete a chemistry major. Transfer students may be candidates

Recipients must be enrolled at GVSU as a qualified chemistry major, degree-seeking student
Students must be attending full-time and making satisfactory academic progress
Priority will be given to scholarship candidates who have financial need as evidenced by filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: Automatically renewed for a max/total of 4 semesters provided the recipient continues to meet the eligibility requirements more...

Aauw Birmingham Excellence Award
The AAUW Birmingham Branch devote many hours to raising funds for scholarships and other endeavors that support AAUW’s mission of promoting education and equity for women and girls.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, the applicants:
MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.8


MUST demonstrate financial need.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be a U.S. Citizen.
Preference given to students who have struggled to enter or return to education due to circumstances such as domestic violence, divorce, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, single parenthood, or difficult life-changing transitions; or are
reentering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment due to family circumstances such as caring for children or aging parents.

MUST be willing to be contacted by an AAUW representative.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
*Applicants may reapply if they were previously awarded this scholarship.
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Aauw Farmington Branch Scholarship
The AAUW Farmington Hills Branch support the advancement of equity for women and girls through advocacy, education, philanthropy, and research.
Criteria
To be eligible for this scholarship, applicants:
Must be a resident of Farmington or Farmington Hills, Michigan.
Must have a cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher.

MUST be a U.S. citizen.

MUST demonstrate financial need.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who have Orchard Ridge as “home campus.”
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Aauw Northville-Novi Branch Endowed Award
The AAUW Northville-Novi Branch supports a number of community action projects and raises funds for local college scholarships.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have a minimum 2.5 GPA


MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credit hours

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have struggled to enter or return to education due to circumstances such as domestic violence, divorce, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, single parenthood, and difficult life-changing transitions.
Students who are reentering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment due to family circumstances such as caring for children or aging parents.

MUST be used award for tuition, books, and other educational expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if the recipient still meets the criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability.
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Aauw: Wyandotte-Downriver Foundation Scholarship
This scholarship is to provide financial support, including tuition, fees, books and supplies. The applicant must be a United States citizen, must be a permanent resident of one of the following 19 Downriver Michigan communities: Allen Park, Brownstown, Ecorse, Flat Rock, Gibraltar, Grosse Ile, Huron Township, Lincoln Park, Melvindale, New Boston, River Rouge, Riverview, Romulus, Rockwood, Southgate, Taylor, Trenton, Woodhaven and Wyandotte, must have earned a minimum of 12 college credits and must be currently enrolled as a full-time student. Preference given to a student returning to college, after an absence, due to various circumstances. Applicant must submit an essay of 250-500 words to include an introduction of themselves by understanding the AAUW mission and principles (http://www.aauw.org/about) and why they believe they would be successful in their intended education goal and future career. more...

minimum GPA 2.5 each semester of award
financial need (FAFSA required)
award is for tuition, required fees, and books more...

Accounting Alumni Scholarship
This scholarship was established to recognize outstanding full time undergraduate accounting students who show promise of making outstanding contributions in the field of accounting.
Students must be full-time undergraduates and accounting majors
Must demonstrate good interpersonal skills and continues involvement in the business community
Must have overall GPA of 3.2 and an accounting GPA of 3.5 or higher
Must have completed ACC 310
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
Application Process: To apply for this scholarship complete the School of Accounting Scholarships application through myScholarships. more...

Ada Council For The Arts Vogelsang Memorial Scholarship (Art)
This scholarship is available to first year entering freshman who are accepted by GVSU into one of the many visual arts programs offered through Art and Design.
Must be a resident of Michigan
Preference given to residents of Ada Township, Cascade Township, Grand Rapids Township or Vergennes Township
Demonstration of financial need is not required, although should the top candidates have equal academic qualifications, it may be considered. Must file FAFSA for financial need consideration.
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

Ada Council For The Arts Vogelsang Memorial Scholarship For Dance Majors
This scholarship is available to first year entering freshman who are accepted by GVSU and seeking a degree in Dance.
Must be a resident of Michigan
Preference given to residents of Ada Township, Cascade Township, Grand Rapids Township or Vergennes Township
Must be a full-time student
Demonstration of financial need is not required although, should the top candidates have equal academic qualifications, it may be considered. Must file FAFSA.
Application Process: To apply visit: https://www.gvsu.edu/mtd/scholarship-awards-4.htm
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

Adam M. Malson Memorial Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist a student in Political Science or International Relations with the cost of their education. To qualify for this scholarship, students must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Be an undergraduate student enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more) with a major in Political Science or International Relations
Student should be making university Satisfactory Academic Progress standards
Preference will be given to students with military service
Renewal criteria: This scholarship is non-renewable more...

3.0 cumulative GPA

Albion Alumni Grant
The Albion Alumni Grant is available to students at Albion College. Your family must include one or more Albion alumna/alumnus to be eligible for this award. more...

Alec Harwood Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship to be used for tuition, fees, books and supplies. Preference will be given to a student pursuing a degree or certificate in welding technology. If there is not an applicant pursing welding technology, the scholarship may be awarded to a student in any Applied Science and Engineering Technology Division certificate or degree program. Preference will then be given to a student whose coursework includes welding. Applicant must have a 3.0 GPA and at least a part-time student at MCCC during their scholarship year. Part-time enrollment is defined as six (6) contact hours per semester. Preference will be given to a Monroe High School, Monroe, Michigan, graduate. If there is not an applicant from Monroe High School, the scholarship may be awarded to a high school graduate from any Monroe County high school if they meet all other criteria. more...

Alena E. Zachery-Ross '95 Emerging Leaders Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to reduce the financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from Ypsilanti Community Schools, Muskegon Heights Public School Academy System, Van Dyke Public Schools in Macomb County, Detroit Public Schools Community District, and Urban Schools identified by the GVSU Admissions Office. To qualify for this scholarship, recipients:
Must be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an incoming freshman or transfer enrolled as an undergraduate
Must be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more) in any course of study
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards
First preference will be given to graduates from Ypsilanti Community Schools, Muskegon Heights Public School Academy System, Van Dyke Public Schools in Macomb County, Detroit Public Schools Community District. Second preference will be given to graduates of Urban Schools identified by the GVSU Admissions Office.
Financial Need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of four years (8 semesters) more...

Alex Aninos Music Education Scholarship
The purpose of the scholarship is to support students who struggled with music courses early on in their education at Grand Valley, but then show desire to and proof of academic improvement through retaking courses, better overall GPA, and having involvement in groups and/or communities within the Performing Arts Center (i.e. Music Fraternities, organizations, performing/chamber ensembles, etc.).
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be at least a junior or senior enrolled for 12 credit hours or more with a declared major in Music Education
Shall be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Alexa Kraft Memorial Award
The competitive award was established to honor the memory of Alexa Kraft, a student athlete on the Macomb Community College’s cross country and track teams. A committee of the Athletic Manager and other Athletic Department representatives will review the applications.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.0 each semester of award
current or graduating student athlete participating in a Macomb Community College sponsored NJCAA sanctioned sport
letter of recommendation from a coach
short biography and description of goals that student-athlete plans on attaining at Macomb Community College
award is for tuition and fees
students must be nominated by a Macomb Community College coach and meet the final criteria.
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://www.macomb.edu/future-students/campus-life/athletics/index.html more...

Be enrolled full time
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
Application Process: Candidates are nominated by the faculty from their units and are expected to be in their final year of undergraduate study during the year covered by the award. Please contact your department for further detail. more...

Alison Mcmanus Walters '73 Fostering Success Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to foster youth and ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth while pursuing a degree at GVSU.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be a resident of Michigan and have been in foster care, orphaned, or a ward of the court on or after their 13th birthday
Must be an undergraduate student enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more) in any course of study
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress Standards
Preference will be given to students who live on campus and participate in Student Success Programs offered by GVSU

Financial need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 8 semesters. more...

Allen Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Church Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Western Michigan University. Selection based on minimum 2.0 GPA, financial need, public service and volunteer activities. Preference given to members or children of members of the Allen Chapel African Methodist Episcopal Church. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Allen J. Bogucki Memorial Endowed Scholarship
The Alan J. Bogucki Endowed Scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed 12 or more credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST be enrolled as a full-time student.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


MUST be enrolled in Business, Accounting, or Business Administration or Management Development curriculum (BUS.ABA, MGT.BUS.AAS, and ACC.ABA)

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership (written documentation required)

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write thank-you letter to donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Allyn L. Miller Scholarship

Alumnae Association Student Research Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students atending the University of Michigan-Flint. Preference will be given to non-traditional students, both men and women. Applicants must have completed a minimum of 55 credit hours. Candidates must complete a student research application form and submit a written statement outlining proposed research project: its goals, value, progress to-date, and any other potential funding sources. Applicants must submit a letter of recommendation from a UM-Flint faculty member sponsoring the student research. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Alumni Association Presidents' Leadership Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to award and encourage the building of lifetime leadership skills while students are earning a degree at GVSU.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be at least a sophomore (transfer students are eligible)
Must be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more) in any course of study
Must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA or higher
Must be meeting satisfactory academic progress standards
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate outstanding leadership by serving in a leadership role in a volunteer organization
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed more...

Amanda Kate Cohen Memorial Social Work Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to reduce the financial pressure on students and their families to make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will assist seniors pursuing a Bachelor of Social Work and ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate senior enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the School of Social Work
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate an interest in working with children and/or have past volunteer/community service experience with children.
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Ambassador Secchia International Studies Scholarship
This scholarship will be made available to Grand Valley students chosen by the university who seek to pursue studies in Italy in public administration or business.
To qualify, you must:
*be enrolled full time (part time students may qualify under special circumstances)
*be studying abroad in Italy. In the event that travel to Italy is not safe or available, other parts of Europe will be considered.
*program length must be at least 6 weeks abroad.
*majoring in public administration or business.
Preference will be given to programs of a full semester or more in length.
Financial need is not required.
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Andrew S. Abler ’78 Science Technology Engineering And Math (Stem) Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to attract and assist the best and brightest students pursuing degrees in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math (STEM) and help them reach their full potential and enhance Grand Valley’s learning environment. This merit and need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
To qualify, students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*have a declared major in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math
*have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0+
*be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University: https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
Preference will be given to the following majors in this order: biology, chemistry and health sciences.
Financial Need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewed for a maximum of 8 semesters (total) as long as recipient continues to meet qualifications listed above. more...

Andrew S. Friend Family Annual Scholarship

Andrew Stephen Meek Memorial Scholarship
Established in memory of Andrew (Drew) S. Meek who graduated from Macomb Community College in May 2001, with a 3.8 GPA. After barely graduating from high school and dropping out of a community college in Arizona, a belief in himself and motivation from instructors at Macomb propelled Andrew toward achieving academic success. Continuing his education at Michigan State University, Drew graduated Cum Laude with a Bachelor of Science degree in Psychology. Drew eventually became a secondary education teacher in Social Studies where he instilled the value and love of learning in his students. Andrew passed away before ever achieving his full potential. He will always be remembered for his profound, thought-provoking conversations, his love of books, and encouraging others to get an education. This scholarship will be used to assist students who desire a post-secondary education but lack the funds to achieve their educational goals.
minimum GPA 2.0 each semester of award (high school transcript accepted for first year students)
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
provide a 250-word essay describing your financial challenges, why you are deserving of this award and how this award will help you achieve your educational goals
must demonstrate financial need
award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses more...

If no dependents apply then students majoring in Mechanical Engineering or Business Administration will be given consideration. Nonrenewable. more...

Angelo Evangelista Construction Management Endowed Scholarship
The Angelo Evangelista Construction Management Endowed Scholarship was established in memory of Angelo Evangelista, founder of the Tony Angelo Cement Construction Company, by his sons.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a resident of the State of Michigan.

MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward eligibility (e.g., includes students with prior degrees and/or experience in construction/concrete management).

MUST be enrolled full-time or part-time in the Construction Management Program or specific math classes at Oakland Community College (must be enrolled in at least one math class with a course number of MAT 1560 through MAT 1740).

MUST maintain a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA with a 3.0 GPA for any construction class within the curriculum.

MUST describe in writing (1 page) applicant’s interest in Construction Management and future career plans.

MUST be used for tuition and books only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to residents of Oakland County, followed by Wayne County and Macomb County.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate or gradaute students attending Western Michigan University that are majoring in Art. Selection based on academic achievements, minimum 3.5/3.6 GPA and talent. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Ann accepted a position with Oakland Community College during its formative years. She was very dynamic and inspirational, and as a professor she was a caring, dedicated, and a gifted professional educator.

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

Anonymous Endowed Foundation Scholarship
An anonymous donor established this scholarship to recognize scholastic achievement, to encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed between 12 and 90 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have a cumulative 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST demonstrate financial need.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to single heads of households.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Anonymous Geology/Earth Science Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to promote and encourage careers in Geology and Earth Sciences and assist first generation college students and students from underrepresented groups with the costs of their education at Grand Valley State University (GVSU).
Recipients of this scholarship must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the Geology or Earth Science major
*have a 3.5 or higher cumulative GPA in high school, or a cumulative Transfer or GVSU grade point average of 2.5 or greater
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to candidates who are the first in their family to earn a four year degree (First Generation) and/or be a member of underrepresented groups in the fields of Geology or Earth Science
Financial need is considered but not required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication for a maximum of 10 semesters provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. more...

Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards

Arend D. And Nancy Lubbers University Honors College Scholarship
This scholarship was intended to draw exceptional students to the existing University Honors Program or to an Honors College.
Accepted for enrollment in the University Fredrick Meijer Honors College as an entering freshman
Must have a 3.8 cumulative high school grade point average and a 32 ACT composite or 1430 SAT composite
Students meeting the eligibility criteria will be invited to the Presidential Scholarship competition. Scholarships are awarded to students who compete in the scholarship competition
Application Process: Just as the merit scholarships, your admissions application to GVSU serves as your application for this scholarship
Renewable Criteria: Renewable
GPA must be 3.0 at the end of freshman year (earn 25 credits or more), sophomore 3.25 (earn 55 credits or more), junior 3.5 (earn 85 credits or more), senior 3.5 (earn 115 credits or more)
Renewable for a maximum of 5 years (10 semesters) more...

Assistance League Of Southeastern Michigan Scholarship
Established to provide financial assistance for Macomb Community College students who struggle to enter or return to education due to economic hardship, domestic violence, divorce, lack of spousal support, single parenthood, or difficult life-changing transitions. Also considered would be students re-entering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment and those seeking retraining.
• half-time (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
• minimum GPA 2.5 each semester of award
• must submit a 250-word essay describing how this scholarship will help the applicant overcome a challenge or difficult time in their life and how it will help them achieve their educational goals
• award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses excluding room and board
• Prior recipients may re-apply for the award each year, provided the student meets the criteria stated above more...

Assistance League Of Southeastern Michigan Scholarship
Assistance League of Southeastern Michigan is a nonprofit, all-volunteer organization whose mission is to transform the lives of children and adults through community-based programs.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College.

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits.

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher.

MUST demonstrate financial need.

MUST be used for tuition, books and other education expenses (excluding room and board).

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST have struggled to enter or return to education due to economic hardship, domestic violence, divorce, lack of spousal support, single parenthood, or difficult
life-changing transitions; AND/OR be reentering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment; AND/OR be seeking retraining.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater
Have completed two semesters of coursework with the MAT program
Have at least one semester remaining in the MAT program

Autocam Medical Engineering Scholarship
Autocam Medical would like to encourage engineering majors interested in practical engineering and educate young people about the changes in the advanced manufacturing field that have taken place over the last 20 years. By providing scholarship support to students from Michigan who may have limited exposure to manufacturing, they hope to raise awareness among college aged populations about advanced manufacturing and ultimately improve the image of manufacturing that is portrayed in popular culture.
Must be entering your sophomore year at GVSU

Must be enrolled full-time in the Seymour and Esther Padnos College of Engineering and Computing
Must declare a major in either Mechanical Engineering, Product Design & Manufacturing Engineering and/or Interdisciplinary Engineering (with a focus on manufacturing)
Must maintain a cumulative grade point average of 3.2 and be making satisfactory academic progress
Must be a meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards
Renewal Criteria: Renewable
Scholarships will support a sophomore for a total of 3 years (9 semesters)
Finalists will be contacted by faculty and staff of the Engineering Scholarship Committee for an interview, and asked to sign a release to share your resume with Autocam Medical. In addition to the scholarship, Autocam Medical encourages students to apply for internship and co-op opportunities at Autocam Medical. Autocam Medical may contact you about future opportunities with their company. more...

Barbara H. Padnos International Scholarship
The Barbara H. Padnos International Scholars program is intended to support substantive study abroad programs for GVSU undergraduates. Recognizing the benefit that long-term study abroad can provide to students throughout their lifetimes, the Barbara H. Padnos International Scholars program provides opportunities for students to engage in long-term study, thereby acquiring an in-depth understanding of the language, culture, and values of another country. Ideally, Padnos scholars will spend as much time as possible in the host country/culture. Therefore, only students studying abroad for two semesters or an academic year at one location will be considered eligible, with special consideration for students who have a plan to spend more than 10 months abroad (up to and beyond a full calendar year).
The Padnos Scholar selection process is meant to identify the most promising applicants: those who demonstrate great potential for success through study abroad, as well as those who will positively share their year-abroad experience with others.
Student must be full time, degree seeking students attending a full year overseas study program (two semesters, one location)
Student must have earned a minimum of 24 credits by time of application
Students must have a minimum GPA of 3.0
Students must be planning to spend at least two full semesters in the host country/culture, ideally a full calendar year
Students must be happy to be identified in publicity by Padnos International Center as an awardee
Students must be making satisfactory academic progress and working toward a degree
Preference is given to students in the Arts and Humanities
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
Applicants must meet the requirements of the specific study abroad program for which they are applying. Study Abroad programs may have different requirements from the requirements of the Barbara H. Padnos International Scholars program. Awards are contingent on the applicant’s acceptance into a study abroad program that is approved by the Barbara H. Padnos International Center.
Students are encouraged to select a study abroad program carefully, with the assistance of the Barbara H. Padnos International Center staff and Department faculty, so that it will be consistent with academic program requirements at GVSU. more...

Barbara Jewett Endowed Scholarship For Occupational Therapy Students
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Wayne State University who are majoring in Occupational Therapy. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the Department of Occupational Therapy for more information and/or application. more...

Barry Castro Business Ethics Scholarship
This scholarship is intended to aid sophomore students who intend on becoming junior level students at the Seidman College of Business.
Applicants must be students at the sophomore level who anticipate becoming junior level students at the Seidman College of Business beginning with the fall semester following application for this scholarship
First time recipients must be enrolled at Grand Valley State University at the Junior level (55 minimum earned credit hours) with fulltime status in the Seidman College of Business, undergraduate, degree seeking, and must demonstrate a strong interest in business, ethics, and philosophy.
Minimum cumulative grade point of 3.0 and making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the university and the Seidman College of Business
Demonstration of financial need (as defined by filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid- FAFSA) is not required but may be considered for selection
Renewal Criteria: Renewed without reapplication for 1 additional year. If student does not renew then a new candidate will be awarded. more...

Bartholomew F. Fiumano Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Established in memory of Bart Fiumano, a dedicated counselor at Macomb Community College from 1968 to 2007, to provide scholarship assistance to students at Macomb Community College. Bart was committed to helping students throughout their journeys at Macomb: from career and interest exploration, to choosing appropriate coursework, and pursuing employment. He was largely responsible for the development of the Life Career Development Course (currently Life 1010). Through this scholarship, the Fiumano family continues Bart’s legacy of student service, helping students pursue their educational interests while working towards their long-term career goals.
must be enrolled at Macomb Community College
half-time enrollment (6 credit or contact hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
must submit a 250-word autobiographical essay describing career interest and goals, and what inspired these interest and goals
preference given to students wishing to enroll in Life Career Development Courses, or who wish to pursue a career in higher education
award is for tuition, fees, and other educational expenses more...

Barton Malow Annual Scholarship
Barton Malow Company provides construction services throughout North America. The company believes that their progress, success and legacy depends on their good name. An excellent reputation is a differentiating competitive advantage. This scholarship is for students who are pursuing a degree in Construction Management.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 2.5 cumulative credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST be enrolled in one of these degree or certificate programs: Construction Management (CMN.AAS), Construction Management Professional (CMP.AAS), or HVAC Systems Technology (HVA.HVT.AAS,
HVA.HVA.CT, HVA.TES.CA, HVA.AWB.CT, HVA.HVH.CT, HVA.HVR.CT)

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 in their program.

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

This scholarship was established by commercial contractor Barton Malow to provide financial support to a Macomb student studying in a construction-related field. It also provides an opportunity for a full-time paid internship opportunity.
applicant must be enrolled in Construction Technology, Architectural Technology, Land Survey Technology, Civil Technology, or Applied Technology with a preferred interest in commercial construction.
prefer leadership experience amongst peers through on campus activities, sports, community involvement, etc.
half-time enrollment (6 credit or contact hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
award is for tuition, books, and fees
applicant must provide a 250 word essay about what their career goals in a construction related field
If selected, the recipient of award is required to meet the following qualifications for Barton Malow’s internship program:
– drug screening and criminal background check
– available for a minimum of 12 weeks, full-time
– have reliable transportation
– willingness to travel more...

Battle Creek Student Teaching Scholarship
Grand Valley State University’s College of Education and the W.K. Kellogg Foundation have partnered with Battle Creek Public Schools to offer the Battle Creek Public Schools Student Teaching Scholarship. Scholarship funding covers full tuition for up to 16 undergraduate credit hours. Recipients also receive a $4,300 stipend to assist with cost of housing, textbooks, and mileage.
Applicants must:
Full-time undergraduate student
Be interested in Student Teaching in Battle Creek Public Schools.
Be eligible for application to Student Teaching through the College of Education.
Complete a separate application: https://www.gvsu.edu/coe/student-scholarships-44.htm?recordId_1=A83BBE9F-9B52-E3A0-89F0FD2C71C664D4#01FB1215-96ED-BCC0-17A6166C6E32B6C0 more...

Bayliss Scholarship
Scholarship for graduates of a Michigan high school who are sophomores attending Western Michigan University and are majoring in Computer Science. Applicants must have a minimum 2.0 GPA. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Bcps - Health And Teacher Education Pipeline Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to graduates of Battle Creek Central High School who intend to pursue a bachelor’s degree in either Nursing, Health Professions or Teacher Education and encourage recipients to pursue experiential learning and career opportunities in Battle Creek.
These scholarships will include the following for eight semesters of full-time undergraduate study:
-cost of tuition and fees (12-15 credits per semester)
-housing and dining – Traditional-Style Double Room at Grand Valley State University (Kistler, Copeland & Robinson Halls) and 14 meals per week, including $225 dining dollars
-book stipend: Up to $700 per semester
To be eligible students must:
*be graduating seniors from Battle Creek Central High School
*be admitted into Grand Valley State University and enrolled full time (12-15 credit hours per semester)
*demonstrate career goals in Nursing, health Professions or Education and a commitment to pursue experiential learning and career opportunities in Battle Creek when possible
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP). This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 8 semesters. more...

Bdo Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage underrepresented students to join the accounting industry by providing financial assistance to remove barriers to earning a GVSU degree.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU) as an incoming first-year student
*be from an underrepresented group as identified in the essay question
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to students majoring in Accounting who are currently or were previously involved in the West Michigan Accounting Awareness Initiative.
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of eight semesters more...

Be The Change Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist first generation students who have a parent that has previously been or currently incarcerated (defined as time spent in jail or prison). To be eligible for this scholarship recipients must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Be an undergraduate student (including transfer students)
Be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more) in any course of study
Must be making Satisfactory Academic Progress according to the norms established by the University
Preference will be given to students who are the first in their family to earn a four-year degree (first generation)
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of eight (8) semesters. more...

Becker Cpa Course Scholarship
The Becker CPA Course scholarship is awarded to a student who will take the CPA exam within one year that shows potential to excel in passing the examination the first time. Becker Professional Review was established in 1957 and celebrated their 50th anniversary in 2007. The value of the program is $3,393. In 2014, 53 out of 59 Watt Sells winners used Becker to prepare for the CPA exam.
Students must be full-time undergraduates and accounting majors
Must demonstrate good interpersonal skills and continues involvement in the business community
Must have overall GPA of 3.2 and an accounting GPA of 3.5 or higher
Must have completed ACC 310
Application Process: To apply for this scholarship complete the School of Accounting Scholarship Application. more...

Benjamin Mutnick Mettle Award For Hospitality And Tourism Management
This scholarship was established in memory of GVSU HTM Professor, Ben Mutnick (please click donor information below to read more about Professor Mutnick). The purpose of this award is to recognize an HTM student who, like Professor Mutnick, has persevered through and/or overcome challenging or adverse conditions in their own lives while, at the same time, achieving success in the HTM Program. Each award recipient will demonstrate a sincere motivation to succeed, despite such trials and tribulations. Students should note that this award is not limited solely to those individuals who may have overcome severe illness, but is available to those students who endured any significant obstacle with an optimistic aspiration to succeed, despite all odds.
Must have a declared major in Hospitality and Tourism Management
Must be a full-time undergraduate student (12 credits/semester)
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress (2.0 GPA or higher)
Previous recipients of the Benjamin Mutnick Mettle Award are not eligible to apply
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Bennett & Wahlman Endowed Scholarship
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a member in good standing of the OCC Forensic Team.
A member in good standing means:
a. The student meets the eligibility requirements of the National Forensic Association and MISL. (That includes being enrolled at OCC with at least 3 credits. Students who have already received a
Bachelor’s degree is not eligible.)
b. The student participates in 2 to 4 Forensics Tournaments a semester and one fundraising activity a year. The forensic tournament schedule runs during the fall and winter semesters.
c. At each forensic tournament, the student must have at least two fully prepared events.
d. After each tournament, the student & the forensic advisor must discuss changes to the performances/speeches and the student must implement those changes before the next tournament.

MUST be used for tuition or books

MUST fulfill her/his obligation, then s/he may forfeit her/his rights to the monies.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
*Recipients will be selected by the forensic advisor(s) and/or the speech discipline members on the home campus of the forensic team. *
Preference may also be given to students who show financial need.
Preference is given to the students who have previously worked with the OCC Forensic Team, another forensic program, the OCC Performance Studies Festival, or to students who have demonstrated excellence in the field. more...

Berkowitz Scholarship For Students With Disabilities
The purpose of this Scholarship is to provide financial assistance to a GVSU student who is handicapped with a preference for a student whose handicap substantially affects his or her mobility.
Applicants must be currently enrolled as a degree seeking undergraduate student of Grand Valley State University and must have a documented physical or learning disability
Must be a current sophomore, junior or senior with an established GVSU grade point average
Must be at least half-time student
Financial need as determined by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). Financial need will not be the sole factor in determining eligibility.
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship is renewable as long as student makes Satisfactory Academic Progress and reapplies more...

Bill '73 And Jan Anway Athletic Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to annually award a scholarship to any current or former (who have exhausted eligibility) GVSU student-athletes who are majoring in education. This scholarship will cover courses taken in the semester(s) that will not interfere with the players’ athletic program eligibility, including fall, winter or spring/summer semesters, and will assist with degree completion.
To qualify for this scholarship, students must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Be an undergraduate student enrolled for 3 credit hours or more in the College of Education
Student should be making university Satisfactory Academic Progress standards
First preference will be given to those who are/were football players, second preference to basketball players, third preference to any other Laker athlete, and fourth preference to a GVSU club sport participant
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 12 semesters so long as the recipient is on track to earn a degree in education within 6 years of first enrolling at GVSU. more...

Bill And Diana Wipperfurth Annis Water Resources Institute Student Research Scholarship
This scholarship is established to provide educational opportunities to students who are interested in water resources. For this scholarship, the student will be involved in academic research activities under the supervision of faculty or staff at AWRI.
Must be entering their Junior or higher undergraduate or graduate level work with a minimum of 55 earned credits
Must be currently involved in academic activities at the Lake Michigan Center and under the supervision of faculty and staff at the AWRI of GVSU

Must be enrolled full time as a degree seeking student
Must have a 2.75 or higher cumulative grade point average and making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Demonstration of financial need as defined by filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is not required, however indication and explanation of financial need on the application may be considered during selection
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
The recipient of the scholarship is expected to participate on AWRI projects an average of 10 hours per week for 15 weeks during the Fall semester. For more information about AWRI, please visit our web site www.gvsu.edu/wri. more...

Blinkhorn/Donk First Generation Student Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist student from Michigan, who are the first in their families to earn a four year degree, with the costs of a Grand Valley degree, and to encourage and reward students who are on track to graduate in four years. To be eligible, student must:
Be an undergraduate junior or senior at GVSU
Be enrolled for 15 credit hour or more in any course of study
Have a 3.0 GPA or higher
Be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP)
Student must be a permanent resident of the State of Michigan
US citizenship is not required
Preference will be given to students who are the first in their family to earn a four year degree
Financial need may be considered
This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications of the scholarship for a maximum of four semesters. more...

Blinn B. & Barbara Ann Rush Endowed Scholarship
The Blinn B. Rush and Barbara Ann Rush Scholarship is available to an individual with Autism who has successfully met all the requirements for admission to Oakland Community College.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants must provide:
Documentation of status as a person on the autism spectrum;
Documentation of acceptance or attendance at OCC;
A written Letter of Recommendation from someone other than a family member, who is familiar with the individual’s potential to complete the required coursework;
A brief, written description stating your educational goals and reasons for applying for this scholarship (this will be shared with the donors).
Also, applicants:


MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Blue Working Family Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students who graduated from high schools in Michigan who otherwise might not be able to attend and finish college solely because of economic reasons. Recipients shall be known as the Blue Working Family Scholars. To be eligible for this scholarship applicants must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Be new first year students from a Michigan high school
Be an undergraduate enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in any course of study
Be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Preference will be given to students that demonstrate the largest unmet need. Unmet need is the difference between a student’s total cost of attendance and financial aid the student receives, including taking into account the expected family contribution from the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the FAFSA
Renewal Criteria: The scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above and maintain a cumulative 2.3 GPA. This scholarship may be awarded for a maximum of 8 semesters. Recipients will also be required to perform a minimum of ten hours of community service per semester. more...

Boand & Rowe Professional Development Award For Advancement Of Women In Sport & Physical Activity
The purpose of this award is to provide financial support to current GVSU undergraduate or graduate students who are seeking leadership and professional development opportunities relative to supplemental program and project work that relates directly to initiative and the advancement of women in leadership in sport and physical activity.
Must be an undergraduate or graduate student
Must be full-time student
Undergraduate applicants must have completed at least 55 credits
Must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA

Must be meeting satisfactory academic progress
Preference given to those applicants who demonstrate an interest or career goals related tot he advancement of women in leadership in sport and physical activity.
PLEASE NOTE: Award recipients will be required to submit a one-page report at the conclusion of their project reflecting on their experiences and listing the specific learning outcomes that were attained. This report will be uploaded into your myScholarships application at completion of the professional development activity more...

Boand & Rowe Scholarship For Advancement Of Women In Sport & Physical Activity
This scholarship was established to assist current GVSU undergraduate or graduate students for their leadership or involvement in activities to advance women in leadership in sport and physical activity.
Must be an undergraduate or graduate student
Must be full-time student
Undergraduate applicants must have completed at least 55 credits
Must have a 2.5 cumulative GPA

Must be meeting satisfactory academic progress
Preference given to those applicants who demonstrate an interest or career goals related tot he advancement of women in leadership in sport and physical activity.
Financial need is not required but may be considered by completion of the FAFSA
Renewal Criteria: May be renewed with reapplication. more...

Bob Maxey Ford Lincoln Scholarship
Established by Bob Maxey Ford and Bob Maxey Lincoln to provide financial support to Macomb students studying in the Automotive Technology program. Bob Maxey Automotive has three dealerships and wishes to assist students with tuition and offer a gateway into their career in automotive repair at one of our dealerships. The technician career program provides tuition assistance and on the job training from excellent experienced technicians. The scholarship is open to full and part time students.
enrolled in the Automotive Technology Program
minimum GPA 2.5 each semester of award
250-word personal statement to include information about themselves and why they want a career in automotive repair
meet with Bob Maxey Ford/Lincoln to interview for potential open positions
award is for tuition, fees, books and other educational expenses
The Dean of Automotive Technology program will lead the selection process which will include a representative from Bob Maxey Ford/Lincoln. more...

Bob Parks-Mens Track & Field Scholarship

To qualify students must:
*be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU
*be an undergraduate student enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater
*have completed one academic year of employment through the Office of Student Life

Breen Scholarship
The History Department of the Arts and Humanities, GVSU offer an annual Quirinus Breen Prize in honor of Professor Quirinius Breen. This award is for student research essays on historical subjects. Essays may be developed from class assignments or written especially for a particular year’s competition.
Applicants must be enrolled full time
Students must be regularly enrolled in any history courses
To be accepted for the competition, an essay must:
be based on research in primary and/or secondary source
clearly concern itself with historical questions
demonstrate the author’s skills in using historical method
contain no more than 30 pages or less than 10 pages, excluding footnotes and bibliography
Contact Information: Professor Gabriele Gottlieb, gottlieg@gvsu.edu more...

Brooks College Scholarship For Study Abroad
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students with the costs of study abroad programs and to encourage students to seek out study abroad experiences that provide a transformational experience in the classroom and in the community.
Recipients for this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate junior or senior with a declared major or minor in one of the programs offered by Brooks College of Interdisciplinary Studies or a junior or senior in good standing in the Honors College.
Must have completed at least two core courses of the major or minor
Must be meeting satisfactory progress according to the norms established by the University
Preference will be given to students who have been accepted into any faculty-led study abroad program that includes service learning
Financial Need may be considered but is not required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

Must be an undergraduate student

Must meet Satisfactory Academic Progress standards

Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is non-renewable.
Application Process: All students who are studying away will be considered for this scholarship, no application required. more...

Brooks First Generation Diversity Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship is awarded in the spirit with hope that the minority recipients will use their education and a portion of their blessings to positively impact the lives of others.
Candidates must be accepted or currently attending GVSU

First year students must have a high school cumulative GPA of 3.1 or higher and an ACT composite score of at least a 20 or SAT score of at least 1040
Must demonstrate financial need
Must be a full-time student
Candidates must declare their minority status in their response to admissions application form questions regarding their racial/ethnic origins. Multiracial candidates may also qualify for this scholarship. Racial/ethnic origins categories, which qualify, are black/non-Hispanic, Hispanic, American Indian or Aleut, Asian or Pacific Islander
First priority will be given to otherwise qualified students candidates whose familial residence is the greater Holland-Zealand, MI area
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed provided the student continues to meet the qualifications stated above. Renewal candidates shall be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University.
This fund is in compliance with Prop 2-06 because it was established prior to its passing in 2006. At the donors wishes this fund will continue making awards as originally intended, and in return no new gifts to the fund can be accepted. more...

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

Budden Family Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families who do not qualify for federal non-need based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority, and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness, achieve their goals, and become fully engaged citizens. To be eligible:
Recipients must have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate or a graduate student enrolled full-time and admitted to programs within the College of Health Professions or Kirkhof College of Nursing
Have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or greater on a 4.0 scale
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. more...

This scholarship was established by the Forging Industry Educational and Research Foundation to provide financial support to students enrolled in an Engineering or Manufacturing credit or non-credit program applicable to metalworking at Macomb Community College.
minimum GPA 2.5 each semester of award
must be enrolled in an Engineering or Manufacturing credit or non-credit program applicable to metalworking at Macomb Community College including:
Credit programs
o Applied Technology Advanced Processes
o Climate Control Technology
o CAM Technologist
o CNC Machining
o Digital Sculptor (Product Development)
o Machining
o Maintenance Mechanic – Building or Industrial
o Maintenance Technology
o Manufacturing Engineering
o Manufacturing Technology
o Mechatronics
o Millwright
o Mold Maker
o Product Development
o Quality Technology
o Robotics
o Sheet Metal
o Stationary Steam
o Tool & Die
o Welding
Non-credit programs
o Robot Technician
o Maintenance Technician
award is based on merit and does not require student to demonstrate financial need
if selected, the recipient(s) agree to work with Macomb’s Career Services office to successfully complete the following additional donor requirements:
*Fundamental of Forging” online course
*Tour an FIA Member forging plant
awards are renewable for one-year contingent upon the following requirements:
*availability of funds
*student continues to meet eligibility criteria
*student must submit a new scholarship application each year more...

Camille Sneed Memorial Endowed Nursing Scholarship
In May of 2015, Registered Nurse, Camille Sneed, an OCC Nursing graduate passed away unexpectedly. Our goal is to bring a positive light to our nursing community after such a tragic loss. This financial scholarship will be granted to an OCC nursing student for educational expenditures. This fund will not only preserve Camille’s legacy, but it will continue to assist many future OCC nursing students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 20 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST be in the Nursing (NUR.AASX, NUR.RNE.AASX.NUR.TPN.AAS or NUR.AAS) curriculum.

MUST be currently enrolled in at least 4.5 credit hours.

MUST have a minimum 3.0 cumulative grade point average.

MUST write an essay-theme to be determined annually by the Department of Nursing Scholarship Committee.

MUST be used for tuition, books, scrubs and other educational expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Campbell-Williams Endowed Business Scholarship
The intent of this scholarship is to support the education of students from the cities of Flint and Grand Rapids who possess the intellectual capacity and desire to achieve high education but who lack sufficient resources to pursue it.
Freshman candidates must either be accepted for enrollment in the Seidman College of Business at GVSU or have Pre-Business status. Candidates in upper class, undergraduate levels must be accepted for enrollment in Seidman
Candidates’ familial residence must be within the city limits of either Flint or Grand Rapids, Michigan
Entering freshman candidates must have earned a high school GPA of 3.0 or greater. Upper class undergraduate candidates must have earned a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater.
Recipients must be enrolled with full-time status
Must be making satisfactory academic progress
Must annually demonstrate financial need by filing the FAFSA
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided recipients continue to meet the qualifications. Maximum award length is 8 semesters. more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students with financial need who have had volunteer, internship or work experience in program for nonprofit organizations that address women’s issues.
Must be junior, senior or graduate student enrolled full time in School of Public, Nonprofit and Health Administration (SPNHA) and be making satisfactory academic progress
Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
Demonstrate financial need by filing a FAFSA

Demonstrate in writing, commitment to empowering women by describing their career goals and experience working with nonprofit organizations who extend services to women and families
Renewal Criteria: Renewable provided recipient continues to meet the qualifications. May be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

Captain David A. Dreifuss Scholarship
Scholarship for entering freshmen at the University of Michigan-Ann Arbor. Preference will be given to a student whose parent has past or current service in the U.S. Air Force; second preference given to parents service in any U.S. armed forces branch. Applicant must have academic merit. Due date varies. Non-renewable. more...

Captain Robert E.T. Beisel, Jr. Graduate Scholarship

Career Center Internship Award (Fall)
The Career Center of Grand Valley State University established this award to help off-set the costs of working in unpaid internships for students who have demonstrated financial need.
Candidates for this scholarship:
Must file a FAFSA and be accepted to GVSU

Must be a degree seeking student participating in a GVSU approved, credit-bearing, unpaid internship.
To qualify, students must meet criteria required for internship eligibility within their academic department, and must be registered to receive credit for the semester in which they are completing their experience.
Preference will be given to students who intern with non-profit organizations and to those majoring in disciplines that do not require completion of an internship experience.
Be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
General Application must include resume.
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship has multiple opportunities. Please apply for the scholarship posting that aligns with your internship start date:
Fall semester start: Fall application
Winter semester start: Winter application
Spring/Summer semester start: Spring/Summer application
Renewal Criteria: Nonrenewable. Prior recipients may not reapply. more...

Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Eastern Michigan University who are enrolled in the College of Education. Applicants must have financial need. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Carl And Claudia Bajema Grand Rapids Urban Schools Scholarship
Carl and Claudia Bajema created this scholarship in order to provide GRPS graduates who are Grand Rapids residents with the opportunity to access a Grand Valley education.
Recipients of this scholarship must be graduates of GRPS and accepted at GVSU.
Candidates must have at least a 3.5 high school GPA and 24 ACT or 1180 SAT

If the recipient is enrolled for fewer than 12 hours, the award will be prorated.
Transfer students are also eligible for this scholarship if they are graduates of a GRPS high school, residents of Grand Rapids at the time of graduation from the GRPS high school, and meet the high school GPA and ACT score requirements specified above.
Financial need will be considered based on FAFSA.
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to make satisfactory academic progress. more...

Carl And Delores Arendsen Golf Scholarship
This scholarship is designed to assist with degree completion for members of the Laker Golf teams who have exhausted their athletic eligibility.
Must be a member of the Women’s or Men’s Laker Golf teams and enrolled as a degree seeking student.
While all members of the Laker Golf teams are eligible, preference will be given to members who have exhausted their athletic eligibility
Must have not completed their undergraduate education.
Candidates with athletic eligibility must be enrolled full time unless an NCAA exception to full time status is applicable.
Candidates that have exhausted their athletic eligibility may be working towards degree completion part-time or full time.
Recipients must be making satisfactory academic progress
Application Process: No formal application required, scholarship is awarded by coach nomination.
Renewal Criteria: Renewed without application until degree completion, provided the recipient continues to meet the initial qualifications. more...

Students must have financial need, exhibit good character, and citizenship. An essay and a photo must be included with application packet. Nonrenewable. Contact students guidance counselor or the Foundation for more information and/or application. more...

Carl Erickson And Mary O'neill Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for senior engineering, computer science, and nursing students from middle income families who do not qualify for federal need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness, achieve their goals, and become fully engaged citizens.
To be eligible, recipients of this scholarship must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
Be an undergraduate student entering their final year before graduation
Be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more) in engineering, computer science, or nursing
Be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP) according to the norms established by the University and the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Carlson Family Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist a student in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences with the cost of their education. Preference will be given to students who are first in their family to attend college.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to students who are first in their family to attend college.
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Carney Herndon Endowed Scholarship
The Carney Herndon Endowed Scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students pursuing a Culinary degree.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum 2.5 gpa

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST be a resident of Oakland or Wayne counties

MUST be enrolled in Culinary Arts program

MUST specify Orchard Ridge as home campus

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Carol Mclaughlin Career Scholarship
Established for students pursuing a career after completion of a two-year program. It was established by Carol McLaughlin, a Macomb Community College alum, who earned an Associate Degree and then began a career in Financial Management at Shelby Township. Mrs. McLaughlin is a committed volunteer for the Shelby Township Beautification Committee and an advocate for beautification and environmental projects.
enrolled in an Engineering and Advanced Technology, Nursing, Veterinary Technician or other two-year program that enables the student to begin a career after completion. Particularly in-demand areas including welding, machining, design, robotics, and mechatronics
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.5 each semester of award
demonstrate financial need
applicant must provide a 250-word essay on their goals, career path, and service to the community. Special consideration will be given to applicants who have had involvement in beautification or environmental projects
a letter of recommendation from a teacher, mentor, or supervisor must be included
recipients are asked to write a thank-you letter to the donor more...
