Cathy & Robert Raffle Annual Scholarship
*Criteria *
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
• MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College
• MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits
• MUST have a declared program of study
• MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher
• MUST demonstrate financial need
• MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor
• CAN reapply for the award each semester, provided they continue to meet all criteria
• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
• MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
• MUST be diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder or other Learning Disabilities. Proof of diagnosis or designation may be required.
• MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. citizen
• MUST be a resident of Oakland County
Keyword: ACCESS more...

You must be pursuing a clear educational goal in any undergraduate, graduate or professional program, full or part time, at any campus. Centerplate Annual Scholarship
Centerplate is the exclusive caterer for the Cobo Center in Detroit. At gathering places across North America and the United Kingdom, Centerplate and its partner venues have been defining extraordinary experiences through thoughtful hospitality, expertly delivered, for more than 80 years. They partnered with OCC’s Culinary Studies Institute (CSI) to provide a career path to residents of the City of Detroit interested in the Culinary Arts. This scholarship recognizes scholastic achievement, encourages continued progress, and provides financial assistance to Detroiters studying at the CSI.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST be working toward a credential in Culinary Arts or Hospitality (CUL.AASX, CUL.BPA.CT, CUL.HMM.AAS, or CUL.RMP.AAS)

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if the recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

The Cervantes-Paramo Scholarship was established because education has always been a priority among the donors’ families.
Criteria
To be eligible for this scholarship, applicants:
MUST have completed 12 credit hours or more at OCC.

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership through written documentation of volunteer activities.

MUST NOT be eligible for Pell Grants.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who designate Auburn Hills as “home campus.”
Preference will be given to students who are from Spanish-speaking households.
Preference will be given to residents of the City of Pontiac. more...

Chad E. Nyitray Scholarship
Providing scholarship (s) to a full-time (at least 12 billable contact hours per semester) student who is a resident of Monroe County or Washtenaw County, Michigan and United States citizen. Applicant must be enrolled in a business-related transfer program to obtain a bachelor’s degree in business. Preference will be given to an Ida High School, Ida, Michigan graduate. Applicant must have a 3.0 or higher GPA and financial need may be considered. Letter of recommendation from the high school counselor must accompany the application. more...

Chad L. Stoner Medical Research Scholarship
To provide an annual scholarship for a transfer student interested in pursuing a career in medical research. Student pursuing an associate of science degree with coursework emphasis in biological sciences, chemical sciences, or physical sciences. Student must have a minimum 3.2 GPA to apply and carry a 3.0 GPA or higher during the scholarship year. Student must be planning to transfer to a four-year college or university to earn a degree in a discipline area that prepares them for a career in medical research. Must be a full-time student defined at twelve (12) billable contact hours per semester with a minimum of 24 credit hours earned from MCCC prior to applying for scholarship. Applicant must submit a one page essay outlining why they are interested in medical research. Financial aid may be considered. Scholarship may not be used to re-take courses at MCCC. more...

Challenge Scholars
To qualify as incoming freshman students must:
completed application for admission no later than December 31 of the senior year at Union High School
have a cumulative GPA of 3.3 & ACT of 21
fulfilled the requirements of the Challenge Scholars program
file a FAFSA by March 1 of the senior year including GVSU school code
renewable for three additional years by maintaining Satisfactory Academic Progress and a 2.5 CGPA.
need is taken into consideration.
To qualify as a Transfer students must:
completed application for admission no later than December 31 of the second year at Grand Rapids Community College – before the planned fall semester enrollment at GVSU

cumulative GPA 2.5 and a minimum of 30 semester hours earned at GRCC at the time of application review
fulfilled the requirements of the Challenge Scholars program through the Union High School pipreline
file a FAFSA by March 1 including GVSU school code
renewable for one additional year by maintaining Satisfactory Academic Progress and a 2.5 CGPA

need is taken into consideration more...

Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and be members of the student chapter of Society of Plastics Engineers or professional and leadership organizations on or off campus. Due date may vary. Contact the College of Technology for more information. more...

Provides tuition assistance to students in the Macomb Culinary Institute.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award

award is for tuition and educational expenses

Chemistry Undergraduate Scholarship Fund
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Wayne State University who are majoring in Chemistry. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Number of awards may vary. more...

Cheryl Barnhard First Generation Chemistry Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage and assist students who are the first in their family to earn a four year degree.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate student enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*have a declared major in chemistry
*have a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
Preference will be given to students who are first in their family to earn a four year degree (first generation).
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship is not automatically renewable. Previous recipients are eligible to reapply and if selected can receive the scholarship for up to a maximum of four semesters. more...

Cheryl Feinberg Memorial Endowed Scholarship
In memory of Cheryl Feinberg who loved reading and aspired to be a writer.
This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward achieving their educational goals. It will be administered according to the following provisions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
• MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits
• MUST have a declared program of study
• MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher
• MUST demonstrate financial need
• MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor
• CAN reapply for the award each semester, provided they continue to meet all criteria
• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
• MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
• MUST be enrolled in English or Humanities course (ENG 1610 – ENG2800, HUM1510 – HUM2720) more...

Chi Omega Alumnae Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Adrian College who are Mu Zeta Chi Omega members. Selection based on academic achievement, minimum 3.0 GPA, contribution to the society and potential. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. more...

Chicago Automobile Trade Association Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students enrolled full-time at Northwood University-Florida majoring in Automotive Marketing. Preference given to Chicago Automobile Trade Association employees and children of employees of dealerships in the Chicago Automobile Trade Association. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Chief Gerald B. Alward Scholarship For The Fire Academy
This scholarship was established in honor of Fire Chief, Gerald B. Alward, for his 50 years of service to the Washington Township Fire Department, the Macomb County community, Macomb Community College, and the state of Michigan. Chief Alward was instrumental in the development of the fire program at Macomb Community College. His dedication to public safety and compassion to the community he served, and those who served with him, set the bar for future fire fighters and community leaders. This scholarship will continue Chief Alward’s legacy by helping train future fire fighters to serve and protect within their communities.
resident of Macomb county
enrolled full-time or part-time in the Fire Academy
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
award is for tuition, fees, and other educational expenses
a 250-word biography describing applicant’s educational and career goals
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://macomb.academicworks.com/opportunities/flexible.html" more...

Children Of Christian Academy Employee Discount
The Children of Christian Academy Employee Discount is available to first time students under age 24 at Rochester College. Your parent must be employed full-time at an accredited Christian High School to be eligible for this award. more...

Children Of Minister's Discount - Rochester College
The Children of Minister's Discount is available to first time students at Rochester College who are the dependent children of ministers. You must be under age 24 and reside in an RC residence hall to be eligible for this award. more...

Children's Enrichment Center Student Parent Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance for childcare costs for those families with at least one parent or legal guardian pursuing a degree at GVSU. Recipients will receive reduced weekly childcare rates as demonstrated by financial need. This scholarship will remove childcare related obstacles for student families progressing towards academic success.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be enrolled as a full time student
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is not automatically renewable but applicants may reapply. Maximum award of 4 semesters provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. more...

Chinese Study Abroad Scholarship
In this highly connected and competitive world, college graduates with global knowledge and understanding and direct overseas experience are very well sought after. Although we teach language, history and culture of a country in a certain course, there is nothing that can compare to the value of first-hand experience and knowledge that are gained through traveling abroad.
However, overseas travel can be costly and, therefore, daunting, particularly for our two-year college students, a greater part of whom come from mid and low-income families. Thus, proving financial assistance to this group of students in this endeavor is important to alleviate the financial difficulty associated with traveling so that these students have an equal chance at direct overseas experience to remain competitive in the future job market.
In addition to the criteria listed in the application, students must be enrolled full- or part-time and MUST show proof of acceptance into a study abroad program in China approved by the Global Education Committee.
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
• MUST have completed a minimum of six (6) credit hours of instruction at OCC. Transfer credit hours count toward the maximum eligibility.
• MUST be a U.S. Citizen.
• MUST be at least 18 years old.
• MUST be enrolled full- or part-time.
• Must have completed a Chinese language class at a college (e.g. CHI 1510 at OCC) with a passing grade or otherwise demonstrate beginning knowledge of Chinese.
• MUST show proof of acceptance into a study abroad program in China approved by the Global Education Committee.
• MUST have a GPA of 2.5 or higher.
• MUST demonstrate financial need as determined by Student Financial Resources & Scholarships.
• MUST submit a one- to two-page personal statement that address the following questions: _What is your educational and/or life goal? What are the specific objectives you hope to achieve through traveling to
China? How is this travel experience going to contribute to your educational/life goal? _
• MUST provide contact information of one OCC faculty member to serve as a personal and academic reference.
• MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.
Preference will be given to residents of Oakland County. more...

Christopher Stoddard Memorial Scholarship
It is a pleasure to inform you that you have been chosen to receive the Christopher Stoddard Memorial Scholarship. This scholarship covers tuition, fees, supplies and books. Please click the details tab to view the offered amount and a description of the scholarship’s eligibility requirements. Once you accept this scholarship you will be directed to the post-acceptance questions page. This page is required, and will be used to complete your press release as well as the scholarship announcement to your donor.
The scholarship you received was funded through donations from private donors. These are individuals who support our students’ academic endeavors because they truly believe in the Mission of the College and they want to help individuals accomplish their academic and career goals.
A thank you note letting the donor(s) know what receiving the scholarship means to you is required as an upload. However, if you wish, you may also mail it to The Foundation at MCCC, 1555 S. Raisinville Rd., Monroe, MI 48161.
Finally, the Foundation office hosts’ a Scholarship Recognition Dinner at the end of August. Please look for your invitation which will be mailed to you with instructions on RSVPing.
Congratulations on receiving this scholarship! Please contact the financial aid office at (734) 384-4135 if you have any questions. more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students in the Physician Assistant Studies program during their year-long clinical phase.
Recipients of this scholarship must:
Be enrolled at GVSU in the College of Health Professions Physician Assistant Studies Program and accepted in to clinical phase 2
Enrolled for 9 credit hours or more
Have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or greater on a 4.0 scale
Preference will be given to nontraditional students
Financial need may be considered but not required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is non-renewable more...

Entering freshmen must have a 2.7 cumulative high school GPA

Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. The scholarship may be awarded for a maximum of eight (8) semesters. more...

Claudia Bajema Graduate Fellowship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist talented Seidman College of Business graduate students with the costs of earning a graduate degree in business. To receive this scholarship:
Recipients must be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be a graduate student with at least two years of post-baccalaureate full-time professional work experience
Must be enrolled in the Seidman College of Business
Preference will be given to students pursing an MBA
Financial need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above and maintain a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of eight (8) semesters. more...

Clifford & Jeanne Benson Endowed Scholarship
The Clifford & Jeanne Benson Endowed Scholarship was established in honor of the donor’s parents, who provided for an excellent education for her and her siblings.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours on transcript at Oakland Community College.

MUST have Royal Oak/Southfield as home campus.

MUST have a minimum 2.0 cumulative grade point average.

MUST demonstrate financial need (as determined by the OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships).

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST use awards for tuition and other educational expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to working parents & others with special circumstances.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Established by the Charter Township of Clinton Police Department Honor Guard to assist law enforcement students in accomplishing their educational goals at Macomb Community College.
preference given to Clinton Township residents, or to Macomb County residents
must have a law enforcement degree or be obtaining a law enforcement degree in the near future
500-word essay describing their professional goals. Any military experience should be included in the essay, along with a copy of discharge papers. If you are currently serving in the reserves, please include this information in the essay
letter of recommendation from an instructor or professional in the law enforcement field required
award is for tuition, fees and books

Club Of Greater Flint Student Research Fund
Scholarship for undergraduate students atending the University of Michigan-Flint. Applicants must have completed a minimum of 55 credit hours. Candidates must complete a student research application form and submit a written statement outlining proposed research project: its goals, value, progress to-date, and any other potential funding sources. Applicants must submit a letter of recommendation from a UM-Flint faculty member sponsoring the student research. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Clyde Harnack Endowed Firefighter Scholarship
Clyde Harnack was a mentally challenged resident of Royal Oak who always wanted to be a firefighter. Clyde had the highest regard for the fire service. He volunteered his time and energy to the Royal Oak fire department and the local community throughout his lifetime. Upon his tragic death in 1991, his friends started the scholarship to honor his memory and continue his legacy.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a citizen of the United States

MUST be at least 18 years of age

MUST be accepted in the Fire Fighter Technology Academy (FFT.AAS or FFT.CA)

MUST be a High School graduate or have a GED equivalent

MUST have a felony free conviction record

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST meet specific physical requirements:
The applicant must possess normal hearing and visual functions with acuity in each eye correctable to 20/20.
Is free from any impediment of the senses, physically sound, in possession of extremities and well developed physically, with height and weight in relation to each other as indicated by acceptable medical standards.
Is free from any physical defects, chronic diseases, organic diseases, organic or functional conditions, or mental instabilities which may tend to impair functional performance of duty or which may endanger the lives of others or him/herself.
Proof of a completed Physical report must be submitted in writing, and indicate that the physician realizes what type of physical activity the candidate will be undertaking during the Academy.


MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

The CMU Outstanding High School Student Scholarship is automatically awarded to all high school seniors who rank first or second in their high school class and plan to attend Central Michigan University. This award is renewable for three consecutive years, provided you maintain a GPA of 3.25 or higher and continuous full-time enrollment. more...

College Of Liberal Arts And Sciences Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences with the cost of a Grand Valley degree. The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences will award scholarships that help meet their strategic goals that may include recruiting, retaining and recognizing outstanding students in any of their academic programs.
Recipients for this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate and enrolled for 6 credit hours or more in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences—any course of study
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is non-renewable. more...

College Of Nursing Alumni Graduate Scholarship

Colliers International Scholarship
This scholarship was created to assist business students pursing degrees in marketing, economics, finance and entrepreneurship. To qualify for this scholarship students must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Be an undergraduate and enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the Seidman College of Business and shall be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University.
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate an entrepreneurial spirit by the creation of their own business, or plan to establish one in the future

Colonel Charles E. Bayliss Scholarship

Combined Degree Scholarship Program (Cdsp): A National Science Foundation (Nsf) Project Application For Phase 1
The Combined Degree Scholarship Program (CDSP) at Grand Valley State University (GVSU) provides scholarships to high-achieving, low-income students to complete both their Bachelor’s and Master’s in Engineering in a compressed timeline. The scholarship program consists of two components: extensive extracurricular support and financial support ($10,000/year) for last two years of the program. This particular application is for joining the cohort to enjoy the benefits highlighted below. Following this, there will be a selective process to identify CDSP scholars. In addition to the financial support, these scholars will then enjoy the various benefits from high impact structures such as faculty mentoring, cohort immersion, peer mentoring, experiential learning, research activities, targeted workshops, and leadership shadowing of industry senior managers.
Benefits:
*Eligible to apply for $20,000 via CDSP once accepted into graduate program
*Extensive individualized mentoring by faculty member
*Peer mentored by current graduate students
*Supported innovative projects with fellow cohort members
Requirements:
*Be enrolled full-time as an undergraduate engineering student at GVSU
*Have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater
*Been granted secondary admit status
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Combined Degree Scholarship Program (Cdsp): A National Science Foundation (Nsf) Project Application For Phase 2.
The Combined Degree Scholarship Program (CDSP) at Grand Valley State University (GVSU) provides scholarships to high-achieving, low-income students to complete both their Bachelor’s and Master’s in Engineering in a compressed timeline. The scholarship program consists of two components: extensive extracurricular support and financial support ($10,000/year) for last two years of the program. This particular application is for phase 2 and is only available to those students who have been part of Phase 1. Successful admission into Phase 2 unlocks the various benefits mentioned below:
Benefits:
*$20,000 in scholarship via CDSP once accepted into graduate program
*Extensive individualized mentoring by faculty member
*Peer mentored by current graduate students
*Targeted seminars and workshop to enhance professional development
*Research activities and conference participation/attendance
*Leadership shadowing of industry senior managers
*Experiential learning
Requirements:
*Admitted to the graduate school
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Community Leadership Scholarship
This scholarship is intended to advance new generations of business leaders and community philanthropists.
Demonstration of financial need is not required.
Candidates must give evidence of significant community service performed while a college student at GVSU as well as their desire to be engaged in community service throughout their lives
Recipients must be a junior or senior
Recipients must be enrolled full time at GVSU

Recipients must provide two or more letters of recommendations from individuals familiar with your community involvement. One letter of recommendation must be from a GVSU faculty Member from the candidates’ academic major and one letter from someone not directly associated with the University.
Recipients must be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Submission of the resume in the general application is required for this scholarship
Honors, awards and extracurricular activities will be taken into consideration
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

Applicants must have made contributions to improve the quality of campus life through their participation in campus activities and student organizations. Candidates must have attended OU for one year, have a minimum 2.5 GPA and carry 12 credits for each semester the award is received. Number of awards varies. Nonrenewable; may reapply. more...

Computer Science And Information Systems Academic Scholarship
Academic Scholarships will be awarded to Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology and Cybersecurity majors to honor those students for their outstanding performance and to encourage them to continue in the field of Computer Science or Information Systems at his/her level of excellence.
Candidates must be second-admitted into either the Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology or Cybersecurity majors
Candidates must have at least 45 credit hours completed at the time of application
Candidates must have completed at least 14 credit hours in the major (excluding cognates) at Grand Valley State University and be enrolled in at least one course in Computer Science or Information Systems at the time of application
Candidates must be returning to GVSU, as a full-time student, the following fall semester and is expected to take at least one Computer Science or Information Systems course that academic year
Candidates must have an overall GPA of 3.2 or better
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

Computer Science And Information Systems Study Abroad Scholarship
Scholarships are available to CS and IS majors who study abroad at an institution of higher learning in another country. The purpose of the scholarship is to provide students with greater opportunities in their study of computer science or information systems.
Eligibility:
•Must be a CS or IS major
•Must plan to study abroad during the next academic year
•Have 45 credit hours completed
•Have 14 credit hours in the major completed at GVSU
•Have a GPA of 3.2 overall or better
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

minimum high school GPA of 2.5 (high school transcript required)
award is for tuition and fees
St. Clair Shores resident
selection based on financial need and commitment to a career in law enforcement or fire science
renewable, based on application and funds available
essay on why applicant wants to go into the profession of law enforcement or fire science
one recipient chosen from each of the three school districts in St. Clair Shores (South Lake, Lakeshore and Lakeview)
cannot be related to police or fire personnel
must maintain 3.0 GPA, maintain a clean driving record and have no criminal history while in the program
selection will be made by the Macomb Community College Public Service Institute

Crowe Llp Strive For Progress Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage underrepresented students to join the accounting industry by providing financial assistance to remove barriers to earning a GVSU degree.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*must be from an underrepresented group identified in the essay question
*be an undergraduate student enrolled at least part-time
First priority will be given to students currently or previously involved in the West Michigan Accounting Awareness Initiative. If no students with an affiliation to West Michigan Accounting Awareness Initiative apply, preference will be given to students who have a declared major in one of the following programs: accounting, management with management information systems emphasis, or supply chain management with a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or greater.
Financial need may be considered and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Curtis A. Cryderman Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship in the Automotive Technology Program was established to help students with a passion for automobiles similar to that of Curtis Allen Cryderman (1963 – 2004). With innate talent honed by personal hands-on application, academic course work, and on-the-job training and experience, Curt excelled at auto body work/refinishing of new and classic cars. And, true to his Studebaker family automotive heritage, Curt typically “Gave More Than He Promised”, according to his mother, scholarship creator and MCC alumnus, Sandra A. Studebaker.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) in the Automotive Technology Program, Product Design, Machining or Digital Sculptor Program each semester of award
minimum GPA of 2.5 or higher each semester of award
applicants must explain their passion for the automotive industry with an essay (up to 250 words) and should include photos of their work that they are most proud of
award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses more...

Be a junior, senior or graduate student athlete

Department of Music scholarships are awarded on the basis of achievement and potential in music and dance performance (by audition).

Daniel W. Doidge Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Daniel W. Doidge graduated from OCC in April, 1989 in liberal Arts. He transferred to the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, and completed a bachelor’s degree in psychology. As part of his course work at Michigan, he began internships and work experience in early childhood education. He loved children and especially enjoyed working with preschoolers. Following graduation, he worked in several different early childhood education centers in southeast Michigan until his untimely death in 2007.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST a demonstrated cumulative minimum GPA of 3.0


MUST be enrolled in the Early Childhood Education (ECE.AAS or ECD.AAS)

MUST a demonstrated financial need (as determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to non-traditional student enrolled in ECE.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Danny K. Phipps Music Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to recognize and reward students who are pursuing a bachelor’s degree in music education who demonstrate exceptional leadership, character, and potential.
To qualify, students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU
*be an undergraduate senior enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the Music and/or Music Education Program
*be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP)
*preference will be given to students utilizing the Disability Support Resources at GVSU
Financial need may be considered but is not required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal: May be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above for a total award of 4 semesters. more...

Daughters Of The American Revolution Scholarship, John Sackett Chapter
The Daughters of the American Revolution (DAR) is a lineage-based membership service organization for women who are directly descended from a person involved in the United States’ struggle for independence.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 3.0 credit hours at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA


MUST be enrolled full-time (minimum 12 credit hours per semester)

MUST specify Royal Oak, Orchard Ridge or Southfield as your “home” campus

MUST demonstrate financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be a U.S. citizen

MUST be used for tuition only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Dave Hamilton Construction Management Endowed Scholarship
The Dave Hamilton Endowed scholarship was named in honor of Dave Hamilton, retired President of Auch Construction. Mr. Hamilton established the scholarship to encourage students to pursue a degree in Construction Management.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST be enrolled in Construction Management (CMS.AAS) program or Math courses required for Construction Management degree (MAT1560 through MAT1740)

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership (Requires written documentation of demonstrated skills; either an essay, résumé, or letter(s) of recommendation)

MUST demonstrate financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST be used for tuition only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students in the Construction Management program (CMN.AAS).
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if the recipient still meets the criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

David G. And Mary L. Annis Education Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to benefit students who desire to enter the teaching profession.
This scholarship is open to all qualifying freshmen who demonstrate financial need and who will be enrolled full-time.
Priority will be given to candidates who are graduates of Allendale, White Pigeon, Forest Hills and Northview school districts.
Renewal Criteria: Renewable for a total of 9 semesters if students maintain 2.5 GPA in sophomore year and maintain a 2.7 or better in junior year and beyond. Also, Junior and Senior level renewing recipients must demonstrate their intention to pursue credentialing to become elementary or secondary teachers by applying to and being accepted to GVSU College of Education more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to benefit students who desire to enter the teaching profession after previously earned degrees in other fields and who may have also had prior non-teaching careers.
Must be admitted into the Graduate Teacher Certification program
Must be enrolled full-time student in the graduate M.Ed. program
Must file the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA), and demonstrate financial need

REQUIRED: You must upload a resume through the general application for this scholarship
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
Review Committee: College of Education more...

David Randall Endowed Math Scholarship
The David Randall Endowed Math Scholarship was established to honor the memory of the long-time faculty member, donor, and mentor to OCC students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum demonstrated GPA of 2.5


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition only.

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to students who have successfully completed two or more math classes (courses numbered 1150 or above) and/or who are declared math majors.
Preference given to students who have submitted a letter of recommendation from a Highland Lakes math faculty member.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

David W. Elliott Memorial Foundation Annual Scholarship
David W. Elliott was a local business owner who died of kidney failure. Elliott said he gained a great appreciation for the nursing profession while being treated for kidney disease and wanted to support the education and training of future nurses.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST be working toward a degree in Nursing (NUR.APP or NUR.TPN.APP)

MUST be in good academic standing

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by Student Financial Resources and Scholarships

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Delta Kappa Gamma Society Scholarship - Beta Eta Chapter
The local chapter of Delta Kappa Gamma, Beta Eta, is comprised of women educators – working and retired – from the Clarenceville and Farmington Public Schools. This scholarship was established to provide financial assistance to students who struggle to enter or return to education due to circumstances as domestic violence, divorce, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, single parenthood, and difficult life-changing transitions. Students who are reentering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment due to family circumstances such as caring for children or aging parents.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have struggled to enter or return to education due to circumstances such as domestic violence, divorce, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, single parenthood, and difficult life-changing transitions.
Students who are reentering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment due to family circumstances such as caring for children or aging parents.

MUST be a U.S. citizen.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have a cumulative GPA 2.5 or higher

MUST designate Oakland Community College, Orchard Ridge as their home campus.

MUST demonstrate financial need (as determined by the OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships).

MUST be used for tuition, books or other educational expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Delta Sigma Theta Sorority - Lambda Pi Chapter Fortitude Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide monetary support to further the educational aspirations of undergraduate and graduate women that are actively enrolled at GVSU (this includes online students).
To qualify, students must:
*be an undergraduate or graduate student enrolled full or part time
*be enrolled in any course of study
*have a cumulative grade point average of 2.75 or higher
*be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP): https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
*Preference will be given to candidates who have overcome one or more obstacles to pursue a four-year degree
*Additional consideration will be given to candidates who are women of color, first generation, from single parent households, have one or more incarcerated parents, or who have experienced foster care or placements with a family member or other guardian, or applicants from major urban cities with histories of socio-economic challenges
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

Delta Sigma Theta Sorority - Lambda Pi Chapter Legends Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide monetary support to further the educational aspirations of undergraduate and graduate women that are actively enrolled at GVSU (this includes online students).
To qualify you must:
*be an undergraduate or graduate student enrolled part time or full time
*be enrolled in any course of study
*have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or greater
*be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP): https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
*Preference will be given to candidates with, or connection to, a member of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority and/or Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Lambda Pi Chapter.
*Additional consideration will be given to candidates who are women of color, first generation from single parent households, have one or more incarcerated parents, or who have experienced foster care or placement with a family member, or other guardian or applicants from major urban cities with histories of socio-economic challenges.
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Delta Sigma Theta Sorority - Lambda Pu Chapter Founder's Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide monetary support to further the educational aspirations of undergraduate and graduate women that are actively enrolled at GVSU (this includes online students).
To qualify, students must:
*be enrolled full or part time at Grand Valley State University in any course of study
*have a cumulative grade point of 2.75 or greater
*be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP): https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
*Preference will be given to candidates who demonstrate a commitment to community service at GVSU and in the community
*Additional consideration will be given to candidates who are women of color, first generation, from single parent households, have one or more incarcerated parents, who have experienced foster care or placement with a family member or other guardian, or applicants from major urban cities with histories of socio-economic challenges.
*Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Dennis Toffolo Emerging Sectors Endowed Scholarship
Dennis Toffolo brought foresight and planning skills to Michigan’s economic development initiatives as deputy county executive for Oakland County. To honor his life and his memory, his friends, colleagues, and family members have established the this scholarship for students enrolled in an Emerging Sectors program.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST be enrolled in an Emerging Sectors degree or certificate program (see below)

MUST have financial need

MUST be a resident of Oakland County

MUST use for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
The Dennis Toffolo Endowed Scholarship will provide financial assistance to students at Oakland Community College pursuing such emerging sector fields as:
• Advanced Electronics and Controls
• Advanced Materials and Chemicals
• Alternative Energy and Power Generation
• Automotive Research and Development
• Biotechnology
• Communications and Information Technology
• Homeland Security
• Medical Devices and Instrumentation
• Micro technology/Nanotechnology
• Robotics and Automation
• Film Industry Training Program
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Scholarship for graduating seniors from a Detroit, Michigan high school who will be undergraduate students attending Wayne State University. Selection based on academic achievement, financial need and potential. Students must file the FAFSA. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Detroit Promise Scholarship
The four-year Detroit Promise is a last dollar funding program for students who live in the city of Detroit and will graduate from any Detroit high school in 2017. It provides Detroit youth a tuition-free path to a bachelor’s degree at a number of four-year universities in the state of Michigan.
Eligibility requirements:
Reside in the city of Detroit from ninth grade through 12th grade
Attend for all four years and graduate from any Detroit high school: DPS, EAA, charter, private, parochial, home school, etc. Students who have attended multiple Detroit high schools are eligible
Must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA as of Monday, Feb. 1 of senior year
Must have a minimum score of 21 ACT/1060 SAT as of senior year (can re-test through Feb.)
Meet college or university admission requirements more...

Detroit Symphony Orchestra-Bradlin Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students attending Wayne State University who are majoring in Music with an emphasis in orchestral instruments. Selection based on talent and potential. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Devon Smiley Legacy Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students who have experienced the loss of a sibling.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards
Preference given to students pursing a teaching degree, especially those with an emphasis in Special Education or those engaged in University-sponsored study abroad experience
Financial need is not required.
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed more...

Diane & Lyle Victor Hvac/R Systems Technology Endowed Scholarship
This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward achieving their educational goals. It will be administered according to the following provisions.
Criteria:
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
• MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits
• MUST have declared HVAC/R System Technology as a program of study (HVA.HVC.CT, HVA.TES.CA, HVA.AWB.CT, HVA.HVH.CT, HVA.HVH.CT, HVA.HVT.AAS, HVA.HVR.CT)
• MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher
• MUST demonstrate financial need
• MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor
• CAN reapply for the award each semester, provided they continue to meet all criteria
• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
Preference will be given to parents with children at home from Oakland and Wayne counties. more...

Award recognizes the importance of a diverse workforce in the field of MIS and the central role played by the School of Business Administration in preparing highly skilled MIS graduates. Due date varies. more...

The award is to recognize students striving towards academic achievement in various academic programs and is awarded to new or continuing education students attending Macomb Community College.
must be enrolled in at least one class (credit or non-credit) at Macomb Community College
incoming high school graduates or equivalent and transfer students are eligible
50-100-word essay stating how this scholarship will impact their life

GPA is NOT required for first time applicants; award reapplication each year provided applicant has minimum GPA of 2.5 or higher
preference given to graduates or former students of Mt. Clemens School District
letter of recommendation optional
award is for tuition, fees, books other educational expenses more...

Disabled American Veterans Chapter 137 Scholarship
To be used for tuition, fees, books and supplies. Applicant must be a Monroe County, Michigan resident, a United States citizen, maintain at least a 2.5 GPA and be a veteran or the child of a veteran. The veteran must have received an honorable discharge and submit a copy of their DD-214. Preference will be given in or to: 1. A disabled veteran, 2. the child or spouse of a disabled veteran, 3. a veteran with financial need. 4. the child of a veteran or 5. the grandchild of a disabled veteran. more...

Distinguished Albion Scholars are selected from among Trustee Scholarship awardees. more...

Dom Polski Cultural Center Scholarship

Don & Margie Arsen Endowed Scholarship(2)
Mr. Donald H. (Don) & Mrs. Marjorie (Margie) Arsen are long-serving educators and civic boosters in Waterford Township and southeast Michigan.
Don and Margie are graduates of Central Michigan University. Beginning in 1949 through his retirement in 1985, Don was a teacher, counselor, elementary principal, and director of adult education in the Waterford Schools. He is also a past president of the Jaycees-Waterford Chapter, a member of the Waterford Rotary, and served as an officer of the Waterford Education Association. He served for over 30 years as a board trustee of the Waterford Foundation for Public Education, which he helped launch in 1984. Margie was a pioneer at the Stepanski Early Childhood Center, where she taught for 23 years. She retired in 1983, and passed away at the age of 92 in March 2019.
Don numbers among the Founders of Oakland Community College. In 1964, he volunteered for and financially supported the Community College Citizens Committee. The Committee worked successfully to put the creation and funding of OCC on the countywide ballot. He also stood for election to its first Board of Trustees. He and his family tirelessly canvassed and spoke in support of creating the College.
Together, Don and Margie have worked on and established important programs to advance education. These included Teacher of the Year; Select 50, honoring 25 seniors from Waterford Kettering and Waterford Mott high schools; the Margie Arsen Early Childhood Education Fund; the Globetrotters project, rewarding the most improved students at a Detroit public school; and a program to honor the top 10 students at Waterford Durant High School.
This endowed scholarship is established in celebration of the Arsens’ lifelong commitment to advancing our community through education. more...

Don & Marie Huey Memorial Fund
The Don and Marie Huey scholarship was established as a memorial to Don & Marie Huey. Mr. Huey was an accountant and controller and Mrs. Huey was a bookkeeper. The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to a student in the accounting curriculum.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled in the Accounting (ACC.GA.CT or ACC.ABA) certificate or degree program.

MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST be a U.S. citizen or eligible non-U.S. citizen.

MUST have a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA


MUST explain in writing why they have chosen to major in accounting and articulate their future goals.

MUST use awards for tuition and other educational expenses and fees.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Don & Nancy Lubbers Opportunity Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to attract the brightest students from middle income families and help widen their pathway to graduation. This two fold purpose will allow the University to be competitive among other insitutions that are chosen by highly accompilshed high school graduates, while also helping the student from middle-income families avoid indebtedness. Even very bright students, whose families do not qualify for federal need-based aid, often face the difficult choice of burdening their families with further debt or not completing their degrees solely because of economic reasons. To be eligible, students must:
Be admitted to GVSU

Incoming students must have a high school GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale
Enrolled full-time
Be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress
Preference will be given to students that demonstrate the largest unmet need
This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications of the scholarship and maintain a 3.0 GPA for a maximum of eight semesters. more...

Dora J. Geeter Memorial Culinary Arts Annual Scholarship
Dora was the third eldest child of fourteen born to Rosie & Samuel Geeter. She was extremely creative and loved to cook and bake. Her specialty was creating delicious cakes, which she would sell along with other yummy goodies. Her family and friends established this scholarship in hopes of giving another aspiring bakery chef the opportunity to share their culinary creations with others, as well as honoring Dora’s memory.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed at least 12 credit hours at Oakland Community College (transfer credits count toward eligibility)

MUST have a minimum GPA of 2.5


MUST demonstrate financial need as determined by Student Financial Resources & Scholarships

MUST be working toward the Culinary Arts degree (CUL.AASX) or the Baking & Pastry Arts certificate (CUL.BPA.CT)

MUST be used for tuition and books only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students pursuing a certificate in Baking & Pastry Arts
Preference will be given to residents of the City of Pontiac
Preference will be given to graduates of Pontiac Central High School (or Pontiac High) more...

Dorene Hope Shank Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Dorene Hope Shank was a teenage mother with two young children to support, and after obtaining her GED she enrolled at OCC and graduated magna cum laude. The Dorene Hope Shank Memorial Endowed Scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students who are single parents.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a single parent.

MUST have completed between 12 and 90 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have demonstrated financial need

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to full-time students.
Preference will be given to single mothers between the ages of 25-35 enrolled in a degree program.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Doris & George Mosher Endowed Scholarship
The Founders of Oakland Community College, Doris and George Mosher, established the Doris and George Mosher Endowed Scholarship in 2000. The scholarship is to financially assist students who demonstrate a financial need and will be used to cover tuition and other educational expenses.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed between 12 and 90 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative grade point average between 2.5 and 3.0


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST demonstrate financial need (as determined by Financial Assistance and Scholarships department)

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Doug And Shirley Van Dyke Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist undergraduate junior or senior students in the accounting program with the cost of their education.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU
*be an undergraduate junior or senior
*be enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the School of Accounting
*have a cumulative grade point average of 3.4 or greater
*be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP) according to the norms established by the University
Financial need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. more...

Dr. & Mrs. C.L. Dangremond Scholarship

Dr. Dennis Sobol Family Endowed Scholarship In Instrumental Music Performance
Dr. Dennis R. Sobol is a retired member and former Chairman of the OCC Orchard Ridge campus Psychology Department. His career at OCC spans from 1968 at the age of 24 until his retirement in 2010, and subsequently as an adjunct professor. His interest in and love for Community College teaching started at the Merritt College Campus of Oakland City College.
Criteria for HIGH SCHOOL Seniors
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. citizen.

MUST have Orchard Ridge campus as home campus.

MUST be a high school senior with an over-all minimum 2.7 cumulative GPA.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST submit a letter of recommendation from his/her high school music teacher.

MUST submit a written essay covering his/her plans for continuing education as a potential Music major or minor, and the importance of Music Performance in their life.

MUST be used for tuition and books.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Dr. Donald J. Klein, Sr. Graduate Scholarship In Accounting
This scholarship was created by the Seidman School of Business and Accounting Department alumni in honor of Professor Emeritus and former School of Accounting Department Chair, Don Klein.
Must have completed an undergraduate business degree
Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.75 or better upon admission to the MSA program
In addition to academic excellence, applicants must have demonstrated leadership, service and involvement in extra-curricular activities. They must have strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Must be enrolled as a full-time graduate student (9 credits per semester)
Must complete the Masters of Science in Accounting within two academic years
Must maintain a 3.5 GPA while in the MSA program
Candidates must be accepted by Grand Valley State University for enrollment in the MSA program to be eligible to receive this scholarship more...

Dr. Douglas Tubman Memorial Football Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to support GVSU Football student-athletes not currently receiving athletically-related financial aid/scholarships (walk-on), or other football athletes during summer to support their tuition and room and board.
To qualify, students must:
*accepted or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*undergraduate member of the GVSU Laker Football Team
*be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University: https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
Preference will be given to student-athletes not currently receiving athletically-related financial aid/scholarships (walk-on), or other football athletes taking summer courses.
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may or may not be renewed without reapplication provided the above qualifications continue to be met. more...

Dr. Gordon F. & Mrs. Patricia S. May Endowed Scholarship
Dr. Gordon & Mrs. Patricia May started this scholarship to ensure that the legacy they started here at Oakland Community College, he as an Administrator and she as a Counselor continues. Their passion has always been to help further the education of the youth of Pontiac and this scholarship provides that opportunity.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College.

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits.

MUST have a 2.8 GPA or higher.

MUST be a graduate of Pontiac High School or its predecessors or a resident of Pontiac.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Dr. James D. Hoffman Scholarship
This scholarship was created to benefit diversity students at GVSU who are academically and economically disadvantaged. In addition, School Zone Publishing Company employees or children of employees may apply for this scholarship.
Diversity Candidates
Must be entering freshman
May be an undergraduate half or full-time student
Must demonstrate financial need
School Zone Publishing Company Employees or Children
These applicants may be students at any undergraduate or graduate level when applying
May be a half or full-time student
Do not have to demonstrate financial need
Renewal Criteria: For both Diversity and School Zone candidates scholarship is renewable for a max of 10 semesters provided the student maintain a 2.0 GPA and are meeting satisfactory academic progress.
This fund is in compliance with Prop 2-06 because it was established prior to its passing in 2006. At the donors wishes this fund will continue making awards as originally intended, and in return no new gifts to the fund can be accepted. more...

Dr. Jeanne J. Arnold First Generation Urban Schools Scholarship
The First Generation Urban Schools Scholarship was established to provide opportunities for new incoming students who are the first in their families to attend college and may receive little encouragement and financial support to attend.
Must be the first person in his or her immediate family to pursue a college degree (neither parent/guardian has a four year degree), as reported on their admissions application.
Must be a graduate of a high school identified as a urban school or additional schools identified by the financial aid office (please contact financial aid office for full listing).
Incoming transfer students are eligible, including those transferring from the community college in Michigan, and who are also graduates of a listed urban high school.
Recipients must maintain an minimum 2.5 cumulative grade point average and be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Preference will be given to graduates from Michigan Urban Schools
Candidates must be accepted by Grand Valley State University for enrollment and recipients must be attending GVSU as full-time degree-seeking undergraduate students to be eligible to receive this scholarship
Must have financial need as demonstrated by Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Application Process: There is no formal application required for this scholarship. Your admissions application to the university serves as your application for this scholarship.
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship may be renewed for a maximum of 8 semesters without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet satisfactory academic progress. more...

This scholarship was established by Mr. and Mrs. David DeGutis in loving memory of Dr. John and Jill DeGutis. David is a graduate of the Macomb Community College Police Academy. Dr. John and Jill DeGutis’ memories will be eternal with this endowed scholarship at Macomb Community College, which is to be used to assist police and fire academy students in accomplishing their educational and professional goals.
must be enrolled in the Fire Training or Police Academy
must be a pre-service student
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.0 each semester of award
provide a 250-word essay describing the reason for your career choice. Careful consideration will be given to those who describe a financial struggle they have experienced in their lifetime, which may have prevented them from achieving their educational goals.
award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://macomb.academicworks.com/opportunities/flexible.html" more...

Dr. Kathleen J. Lorencz Endowed Scholarship
Dr. Kathleen Lorencz taught business at Oakland Community College for 41 years, from 1969 through her retirement in 2010. She earned her Bachelor Degree at Michigan State University and her Master and Doctorate at Wayne State University.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a U.S. citizen or eligible non-U.S. citizen

MUST have completed at least 12 credits at Oakland Community College; transfer credit hours count toward eligibility

MUST NOT have already earned an Associate or higher degree

MUST be enrolled part- or full-time

MUST have declared a program of study in Business or Computer Information Systems (ACC.ABA, BUS.ABA, MGT.BUS.AAS, CIS.AAS, or ICM.INT.AA)

MUST have Royal Oak or Southfield as home campus

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

This fund was established by friends and colleagues of Dr. Larry Zimmerman. Dr. Zimmerman served as Associate Dean of Health Science and Technology from 2008 to 2015. He also served as an Adjunct Faculty member within the Humanities department from 2010 to 2015. award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses

Dr. Leroy & Carole Salowich Endowed Scholarship For Veterans And Active Military/First Responders
Dr. LeRoy Salowich is a veteran with eight years of military service. He is a charter faculty member of the Oakland Community College. He developed, directed, coordinated and taught the Medical Laboratory Program. The program had worldwide recognition. The program accepted the education and training that military veterans acquired during their time of active duty. The acceptance of the veteran’s military training allowed the veterans to become registered technicians without repeating courses, which they took during their active duty training. Dr. Salowich retired after 35 years of service with OCC.
Carole Salowich taught middle school for 31 years. She was actively involved in writing curriculum for the county, state, US and Canada. She served on the Board of Michigan Council for Social Studies. Carole obtained several grants to develop an international Social Studies curriculum. In 1988 Carole was named “Outstanding Social Studies Educator in the State of Michigan.”
1. Criteria for the Veterans, Active Military
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum 2.5 GPA


MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST be part-time (generally 6 credit hours per semester)

MUST have financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST be a veteran or spouse of veteran with Proof of Active Military service or Military Discharge ( other than dishonorable).

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.
Preference will be given to Disabled Veterans first, then Veterans, and finally Active Military
2. Criteria for the First Responders
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum 2.5 GPA


MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST be currently enrolled part-time (generally 6 credit hours per semester

MUST be enrolled in the Oakland Policy Academy, Oakland Fire Training Institute, or EMS Academy

MUST demonstrate financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to Disabled Veterans first, then Veterans, and finally Active Military more...

Dr. Lisabeth S. & Michael J. Margulus Next Generation Teacher Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to continue the Margulus’ legacy of supporting future K-12 educators who have a passion for working in underserved districts.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate junior or senior enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the College of Education and Community Innovation, with a declared major in Education
*have a 3.5 or higher cumulative GPA
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate a passion for working in underserved school districts.
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
*Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. This scholarship may be awarded for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

Must submit a portfolio

Dr. Martin Stella Endowed Music Scholarship
Established to honor their dear brother, Martin, Rick and Joe Stella remember, from his early years, that Martin was committed to his vision and dreams. His drive was evident in everything he attempted. From sports to academia, he succeeded to become their family’s highest educated member. He earned his bachelors and doctoral degrees from the University of Michigan‐Ann Arbor and Master of Education degree from Wayne State University. He established several bands and performed for thousands. The commitment of his lifetime would be as a student, teacher, counselor, conductor and professor. This scholarship has been created to provide financial assistance to Macomb students pursuing a career in the music field.
pursuing a career in the music field
minimum GPA 2.0 each semester of award
letter of recommendation from music or band instructor
open to incoming high school students
award is for tuition, fees, books, and educational expenses more...
