MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Dr. Maurice Mccall Annual Memorial Scholarship
Dr. Maurice Henderson McCall was the eldest of six children born in Newport News, Virginia. He earned his bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Carnegie Mellon University in Music Composition and Theory and his doctoral degree from the University of Cincinnati Conservatory of Music. He eventually would accept the position of Registrar at Virginia State University and then Oakland Community College, where he worked for twenty-one years before retiring in 2011.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed at least twenty-four 24 credit hours at Oakland Community College (transfer credits count toward eligibility)

MUST have a minimum GPA of 2.5


MUST demonstrate financial need as determined by Student Financial Resources & Scholarships

MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. Citizen

MUST be working toward a degree in Computer Information Systems: Business Systems Analysis Option (CIS.BSA.AAS), Cybersecurity Option (CIS.CYS.AAS), Information Technology Support Option (CIS.ITS.AAS) or
Software Engineering Option (CIS.SWE.AAS).


MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Dr. Mel & Nena Chudnof Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship fund was created to honor Dr. Mel and Nena Chudnof. Mel was a faculty member at the OCC Auburn Hills campus for 43 years. He taught Psychology and coordinated the Mental Health/Social Work associate degree program, teaching its major courses. Nena taught in the West Bloomfield public schools for 31 years and specialized in Gifted Education.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 30 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours count toward eligibility.

MUST have demonstrated scholastic achievement with a minimum 2.5 GPA. Only grades earned in the two years prior to applying will be included in the GPA calculation.

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships.

MUST provide a letter of reference from an employer or non-family member describing qualities of leadership or community service.

MUST have completed one (1) Psychology (PSY) course.

MUST be pursuing a career in Psychology, Social Work, Counseling, or public-school teaching.

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST be enrolled in a program of study.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Dr. Nancy K. Mack & Katherine Klemit Mack Memorial Scholarship
To provide financial assistance to an undergraduate student who is seeking a second bachelor’s degree or a non-traditional student who is pursuing a career in elementary education.
Must be an undergraduate student enrolled at least half time (6 credits) in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences with a teachable major and minor in elementary education
Must have completed at least 30 credit hours, earned a minimum 2.7 overall GPA and a 2.7 GPA in elementary minor courses
Must be making satisfactory academic progress according to GVSU norms
Must meet minimum GPA requirements in major program area when applying to the College of Education
Must demonstrate financial need by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
First priority will be given to candidates who are nontraditional students, second priority will go to candidates pursuing a second bachelor’s degree, and third priority will be given to mathematics or science majors.
Renewal Criteria: Automatic renewal with a maximum of 8 semesters of receiving award. more...

Dr. Patsy Fulton-Calkins Endowed Scholarship
The Patsy Fulton-Caulkins Endowed scholarship was established in honor of the College’s fifth Chancellor. The scholarship will recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST demonstrate financial need

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Dr. Paul & Mrs. Doris Dirkse Health Care Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors or seniors attending Calvin College who are majoring in Nursing. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Nonrenewable. more...

Dr. Robert Banasik, P.E. Endowed Scholarship For Mechanical Engineering
Scholarship for full-time juniors or seniors attending Wayne State University who are majoring in Mechanical Engineering. Selection based on adacemic achievement and potential. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. more...

Dr. Roger A. & Bradley J. Hoekstra Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for upper-division students attending Calvin College who are majoring in Medicine. Selection is based on academic achievement and potential. Financial need may be considered. Nonrenewable. more...

Dr. Ronald Ward Scholarship
In recognition of the outstanding service of Dr. Ronald W. Ward to Grand Valley State University and to the Robert B. Annis Water Resources Institute, this scholarship is established and funded by the R.B. Annis Foundation. The purpose of the scholarship is to provide educational opportunities to students for study in the sciences, engineering, math, and/or health professions at Grand Valley State University. The following guidelines are used in the administration of the Dr. Ronald W. Ward Scholarship Fund.
Eligibility Criteria
To apply for this scholarship students must meet the following criteria:
1.Must be entering their freshman year at GVSU
2.Must be enrolled with full-time status as a degree-seeking student.
3.Must show aptitude in the sciences, engineering, math, and/or health professions and intend to major, concentrate, or specialize in one of these fields while at GVSU.
4.Must have a cumulative high school grade point average of 3.0 or better (on 4.0 system) and an ACT score of at least 24 (or SAT of at least 1100).
Renewal Criteria:Students who have previously received this scholarship are eligible to reapply, but a new pool of applicants will be evaluated each year. Previous awardees of this scholarship, who are reapplying, must maintain a 3.00 grade point average and successfully complete 25 credits after the first year, 55 credits after the second year, and 85 credits after the third year of attendance. more...

Dr. Rosalind Reaves - Africa Legacy Endowed Scholarship
As a teacher in Gambia and Malawi, Dr. Reaves observations taught her that the possibilities are limitless, that we are all capable of much more than we believe, and that academic achievement is attainable under the most adverse circumstances. These profound life lessons serve as the inspiration for the Dr. Rosalind Reaves-Africa Legacy Endowed Scholarship.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a resident or citizen of any African nation or have a parent who is/was a resident or citizen of any African nation

MUST have a GPA of 2.5 or higher

MUST submit a personal statement describing how they plan to use their education to help their community

MUST be used tuition and other educational expenses

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students attending OCC on an F1 visa.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Dr. Rosalind Reaves - Detroit Legacy Endowed Scholarship
“Education is for improving the lives of others and for leaving your community and world better than you found it.”
- Marian Wright Edelman, Founder and President Emerita, The Children’s Defense Fund
This powerful quote encapsulates an important purpose of education: to advance one’s self educationally so that one might in turn uplift and better one’s community. The Dr. Rosalind Reaves-Detroit Legacy Endowed Scholarship was established to pay tribute to the city of Detroit by supporting the post-secondary attainment of graduates of Detroit schools. The ultimate vision for this scholarship is that recipients, upon completion of their studies at Oakland Community College, will deploy their education in service to their community, and thus “leave their community and the world better than they found it.”
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a resident of Detroit or a graduate of a Detroit public high school or public academy.

MUST have a GPA of 2.5 or higher

MUST be enrolled part-time (less than 12 credits per semester)

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Dr. Rose C. Wingo Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Eastern Michigan University who are pursuing a Bachelors of Business Education. Applicants must have a minimum 2.5 GPA and completed BEDU 200-Principles of Business and Marketing Education. Preference given to male applicants. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. more...

Dr. Roy And Patricia Olsson Jr. Recreational Therapy Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students in the Recreational Therapy program with a cost of their GVSU education.
Must be accepted or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
Must be enrolled full time in the Recreational Therapy program as an undergraduate or graduate student (preference given to graduate students)
Must maintain satisfactory academic progress (SAP) according to the norms established by the University
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for two semesters and may be renewed once with reapplication. more...

Dr. Sara Kane-Smart Scholarship In Honor Of The Children's Advocacy Center In Holland
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage and assist students with career goals in child abuse prevention and advocacy who have demonstrated a commitment to advocate on behalf of abused and neglected children.
To qualify, students must:
*be accepted for, or currently enrolled at GVSU
*be an undergraduate student enrolled 12 credit hours or more
*have a social work, psychology, nursing, or criminal justice major
*be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University and the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
*Preference will be given to students with permanent residence in Ottawa or Allegan counties
Financial need may be considered, and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above for a maximum of 8 semesters. more...

Dr. William F. Pickard Business Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to annually provide scholarships to one or more undergraduate students attending GVSU who have the intent to pursue a degree in business. Recipients for this scholarship must have been accepted for admission to GVSU and must have freshman or sophomore standing during the academic year for which the scholarship is awarded.
Must be undergraduate students who are a member of an underrepresented group
Must be a resident of the Michigan counties of Wayne, Oakland or Genesee
Must be first-generation member of their family to attend university
Financial need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Application Process: Your submitted General Application within myScholarships will serve as your application for this scholarship. Students who qualify will automatically be considered.
Renewal Criteria: Not renewable. Recipients can only receive scholarship for maximum of two semesters. more...

• MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College
• MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits
• MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher
• MUST be pursuing a degree in Early Childhood Development
• MUST demonstrate financial need
• MUST be used for tuition and books
• MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor
• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
• MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

students should have completed ECHS 1100 and 1200 with a minimum GPA 2.0 or higher in each

3. What are your goals

Have declared a major in Economics or Business Economics

Have completed two upper level Economics courses at GVSU by the time of application

Edison Elementary Education Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist a student enrolled in the College of Education and pursuing a career in elementary education with a preference for students interested in teaching 3-6th grade.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate student enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the College of Education with an Emphasis in the Elementary Education Program
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to students interested in 3-6th grade education.
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication for a maximum of 8 semesters provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. more...

Elaine Belich Memorial Culinary Scholarship
Established by family, this scholarship is in memory of Elaine Belich, a people person and food lover. This scholarship is intended for students enrolled in the Culinary Institute at Macomb Community College that are facing financial challenges allowing them the opportunity to continue building their future culinary careers.
must be enrolled in at least one Macomb Culinary course at the time of application
recipient must complete the FAFSA application and/or be facing an immediate financial challenge
must submit a 250-word essay explaining your present educational goals, future culinary career goals, and the current financial challenges you are facing to stay in the culinary program
award is for tuition, fees, and other educational expenses more...

Eleanor Marecki Balchan Memorial Scholarship
Established by the family, friends, and colleagues of the late Eleanor Marecki Balchan, a former professor at Macomb Community College. The scholarship provides financial assistance to students interested in speech and pursuing a speech or teaching degree.
24 semester hours or more completed at the time of award
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.2 each semester of award
award is for tuition, fees, and/or books, and/or expenses to compete in speech competitions sponsored by the College
brief summary of educational goals in pursuing speech or a teaching degree
nominated by a Macomb speech professor; letter must accompany application (student cannot be related
by blood or marriage to nominator)
preference to adult students, raising a family, and seeking a college degree to improve their ability to provide for their family as a secondary wage earner
documentation to support these situations must be submitted with application more...

Empowered To Rise Above Scholarship
The Empowered to Rise Above scholarship were established with the hope to serve as a sign to autistic students, as well as those with learning disabilities at OCC that there are people who will always believe in them and see their potential for greatness.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits.

MUST be diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder or other Learning Disabilities. Proof of diagnosis or designation may be required.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Keyword: ACCESS
Preference will be given to applicants who demonstrated financial need. more...

Candidates must be enrolled as a Biology or Cell Molecular Biology major (All other Biology majors are welcome to apply)

Must be attending full-time and making satisfactory academic progress
Preference will be given to students from the West Michigan area and to nontraditional age students who are working full-time, motivated to succeed, dedicated, and value lifelong learning in education. Preference will be given to students pursuing careers in Plant Cell Molecular Biology.

Eugene And Lillian Pawl Scholarship For Biology/Biomedical Science Majors
This scholarship benefits GVSU pre-medical students who are the first in their families to attend college.
Candidates must be entering their Junior undergraduate year (minimum 55 credits hours) and recipients must be enrolled full time as either undergraduate nursing or pre-medical degree-seeking student.
Pre-medical candidates must demonstrate and express intention of entering an allopathic or osteopathic medical school upon graduation from GVSU

Candidates and recipients shall be making satisfactory academic progress
Candidates must have completed ALL prior undergraduate education at GVSU (advance placement and incidental transferable credits from summer courses accepted)
Must demonstrate financial need as defined by government programs by filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: The scholarship may be received for a maximum of four semesters, renewed automatically and make satisfactory academic progress. more...

Farmington Rotary/Lydia Silvani-Foley Endowed Memorial Scholarship
The Farmington Rotary/Lydia Silvani-Foley Endowed Memorial Scholarship was established to assist students with special needs to progress in their educational endeavors, and provide a “New Family” for Farmington Rotary.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be receiving disability support services through the ACCESS program at OCC


MUST reside in Farmington or Farmington Hills

MUST have completed 6 or more credit hours of instruction at OCC


MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability.
Keyword: ACCESS more...

Established to recognize the Fay and Penrod families’ commitment to academic growth. The scholarship is to provide financial support to single heads of household who need assistance to further their education.

minimum GPA 3.4 each semester of award
financial need, with preference to students with greatest need (FAFSA required)

MUST have a 2.5 GPA


MUST have financial need as determined by the Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships.

MUST be from a Spanish-speaking household

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership (Requires written documentation of demonstrated volunteer activities; may include letters to support past volunteer activities.)

MUST be enrolled in a program of study.

MUST be used for tuition and books.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

Finance Department Faculty Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship would be to assist finance majors with covering the cost of a college education. Finance faculty encourage recipients to take an active role in the Seidman Investment Portfolio Organization (IPO) or other finance related organizations.
Recipients for this scholarship must be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be juniors or seniors and enrolled full-time as a Seidman College of Business (SCB) finance major
Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or greater on a 4.0 scale
Must have completed at least 9 credit hours of finance coursework
If financial need is considered, it shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

Financial Executives International Western Michigan Scholarship
The Financial Executives International Western Michigan Chapter scholarship is awarded to a full-time accounting or finance student who is heavily involved in extracurricular activities such as accounting or finance clubs (e.g. Beta Alpha Psi), raising a family, athletics, or working at an outside job while in school. To be eligible:
Must be current juniors or seniors with at least one year remaining at Grand Valley
Must be enrolled in undergraduate or graduate accounting or finance degree programs
Must have 3.25 overall GPA and 3.5 GPA within the candidate’s major
Recipients are requested to attend a chapter dinner meeting in the Grand Rapids, Michigan area in April, for an opportunity to network with financial executives and to be recognized for their achievement.
Application Process: To apply for this scholarship complete the School of Accounting Scholarship Application through myScholarships. more...

First Generation Career Support Scholarship (Fall)
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage and assist first generation students participating in an unpaid internship or experiential learning opportunity approved by the university.
To qualify, you must:
*be an undergraduate enrolled full time
*be completing an internship for credit
*be making Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
*be the first in their family to earn a four-year degree (First Generation)
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship has multiple opportunities. Please apply for the scholarship posting that aligns with your internship start date:
Fall semester start: Fall application
Winter semester start: Winter application
Spring/Summer semester start: Spring/Summer application
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

First Generation Study Abroad Scholarship
The purpose is to support students who are the first in their family to attend college with the cost of a university approved study abroad opportunity.
To qualify, students must:
*be an undergraduate enrolled full time
*be accepted and enrolled in a university approved study abroad program
*be making Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
*be the first in their family to earn a four-year degree (First Generation)
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Fishbeck Occupational Safety And Health Management Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students pursuing careers in occupational safety and health and help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families who do not qualify for federal need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness, achieve their goals, and become fully engaged citizens.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate student enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more)
With a declared major in Occupational Safety and Health Management
Have a cumulative grade point average of 2.5 or greater on a 4.0 scale
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of four semesters. more...

Fostering Laker Success Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to youth who have experienced foster care and ensure financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth while pursuing a degree at GVSU.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*must have current or past placement in foster care, orphaned, or a ward of the court
*be an undergraduate or graduate student enrolled in 6 credit hours or more in any course of study
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to students who participate in the Fostering Laker Success Programs offered by GVSU
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications more...

Frank Johnson Utility Diversity Scholarship
This named scholarship honors Frank Johnson on the occasion of his retirement, for his dedication and 40 years of service and leadership to Consumers Energy. This scholarship is established by Consumers Energy Minority Advisory Panel (MAP) to provide financial assistance to Macomb Community College students seeking education and training in areas that directly impact the talent pipeline for energy.
must be a resident of Wayne, Oakland, or Macomb County
must be a graduate of public high school
open to incoming freshman or currently enrolled students in good standing.
cumulative GPA of 2.4 to 3.0
must be in enrolled in curriculum that supports careers in the skilled trades areas of Construction, HVAC, Utility, or Appliance Repair
priority given to students who attended, participated and/or graduated from a trade/vocational high school program
award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses
award is not renewable
applicant must submit an essay (300 words or less) that answers one of the following:
o What are your career aspirations?
o How do you demonstrate financial need? more...

Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST demonstrate financial need

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

Be enrolled full-time
Have a 3.0 cumulative GPA

Preference will be given to students who demonstrate exceptional leadership experience as outlined in their resume and essay questions.
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Fred A. Bell Business Scholarship
This scholarship provides financial support and recognition to business students who study in a foreign country. The scholarship is available to undergraduate and graduate business majors. With support from this scholarship, students can prepare for a global workplace, and position themselves for success in a world that is more diverse, complex, and interdependent.
Candidates must be full-time undergraduate or full-time/part-time graduate business students
Must have completed a minimum of 12 credits at GVSU

Study abroad application must be accepted by the Padnos International Center
Good academic standing / Strong academic credentials
Must demonstrate financial need
Students must be willing to promote study abroad when they return to GVSU
Application Process: Please apply for this scholarship through the Seidman College of Business Study Abroad Scholarship application in myScholarships.
For winter scholarships please click here to complete application.
For spring/summer/fall/academic year scholarships please click here to complete application. more...

Fred And Bernadine Keller Engineering Diversity Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial support to minority students who show a strong desire to pursue a career in the field of engineering.
Entering freshmen and transfer students must complete application for admission by February 1 and be accepted by GVSU

Must be enrolled with full-time status as pre-engineering or declared engineering degree-seeking student in the Padnos College of Engineering and Computing, School of Engineering
Must possess a strong desire to pursue an education in engineering. Experience in the field via an internship, co-op, or other work related experience is preferred and the recipient must demonstrate academic potential for success in the engineering program
Entering freshmen must have completed at least 6 units of high school mathematics and science courses
Candidates must also demonstrate financial need as determined by filing the FAFSA
This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications above. This scholarship may be awarded for a maximum of 4 semesters
This fund is in compliance with Prop 2-06 because it was established prior to its passing in 2006. At the donors wishes this fund will continue making awards as originally intended, and in return no new gifts to the fund can be accepted. more...

Frederik Meijer First Generation Honors College Scholarship
This scholarship is established to help first generation college students.
Must be the first person in his or her immediate family to pursue a college degree (neither parent/guardian(s) has a four year degree) as demonstrated on the application for admission.
Candidates must have applied to and be accepted by Grand Valley State University for enrollment in the Frederik Meijer Honors College.
Must be enrolled full time in the Frederik Meijer Honors College
Students who participate in the Faculty or Presidential Award of Distinction scholarship competition and are admitted to the Frederik Meijer Honors College will be considered
Application Process: There is no application for this scholarship. Students must apply for admission by December 31 to be considered.
Renewal Criteria: Max 8 semesters if student maintains a 3.2 GPA and remains a full time student and completes 25 GVSU credits after 1st year, 55 GVSU credits after 2nd year and 85 GVSU credits after 3rd yr. more...

Frederik Meijer Opportunity Scholarship
This scholarship was created to assist First Generation students who are the first in their family to pursue and earn a four-year degree.
Applicants must be an undergraduate enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
Must have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0
Must be the first person in his or her immediate family to pursue a college degree
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a minimum of one year (two semesters) and a maximum of four years (8 semesters). more...

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships

MUST be used for tuition, books and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

Gail And David Haines Finish Line Scholarship
This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College who are one class away from completing an Associate degree and are facing financial hardship. The fund is intended to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward completing their degree.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed at least 60 credit hours at Oakland Community College (transfer credits count toward eligibility)

MUST have one class remaining to complete an Associate degree

MUST be in good academic standing with a minimum GPA of 2.0 or higher

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by Student Financial Resources & Scholarships.

MUST be a U.S. citizen

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Gail Taylor Memorial Scholarship
A graduate of the Medical Laboratory Technology program, Gail Taylor was a “non-traditional” student who had a goal of working as a medical technician. After working more than a decade at Pontiac General Hospital, she was killed in a car accident a month after her retirement. To honor her memory and give students the same opportunity to grow and advance in a career of their choosing, her husband Richard “Dick” Taylor, a retired OCC mathematics faculty member, established this scholarship.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 12 credits

MUST have a 3.5 GPA or higher

MUST demonstrate financial need

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST designate the Highland Lakes campus as your home campus

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship is can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Garden Party Annual Vocational Education Scholarship
The Garden Party Foundation believe that the purpose of education is to teach students skills allowing them the opportunity to create their own self-sustainable life, and it is the hope that these funds will help accomplish that goal. This scholarship provides financial assistance to students enrolled in a approved program of study.
PLEASE NOTE: You will not qualify for this scholarship if you are a recipient of the Summer Momentum scholarship.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled in an OCC eligible program of study (see below), following the standard progression of courses to obtain a post-secondary credential.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST maintain a minimum GPA 2.0.

MUST be used for tuition, fees, books and other educational related expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the Garden Party Foundation.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Approved programs of study:
Business, Management, Marketing & Technology
a. Computer Information Systems
2. Engineering, Manufacturing & Industrial Technology
a. Automobile Servicing
b. Collision Auto Repair
c. Computer Aided Design and Drafting Technology
d. Construction Management
e. HVAC and Refrigeration Systems Technology
f. Machine Tool Technology
g. Robotics/Automated Systems Technology
h. Technological Sciences
i. Welding Technology
3. Health Sciences
a. Dental Hygiene
b. Diagnostic Medical Sonography
c. Health Care Administration
d. Medical Assisting
e. Nursing
f. Radiologic Technology
g. Respiratory Therapy
h. Surgical Technology
4. Human Services
a. Culinary Arts
b. Hotel Management
c. Restaurant Management
d. Criminal Justice
e. Emergency Medical Services
f. Fire Fighter Technology
5. Public Services and CREST
a. 911 Academy
b. Police Academy
c. Fire Training Institute
d. EMS Academy more...

Garden Party Endowed Scholarship
Aligning with the mission of The Garden Party Foundation (TGPF) focused on providing trade school scholarships to students with financial needs, this scholarship funds are for students in Oakland Community College’s Vocational Programs. TGPF believes that the purpose of education is to teach students skills allowing them the opportunity to create their own self-sustainable life and it is the hope these scholarships will help accomplish that goal.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled in an OCC vocational program (see below), following the standard progression of courses to obtain a post-secondary credential. Preference will be given to Culinary Arts students.

MUST maintain a minimum GPA 2.0


MUST be used for tuition, fees, books and other educational related expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the Garden Party Foundation.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student

1. Business, Management, Marketing & Technology
a. Computer Information Systems
2. Engineering, Manufacturing & Industrial Technology
a. Automobile Servicing
b. Collision Auto Repair
c. Computer Aided Design and Drafting Technology
d. Construction Management
e. HVAC and Refrigeration Systems Technology
f. Machine Tool Technology
g. Robotics/Automated Systems Technology
h. Technological Sciences
i. Welding Technology

a. Dental Hygiene
b. Diagnostic Medical Sonography
c. Health Care Administration
d. Medical Assisting
e. Nursing
f. Radiologic Technology
g. Respiratory Therapy
h. Surgical Technology

a. Culinary Arts
b. Hotel Management
c. Restaurant Management
d. Criminal Justice
e. Emergency Medical Services
f. Fire Fighter Technology
5. Public Services and CREST
a. 911 Academy
b. Police Academy
c. Fire Training Institute
d. EMS Academy

Gayle Davis First Generation Scholarship
The purpose of scholarship is to reduce the financial stress on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
Must be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be undergraduate student junior or senior enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more)
Must be the first person in their immediate family to pursue a college degree (first generation)
Must meet Satisfactory Academic Progress standards as determined by the Office of Financial Aid & Scholarships
Financial need will be given preference and will be demonstrated by Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)

General Dynamics Land Systems Engineering Scholarship
The General Dynamics Land Systems Engineering Scholarship is given to qualified Grand Valley State University students who are pursuing a degree in engineering.
Must submit a complete admissions application and be accepted to Grand Valley State University by February 1st
May be incoming freshman, transfer or upper-class student
Must be enrolled full-time as pre-engineering or have declared engineering as a major
High School and transfer students must have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 either in high school (if first year student) in another accredited college or university (if transfer student)
Returning students must have 3.0 Grand Valley GPA

First year students must have a math sub score of at least 27 ACT/ 665 SAT and composite of at least 25 ACT/ 1210 SAT

Must have successfully completed at least 6 units of high school mathematics and science courses
Must file the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). First priority will be given to scholarship candidates that have financial need. more...

George And Marianne Stein Memorial Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide need-based scholarship support to promising students pursuing careers in the Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) fields
Candidates must be a junior or senior
Candidates must be enrolled for 12 credits or more with a declared major in one of the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) areas
*Candidates must have at least a 3.2 GPA

Must be attending full-time and making satisfactory academic progress
Financial need is required by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: May be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. This scholarship may be awarded for a maximum of 4 semesters more...

Georgette “Tete” Zainea Memorial Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families who do not qualify for federal need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness, achieve their goals, and become fully engaged citizens.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be enrolled full time
*be maintaining Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP)
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Gerald & Sharon Schreiber Research Fund

Gerald Faye Endowed Scholarship
Gerald E. Faye was a faculty member at Oakland Community College for 51 years. He was a dedicated instructor, teaching within the Social Science discipline. In addition, Gerald was actively involved in the Oakland Community College Faculty Association (OCCFA) during his tenure at the College. OCCFA is creating this scholarship in honor of Gerald E. Faye.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have demonstrated scholastic achievement with a minimum 2.5 GPA.

MUST have completed or be currently enrolled in 6 or more credits within the Social Science discipline
(Courses currently include Anthropology (ANT), Economics (ECO), Geography (GEO), Global Studies (GLS), History (HIS), Political Science (POL), Psychology (PSY), and Sociology (SOC))

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by the OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships.

MUST be used for tuition, books or other educational expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Gerry Logue & Sally Hanna Scholarship
This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College to recognize their scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward achieving their educational goals. It will be administered according to the following provisions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST be or have been an orphan or ward of the court (Student must produce proof that they are an orphan or ward of the court.)


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be a part-time student

MUST have demonstrated financial need (as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources & Scholarships)

MUST be used for tuition, books, and other educational expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if the recipient still meets the criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Gilbert R. And Patricia K. Davis Merit Humanities Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to recognize scholastic achievement in any of the following majors within the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences: Art and Design, Classics, English, History, Modern Languages and Literature, Music, Philosophy, or Theatre.
Recipients should be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate student
Must be a resident of Michigan who have completed 30 credit hours earned at GVSU

Must have a declared major in Art and Design, Classics, English, History, Modern Languages and Literature, Music, Philosophy, or Theatre
Must have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or greater
Must be enrolled either part-time or full-time
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications listed above. The scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of (8) semesters. more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to assist and encourage talented Theatre students at GVSU.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU.
Must be undergraduate residents of Michigan who have completed 30 credit hours and have a declared major in Theatre
Must have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or greater (on a 4.0 scale)
Be enrolled in either full-or-part-time status
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipients continues to meet the qualifications stated above.
Application Process: To apply for this scholarship please complete the Theatre Arts Scholarship Application in myScholarships. more...

Global Citizens Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students studying abroad. The donor intent is to help students who will be studying abroad for an entire semester.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate student enrolled for 9 credit hours or more in an officially sponsored academic program abroad. Program must be approved by GVSU’s Padnos International Center which involves a course that counts towards your GVSU degree
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to candidates with a declared major within the School of Computing and Information Systems.
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to be used to assist historically underrepresented individuals including students of color, ELS, and students who identify with a diverse sexual identity including Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer, Intersex, and Asexual (LGBTQIA) in pursuit of a degree from the Kirkhof College of Nursing or College of Health Professions.
Eligible students must:
Be an undergraduate student
Enrolled full-time in the Kirkhof College of Nursing or College of Health Professions
Making Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP)
Priority will be given to candidates from the Kirkhof College of Nursing

Graduate Teacher Certification (Gtc) Scholarship
This scholarship was established for graduate students accepted into the College of Education who are pursuing initial teacher certification.
Must have applied and been accepted to the College of Education to study at the graduate level or already be a graduate level student in the College of Education
Must be pursuing initial teacher certification and must maintain full-time status as a graduate student
Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or better in an approved teachable major and/or in the last 60 credits of undergraduate work taken at a regionally accredited college or university
Must have been nominated by the Scholarship Selection Committee of the College of Education
Must have demonstrated financial need. Must annually file the FAFSA


REQUIRED: You must upload a resume through the general application for this scholarship
Review Committee: College of Education more...

Grand Valley Lanthorn Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to bestow financial awards to Grand Valley Lanthorn Student editors and managers.
Candidates must at least be entering their second semester at Grand Valley State University and their second semester of employment as an editor or manager at the Grand Valley Lanthorn
Candidates must have a cumulative GPA 2.5 or better on 4.0 scale
Demonstration of need is not required but is considered. Must file FAFSA. Priority given to students with demonstrated need
Must be employed at the GV Lanthorn
Be enrolled full time
Application Process: None. Recipients will be selected by the Grand Valley Lanthorn.
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Grand Valley Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families, who do not qualify for federal need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees.
Applicants shall have been accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be full-time
Must be making Satisfactory Academic Progress
Must file the FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) in order to be considered for scholarship
Renewal Criteria: Scholarships are not automatically renewed. However, recipients may reapply and receive scholarships for consecutive years, if awarded. more...

Grand Valley Uaw Region 1-D Scholarship
Grand Valley State University, in cooperation with Region 1-D of the UAW, offers a limited number of $4000 four year scholarships ($1000 per year), to entering freshman students who are children of UAW Region 1-D members from selected counties. Entering transfer students are eligible for $2,000 awards ($1,000 for two years) and must have graduated from an accredited community or junior college by the time they enter the program and must matriculate directly to GVSU.
High school applicants must have a minimum GPA of 3.1 and ACT composite score of 21 or SAT score of 1080
Transfer applicants must have an associate degree and a minimum GPA of 3.1
Must be a child of UAW member in good standing in Region 1-D and be from Allegan, Barry, Ionia, Kalamazoo, Kent, Montcalm, Muskegon, Newaygo or Ottawa county
Must be enrolled as a full-time student
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship will be renewable for three additional years (two for transfer students) provided the student maintains a 3.0 GPA. more...

Grants For Off-Campus Programs

Grcc Presidents' Scholarship For Transfer Students
The purpose of this scholarship is to reduce financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley Education accessible to students from all background. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
Recipients shall be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate transfer from Grand Rapids Community College
Must have an Associates of Art or Associates of Science degree
Must be enrolled in 12 credit hours or more in any course of study
Must be making Satisfactory Academic Progress
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications listed above. The scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of four semesters. more...

Green Family First Generation College Of Education Scholarship
This scholarship was created to encourage and assist students pursuing careers in education who are the first in their family to earn a four-year degree.
Recipients must be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate junior or senior and enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the College of Education
Must have a cumulative 2.8 GPA or higher
Must be identified on their admissions application as students who are the first in their family (First Generation) to earn a four-year degree
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
essay discussing the best ideas or methods to convince young people (pre-teens) that drinking and drugs are dangers to their lives, their dreams, and goals for success, achievement, and happiness in the future

Gregg K. Dimkoff Finance Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist deserving finance majors with the costs of completing their degrees in finance at Grand Valley State University (GVSU). To be eligible for this scholarship:
Recipients shall have accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate senior enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the Finance Department
Must have a cumulative grade point average of 3.5 or greater on a 4.0 scale
Must be making Satisfactory Academic Progress according to the norms established by the University
Financial need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Gregory A. Kozell Memorial Endowed Fund
The Gregory A. Kozell Endowed Memorial Scholarship was established to honor the memory of Greg Kozell. Greg spent his life serving his country and his community. He believed in the purpose of scholarships: To give a hand up, not a handout.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6-12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have financial need

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Gv In Dc Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist student participants in University-approved internship opportunities in Washington, D.C.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU
*be an undergraduate student
*be enrolled in a University-approved internship opportunity in Washington, DC.
*be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University and the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
Preference will be given to candidates who are the first in their family to earn a four year degree (first generation).
Financial need may be considered but is not required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Gvsu Founders Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to attract the brightest students and allow the university to be competitive among other institutions that top-notch students can choose. Once here, these best and brightest students can reach their full potential and enhance Grand Valley’s learning environment.
To qualify, students must:
*be accepted for admission at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*have a minimum high school GPA of 3.5 or greater
*must be an undergraduate enrolled in 12 credits or more
*have a permanent residence in Kent, Ottawa, or Muskegon Counties
Preference will be given to senior level student that has exhausted their merit/donor funded scholarship eligibility prior to meeting graduation requirements for their degree program.
Financial need is not required.
No application, students who meet requirements will automatically be considered
Renewal – requires 3.2 GPA and maintaining SAP. Students can receive this scholarship for a total of 8 semesters provided funds are available and student continues to meet requirements. more...

Harper Hospital School Of Nursing Alumni Association Endowed Scholarship
During the early 1900s, Detroit’s Harper Hospital was home to one of the nation’s most renowned nursing schools. The fund was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students pursuing a nursing degree.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled and accepted in the Nursing program

MUST be a direct descendant of Harper Hospital School of Nursing graduate

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Hbcu/Hsi Pipeline Consortium Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students enrolled from HBCU/ HSI or other Minority Serving Institutions with a collaborative articulation agreement at GVSU, with the cost of earning degrees at GVSU.
To qualify, you must:
*be a transfer undergraduate or graduate student
*from a minority serving intuition with articulation agreements at GVSU
*be enrolled full-time
*be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP) according to the norms established by the University: https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm
Financial need may be considered but not required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed at the discretion of the coordinating committee.
No application required, your admissions application will serve as your application to be considered for this scholarship more...

Student must be full time

Heyl Graduate Fellowship To Yale Program
The Heyl Graduate Fellowship to Yale Program is available to graduate students at Kalamazoo College who have majored in chemistry, physics, biology, mathematics, computer science, or any cross-disciplinary combinations of any of the foregoing. You must be accepted to Yale University and eligible for a Ph.D. degree in chemistry, physics, engineering/applied science, molecular biophysics, or biochemistry to be eligible for this fellowship. Selection is based on academic merit, goals, and letters of recommendation. more...

Heyl Scholars Program
The Heyl Scholars Program is available to incoming freshman students at Kalamazoo College who are majoring in engineering, biology, chemistry, computer, mathematics, physics, or other natural science. You must be a graduate of Kalamazoo Central or Loy Norrix high schools (or other area highschool/homeschool) and will earn a certificate of completion from the Kalamazoo Area Math and Science Center to be eligible for this award. Additionally, you must have a minimum GPA of 3.5. Selection is based on academic merit and letters of recommendation. more...

Candidates for this scholarship must be students entering their junior or senior year undergraduate with a minimum of 55 credit hours or be engaged in graduate level studies

Demonstration of financial need as defined by filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is required
*Applicants shall be asked to speak to their interest in and the development of gender equity in business.

Holliday-Willey Psychology Scholarship For The Study Of Autism Spectrum Disorders
This scholarship was established for students who are interested in Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) and plan a future career or service working with individuals with ASD. Requirements of candidates include:
Junior or Senior undergraduate or graduate standing (55 credits or more)
Enrollment as a degree-seeking Psychology major, Comprehensive Science and Arts of Teaching (CSAT) major, or a related field at GVSU

Enrolled full time as undergraduate or graduate
Must express and demonstrate an academic interest in Autism Spectrum Disorders as evidenced by a scholarship application essay, which includes future educational and career goals
Must have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or better
Financial need is not required. However, all other qualifications being equal, priority will be given to scholarship applicants that have financial need based on the current FAFSA

Candidates diagnosed as having a Autism Spectrum Disorders are given additional consideration
Renewal Criteria: Renewable for up to 4 – 6 semesters more...

Honor And Dedication Firefighter Scholarship
This scholarship was established by an anonymous donor who wishes to support those dedicated persons who are willing to be trained and serve as firefighters. There are currently individual scholarship awards to be awarded up to five individuals who are pre-service (that is, she/he has not previously worked in the fire service), or is not currently working in the fire service.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a student currently enrolled in OCC’s Basic Fire Academy, or are applicants for the November night Academy.

MUST Meet all general and physical requirements of the Oakland Fire Academy, and have submitted an application to the Oakland Fire Academy.

MUST Agree that if the student does not complete the Basic Fire Academy, the scholarship is forfeited and unexpended funds must be returned so that other applicants may utilize the funds.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Honor The Badge Scholarship
On the occasion of the memorial service for fallen Walker police officer Trevor Slot on October 21, 2011, President Thomas J. Haas announced that the University would initiate a scholarship to recognize Michigan police officers who died in the line of duty. Specifically, the scholarship will benefit a spouse or surviving child of a police person killed in the line of duty.
Must be attending GVSU full-time and meeting academic standards of progress
Must annually file the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: Renewable for a maximum of eight consecutive semesters provided the recipient maintains requirements for scholarship. more...

ELIGIBILITY:
• Recipients will have been accepted for or are currently enrolled at GVSU
• Must be an undergraduate student, currently enrolled full-time (at least 12 credits/semester) with junior or senior status
• Must have declared a major in Hospitality and Tourism Management and be making satisfactory academic progress (2.0 GPA or higher)
• Must be an “active” member of the HTM Clubs listed above. Active members are those who demonstrate their commitment by regular attendance at meetings, activities/events, promotion of membership and other activities deemed appropriate by the committee
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Hungerford Nichols Cpas + Advisors Accounting Scholarship
Hungerford Nichols CPAs + Advisors established a scholarship in 2003 for undergraduate GVSU accounting students. To be eligible, students must have an interest in a career in public accounting in West Michigan. Recipients are expected to demonstrate good scholarship, interpersonal skills and continued involvement in the business community. Recipients receive $2,000 ($1,000 per semester) toward tuition and fees at GVSU.
Students must be full-time undergraduates and accounting majors
Must demonstrate good interpersonal skills and continues involvement in the business community
Must have overall GPA of 3.2 and an accounting GPA of 3.5 or higher
Must have completed ACC 310
Application Process: To apply for this scholarship complete the School of Accounting Scholarship Application. more...

Ilene I. Schooley Biomedical Science Scholarship
This scholarship is intended for GVSU students majoring in Biomedical and Health Science. It is further intended that recipients demonstrate interest in pursuing post-graduate work in health-related research.
Recipients must be entering their junior year or must have completed 55 credit hours
Candidates must also be enrolled full-time as a Biomedical Sciences degree-seeking student
A recipient must maintain full- time BMS enrollment at GVSU

Candidates will have demonstrated a strong interest in basic or applied medical research through previous participation in research with GVSU faculty or summer programs at other institution
Candidates and recipients shall be making satisfactory academic progress towards their degree in Biomedical Sciences
Candidates and recipients must also demonstrate financial need and annually file the Free Application for Federal Student Aid to maintain this scholarship
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship is renewable for provided the recipient continues to meet eligibility requirements. Individual can receive scholarship for a maximum of 6 semesters.
Review Committee: Biomedical Science Department more...

Must be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be undergraduate student enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more)
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) as determined by the Office of Financial Aid & Scholarships
Preference will be given to students pursuing careers focused on social justice, diversity and inclusion and equity.
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Initech Global Diversity In Technology Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist and encourage students of color who are pursuing higher education in information technology fields.
To qualify, students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*declare their minority status on their admissions application questions regarding their racial/ethnic origins
*be a graduate of a public high school in Kent, Ottawa, Muskegon, Oakland, Wayne or Macomb county
*be an incoming freshman enrolled 12 credit hours or more
*be majoring in computer science, information systems, or information technology
Preference will be given to students who are graduates of urban schools identified by the financial aid office and first generation students.
Financial need is required, and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal: may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. Students may receive the scholarship for a maximum of 8 semesters. more...

Initech Global Technology Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist and encourage graduates of public high schools who are pursuing higher education in information technology fields.
Recipients of this scholarship must have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an incoming freshman and a graduate of a public high school in the State of Michigan and enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Cybersecurity or Information Systems majors.
Preference will be given to students from Kent and Ottawa counties
Financial need may be considered but not required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is renewable and can be awarded for a maximum for 4 years or 8 semesters. more...

International Internship Scholarship (Spring/Summer & Fall)
This scholarship is designed to support students interested in pursuing a full-time internship abroad for a minimum of 8 weeks. Students must complete the scholarship application by the deadline. Late applications will not be considered. Priority will be given to students with financial need. Priority will also be given to students who have not already had a significant academic or internship abroad experience. Students need to demonstrate financial need by filing the FAFSA.
To be considered, student must:
Be participating in an internship abroad with a minimum internship period of 8 weeks
Students must be earning credit for the internship
This scholarship is designed for those participating in a full-time internship. This is not available to students who are participating in a study abroad + internship combination.

Must have a completed OASIS application in by the priority deadline for the semester you plan to be abroad.\
This scholarship has multiple opportunities. Please apply for the scholarship posting with the deadline that is closest to the anticipated start date of your internship. more...

International Internship Scholarship (Winter)
This scholarship is designed to support students interested in pursuing a full-time internship abroad for a minimum of 8 weeks. Students must complete the scholarship application by the deadline. Late applications will not be considered. Priority will be given to students with financial need. Priority will also be given to students who have not already had a significant academic or internship abroad experience. Students need to demonstrate financial need by filing the FAFSA.
To be considered, student must:
Be participating in an internship abroad with a minimum internship period of 8 weeks
Students must be earning credit for the internship
This scholarship is designed for those participating in a full-time internship. This is not available to students who are participating in a study abroad + internship combination.

Must have a completed OASIS application in by the priority deadline for the semester you plan to be abroad.
This scholarship has multiple opportunities. Please apply for the scholarship posting with the deadline that is closest to the anticipated start date of your internship. more...

MUST have a minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA is required.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and books.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Itc Holdings Annual Scholarship
ITC Holdings Corp. invests in the electricity transmission grid to improve reliability, expand availability to markets, lower the costs of delivered energy and allow new generating resources to interconnect to its transmission systems. The largest independent electricity transmission company in the country, ITC operates in Michigan’s Lower Peninsula and portions of Iowa, Minnesota, Illinois, Missouri, Kansas, and Oklahoma.The ITC Holdings Annual Scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST demonstrate financial need

MUST be a resident of Oakland County

MUST be enrolled in one of these degree programs:
(CIS.AAS, CIS.BSA.AAS, CIS.CPA.AAS, CIS.CSU.AAS, CIS.CSU.AASX, CIS.CYS.AAS, CIS.ITS.AAS, CIS.SWE.AAS, CIS.SWE.AASX, CIS.SYA.AAS, CIS.SYA.AASX, CIS.THS.AAS or CIS.THS.AASX)


MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

J.C. Huizenga Business Scholarship
This scholarship is created to benefit students in the Seidman College of Business.
Candidates must demonstrate their intense desire and determination to succeed in their chosen studies and careers in business. Must be acceptable for admission to the Seidman College of Business
Candidates must be at a junior class level and must have at least 55 credits or higher and be admitted to the Seidman College of Business as a degree-seeking carrying at least 3 credits per semester
Both undergraduates and graduates are eligible to apply
Undergraduates must have a 3.0 or higher GPA and graduate students have a 3.4 or higher GPA and both shall be making satisfactory academic progress
Graduate students may receive this scholarship while taking 500 level background courses
Must demonstrate financial need by filing a Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Candidates transferring from other institutions of higher learning must be accepted by Grand Valley State University
Renewal Criteria: May be renewed for a total of 4 semesters provided the student continues to meet original qualifications and satisfactory academic progress. more...

preference given to students who volunteer with an animal-related rescue or cause

Jamal Family Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to reduce the financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate junior or senior enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*have a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to past employees and families of current employees of Jamal Hospitality Group IHOP.
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal criteria: This scholarship is automatically renewable provided the recipients continues to meet the qualifications above. This scholarship may be awarded for a maximum of four semesters. more...

James R. Coates Memorial Scholarship
The James R. Coates Memorial Endowed Scholarship was established to facilitate the education of future generations of substance abuse counselors, in hopes that they will continue to strive to have a positive impact on the lives of others.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST be enrolled in Mental Health/Social Work (MHS.APP) program (specialization in substance abuse)

MUST be used for tuition only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...
