James R. Moyer Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to support students pursuing careers to assist the ageing population with recovery from disease and injuries, and the expansion of careers which keep older Americans in their homes.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate junior or senior or graduate student enrolled full time
*be enrolled in a major or degree program that encompasses geriatric care to including, but not limited to: Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Nursing, Physician Assistant Studies, Therapeutic Recreation, Social Work, Speech-Language Pathology, Clinical Dietetics, Medical Lab Sciences, and Health Administration
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) which includes pathway (middle income) students
This scholarship is renewable and can be renewed for a total 6 semesters provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. more...

James Raymond Martin Memorial Scholarship
Established in memory of James (Jamie) Raymond Martin, who was a graduate of Eisenhower High School. He studied Business at Macomb Community College and entered the career of Real Estate at the age of 23. He married Amy Rose Martin in 2015. The two were involved in a car accident in September of that year, where Jamie and their unborn son, Jameson, tragically lost their lives. Jamie was on-day shy of his 27th birthday. Amy Martin survived the accident. Jamie loved kids and donated his organs, saving around 50 lives. This scholarship is available to Macomb Community College students to assist with meeting their educational goals.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours) or more in the Business program with career interest in finance, real estate, and/or entrepreneurship
minimum 2.5 or higher GPA (high school or college)
applicants must provide a brief summary (250-500 words) of their educational goals and how this scholarship will impact them
awards is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses
applicants can reapply for this scholarship more...

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5.

MUST submit 3 letters of reference that describe the applicant’s demonstrated leadership skills.

MUST be used for tuition only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Jamie A. Allen '14, '15 Black Stem Professional Advancement Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help relieve the financial burden and reward African American students pursuing careers in vital professions where African Americans have traditionally been known to be inadequately represented. The ideal candidate strives to personally accomplish various levels of success, but also realizes the significance of reaching back to uplift others as they climb.
To qualify students must:
be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
be at least an undergraduate sophomore enrolled 12 credit hours or more
have a declared major in the Seidman College of Business, the College of Health Science, Kirkhof College of Nursing, or the Padnos College of Engineering and Computing or with a major in science, legal studies or criminal justice
declare their African American racial status in their response to their admissions application form questions regarding their racial/ethnic origins
be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP)
Additional preference will be given to students who excel academically while simultaneously participating in voluntary events such as community service, mentoring, tutoring or others.
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal – This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. The maximum award length is four semesters. more...

Jan & Nancy Treur Family Scholarship
Scholarship for graduate students who are Christian teachers attending Calvin College who are pursuing a Master of Education Learning Disabilities. Applicants must have financial need. Due date, number of awards, and award amount may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Janice Simmons Memorial Endowed Nursing Scholarship
The Janice Simmons Memorial Endowed Scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students pursuing a Nursing degree.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward a maximum of eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.8


MUST be enrolled and accepted into the Nursing program

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership (Requires written documentation of demonstrated skills; short essay or letter (s) of recommendation)

MUST demonstrate financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST be a resident of Oakland County

MUST use for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Jay Oklu & Lisa Spagnuolo Next Generation Endowed Scholarship
Through various experiences in their career and growing population of immigrants in Macomb County, Jay and Lisa were inspired to help this population through scholarships. This scholarship is open to students who are new citizens of the United States or permanent resident aliens of the United States. This scholarship was created to inspire immigrants to create a better life through education.
half-time enrollment (6 credits or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.75 each semester of award
demonstrate financial need
proof of citizenship or resident alien card
brief essay about why the student came to the United States, educational goals and career goals
award is for tuition, fees, and books
renewable, based on application and funds available more...

Jim '83 & Diane '82, '93 Meerman Coopersville Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to reduce the financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU.
Must be an incoming freshman from Coopersville High School
*Must be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more) in any course of study
Must be meeting satisfactory academic progress standards
Must also be graduates of Coopersville High School
Financial need may be considered and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is non-renewable more...

Jo Ellyn Clarey Women's History Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage and reward students majoring in History (including students perusing degrees to teach history at the secondary level) who demonstrate an interest in women’s history.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate junior or senior enrolled full-time or part-time with a major of History, History- Secondary Education, or Group Social Studies- Secondary Education
*be a resident of Michigan
*have completed 30 credit hours at GVSU with a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate an interest in Women’s History.
Financial need may be considered and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

Joan Panopoulos Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide opportunities for graduates of the Grand Rapids Public Schools to attend college. The scholarship is designated to also benefit student who have participated in the TRiO Upward Bound program.
Candidates who have participated in the Upward Bound Program, a TRiO program incorporated within the Advising Resources & Special Programs unit at Grand Valley State will be given preference*
Candidates from other TRiO programs who have graduated from Grand Rapids Public Schools may be considered if no one in the GVSU program applies
Must be an entering new freshman or transfer student from Grand Rapids Community College who have earned an Associate’s Degree
Entering freshmen must have a 3.0 cumulative high school GPA and a minimum ACT composite score of 18 or SAT composite score of 970. Transfer students must have a prior college GPA of 3.0 or greater
Full-time student
Must demonstrate financial need by filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: Scholarships will be automatically renewed (no more than 10 semesters) provided the recipients continue to meet qualifications. more...

Joanne D. Smith Memorial Scholarship
Providing scholarship assistance for a student(s) planning to transfer to a college or university to pursue a degree in music or a second year nursing student (preference is given to a music student). Applicants must be enrolled full time a minimum of twelve (12) academic credit hours per semester. Music applicants must be a graduating high school senior with preference be given to an Ida High School, Ida, Michigan graduate. During the scholarship year, the recipient must be a member of the College/Community Symphony Band and/or the Agora Chorale. Music applicants must submit a letter of recommendation from their high school band and/or choir director. Recipient must be a resident of Monroe County, Michigan and a United States citizen. more...

Joe And Claudia Pohlen Grcc Transfer Student Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist transfer students from GRCC and reduce the financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
To qualify students must
*have been accepted or be currently enrolled at GVSU
*be a transfer student from GRCC
*enrolled as an undergraduate for 12 hours or more in any course of study
*be making satisfactory academic progress (SAP) according to the norms established by the University and the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
Preference will be given to students who identify their minority status in their response to the admissions application form questions regarding their racial/ethnics origins.
Financial Need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications above. This scholarship may be renewed for a maximum of four semesters. more...

John Allegrina Nontraditional Student Memorial Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help assist nontraditional students in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences as they face their own particular challenges of finishing a degree.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate and nontraditional student enrolled for 12 credit hours or more with a declared major in the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

John And Barbara Gracki Football Degree Completion Scholarship
The scholarship will be awarded to undergraduate students who have exhausted their athletic eligibility. Recognizing the hard work of the Laker football players, who juggle class schedules with practice and game schedules and may require extra time to complete their coursework, John and Barbara initiated a scholarship to help the players complete their degree at Grand Valley State University.
Current or former Laker Football athlete who has exhausted their athletic eligibility and has not completed their undergraduate education.
Former players who have attended GVSU and have come back to finish their undergraduate degree are eligible
Must be a member of the Grand Valley State Laker Football team
Must be a junior or senior
Application Process: No formal application required, scholarship awarded based on nomination from coach
Renewal Criteria: May be renewed without application for a max of (4) semesters provided the student maintains a 2.5 GPA. more...

This scholarship was established to support students in the School of Communications.
Must be accepted to or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be full-time, undergraduate student enrolled in the School of Communications

GPA of 3.0 or greater and making satisfactory academic progress
Demonstrate financial need. Must file FAFSA

Preference to students pursuing career in broadcasting/multimedia journalism
Renewal Criteria: Must reapply for renewal. Scholarships may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

John S. Piet Iii & Christine Piet Study Abroad Endowed Scholarship
John S. Piet III was an artist and a faculty member at Macomb Community College from 1976-2011. This endowed scholarship fund was established in 2018 in memory of John S. Piet III by his wife, Christine Piet, to provide financial assistance to Macomb Community College students who apply to the Macomb Study Abroad Fund, to assist them with travel and tuition expenses as participants in international study abroad opportunities
student must meet the requirements for the Macomb Student Study Abroad Fund and complete the application
student must be traveling to a Spanish-speaking country including, but not limited to, Spain and Mexico. Travel must be connected to an academic program or a Macomb study abroad program
successfully completed two semesters or 15 credit hours at Macomb Community College with a minimum 2.0 cumulative GPA

part-time or full-time enrollment
student may be interviewed by the selection committee prior to awarding
student may be asked by the selection committee to present or share their travel experiences with the college community
must include an unofficial student transcript
all students who meet the minimum scholarship requirements for The John S. Piet III & Christine Piet Study Abroad Endowed Scholarship and apply for the Macomb Student Study Abroad Fund will receive awards based on available funds. However, award amounts may vary based on the following criteria:
* whether the student has previously participated in a Study Abroad program at Macomb Community College
* student’s merit, including, but not limited to faculty recommendations, GPA, performance during the interview, etc.
Applications are due by Feb. 28 each year.
To obtain a Macomb Student Study Abroad Application, please contact the MCC Foundation at 586-445-7302 and foundation@macomb.edu. more...

John Shontz Native Plants Biology Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students who are majoring in Biology with an emphasis in Plant Biology.
Must be entering Sophomore, Junior or Senior year in forthcoming Fall semester
Enrolled with full-time status as a degree-seeking student, majoring in Biology with an emphasis in Plant Biology
Recipients shall be making satisfactory academic progress
Transfer candidates must be accepted by GVSU for enrollment, and recipients must be attending the University to be eligible to receive this scholarship
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship is renewable provided the recipient continues to meet qualifications. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 3 academic years. more...

John T. Batchelder Political Science Scholarship
The John T. Batchelder Political Science Scholarship is intended to support academically high achieving political science majors fund their undergraduate careers.
Candidates must be entering their Junior year carrying a minimum of 55 credit hours
Must be enrolled with full or part-time status as a Political Science major, degree-seeking student
Overall cumulative GPA of 3.3 or greater and an average GPA of 3.3 in Political Science courses. Recipient must be making satisfactory academic progress
Demonstration of need is not required but may be considered. Candidates who wish financial need to be considered must file FAFSA.
Transfer Student must be attending GVSU to be eligible to receive this scholarship
Renewal Criteria: Renewable provided student continues to meet qualifications. Scholarship may be received for a maximum of four semesters. more...

Johnny C. Burton Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship was created to assist incoming freshmen or transfers students, as well as students currently attending GVSU. This scholarship is specifically for African-American students who demonstrate a high level of interest in pursuing a career in business and/or entrepreneurship.
Applicants must be African-American students in any major
Freshman, transfer and current students who are attending GVSU are eligible to apply
Student must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP)
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
This fund is in compliance with Prop 2-06 because it was established prior to its passing in 2006. At the donors wishes this fund will continue making awards as originally intended, and in return no new gifts to the fund can be accepted. more...

Johnson Leadership Scholarship
The purpose of the Johnson Leadership Scholarship is to provide financial support for students interested in traveling abroad to advance their leadership skills in any career or area of interest. The scholarship will encourage students who are committed to lifelong learning, developing a global perspective and making a difference. By encouraging study abroad, they hope that students will aspire to what is called `Arete, Greek word meaning to live up to one’s full potential and greatest effectiveness.
Recipients for this scholarship should be accepted or fully enrolled at GVSU

They must be an undergraduate and enrolled as a full-time junior, senior, or transfer student
Must demonstrate financial need by completing the FAFSA, and shall be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Preference will be given to candidates enrolled in a semester long study abroad program approved by the Padnos International Center at GVSU, and students from Kent, Ottawa, and Muskegon counties
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship may be renewed with reapplication, for a max of (4) semesters, provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated herein. more...

Joseph & Mary Lorencz Endowed Scholarship
The Joseph and Mary Lorencz Scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students. This scholarship is for students pursuing degrees in Business or Accounting and who have designated Royal Oak or Southfield as their home campus. The donor encourages retirees returning for re-training to apply.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a cumulative minimum GPA of 3.5


MUST be currently enrolled part-time (generally 6 credit hours per semester)

MUST be enrolled in Business related programs of study (BUS.ABA, MGT.BUS.AAS, ACC.AAS, ACC.ABA, ACC.GA.CT OR ACC.PT.CA)

MUST specify Royal Oak or Southfield as your “home” campus

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

or eligible for an Associate’s Degree in Law Enforcement upon completion of the Macomb Police Academy

a pre-service applicant to the Macomb Police Academy
accepted into/a student in a current Macomb academy class
a student who has applied for the Blanke Memorial Award and submitted a typed essay

Joseph Bolinger, Jr. Memorial Endowed Scholarship
The Joseph Bolinger, Jr. Scholarship was established by Mr. Bolinger’s family to honor his memory and to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST be part-time (6 or less credits) per semester

MUST have a cumulative minimum 3.0 GPA


MUST be enrolled in the Manufacturing or Design Curriculum

MUST be used for tuition only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference for applicants with Auburn Hills campus as “home camps” more...

Joseph Spruit Engineering Scholarship
This scholarship benefits students in the GVSU School of Engineering who demonstrate financial need.
Must have applied to and been accepted by GVSU for enrollment by February 1st or already be attending the University. Any newly-entering students may be considered for this scholarship
Must be enrolled with full-time status as pre-engineering or accepted in Padnos College of Engineering and Computing, School of Engineering as degree-seeking student
Must have GPA of 3.0 or greater in either high school or at GVSU or another accredited college or university
Freshmen candidates must have mathematics sub-score of 27 ACT/ 665 SAT and a composite score of 25 ACT/ 1210 SAT. Also must have completed at least 6 units of high school mathematics and science courses
Must demonstrate financial need as defined by FAFSA. Must file for FAFSA.
Renewal Criteria: Recipients will be automatically renewed for scholarship, can receive scholarship up to 8 semesters total and must meet satisfactory academic progress. more...

Both full and part time students will be eligible
Must have a GPA of 3.0 or better
Must be making satisfactory academic progress
Candidates shall be pursuing a career plan to eventually promote and develop philanthropy and engage in non-profit agency fund raising more...

Joyce Keil Zurel Scholarship
As a dedicated Library Technician, beloved friend, and respected co-worker, Joyce Keil Zurel worked with students and always encouraged them to do their best. This scholarship in her name acknowledges future Library Technicians who are committed to excellence in their field and to student success.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled in the Library Technician Program (LBT.AAS or LBT.CT) at OCC.

MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours in Library Technician courses required for the major.

MUST have a GPA of at least 3.0


MUST be a U.S. Citizen.

MUST be enrolled part-time.

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Judith Siegel Pearson Award
Annual competition for the best creative or scholarly literary work on a subject concerning women. Entries must be unpublished fiction, drama, poetry, or essays in literary studies. Prose or drama entries should be no more than 20 pages, double-spaced. Poetry entries should be no more than 20 pages and consist of 4-10 poems. Contestants retain copyright of all work submitted. Contact Wayne State University English Department for more information. more...

Junior Year In Munich Scholarship
The Junior Year in Munich Scholarship is available to undergraduate students enrolled in any accredited U.S. or Canadian college or university. You must have been accepted to study abroad in Munich, Germany, with Wayne State University's Junior Year in Munich program to be eligible for this award. Selection will be based on financial need, letters of recommendation, academic record, and demonstrated determination and enthusiasm. more...

Justice And Society Graduate Fellowship
This fellowship is to recognize and reward students who have demonstrated academic potential to excel in the master of criminal justice program at GVSU.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be a graduate student enrolled for 3 credit hours or more in the School of Criminal Justice master of science in criminal justice program
*have a 3.5 or higher cumulative GPA
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Renewal criteria: This scholarship is renewable, upon reapplication, for a maximum of 4 semesters for full-time recipients, or 8 semesters for part-time recipients, until 36 credit hours are met provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. more...

in the Student Activities and Athletic departments

Katherine L. Grenda And Donald N. Ritzenhein Endowed Scholarship For Students In The Arts
The Grenda & Ritzenhein scholarship is designed for students who wish to pursue any number of arts disciplines. Research shows that students with a solid Liberal Arts background excel in a wide range of employment opportunities and careers because they have the ability to develop and critique situations that involve speaking, listening, writing, history, humanities, and the human condition. Such wisdom promotes a passion for improving humanity and the world.
• open to students pursuing a degree in Speech Communication, Humanities, or Social Science disciplines
• incoming high school and transfer students are eligible
• half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more)
• minimum GPA 2.5 each semester of award
• award may be renewed each academic year, upon reapplication, as long as qualifications are maintained
• applicants must submit a 250-300 word essay, “Why I want to pursue a college education in speech communication, humanities, or one of the social science disciplines.”
• award is for tuition, fees, books, and college-related expenses more...

Kathleen B. Vogelsang Seidman College Of Business Scholarship For Non-Traditional Students
This scholarship provides financial aid to non-traditional students studying in the Seidman College of Business.
Candidates for this scholarship will be “non-traditional” students who have a family, and for whatever reason did not begin undergraduate education immediately following high school graduation. Or, as a parent may have chosen to stay at home taking care of the children while the spouse worked outside the home. A single head of household who is an undergraduate will be given preference
Candidates may be entering any university level, undergraduate or graduate. Undergraduate candidates will have preference in selection
Must be enrolled full-time or part-time (minimum 6 credit hours)
Must be carrying a cumulative grade point average of 3.0
Demonstration of financial need as defined by filing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) is not required but financial need may be considered
Renewal Criteria: May be renewed for a maximum of 6 semesters provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. more...

Kaufman Family Scholarship Honoring L. William Seidman
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist juniors and seniors in the Seidman College of Business with the cost of a GV education and encourage and recognize students involved in the Business Ethics Center to explore ethics, moral behavior and meaning in business.
Recipients for this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate and enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the Seidman College of Business
Must have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or greater (on a 4.0 scale) and shall be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Preference will be given to students who demonstrate involvement in Business Ethics Center programming and courses
Financial need may be considered (not required) and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. The Business Ethics center and the Financial Aid Office will monitor the recipients’ progress and scholastic achievement for renewal of this award. more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to assist a student in any major participating in the study abroad program in computing and information systems in Zurich, Switzerland. This award will be available to use in the Spring/Summer semester.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate enrolled in any major in the Frederik Meijer Honors College
*be participating in the study abroad program to Zurich, Switzerland that is run by the School of Computer and Information Systems
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Financial need may be considered and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Keeper Of The Dream Awards

Kegham Tazian Endowed Scholarship
Kegham Tazian joined the art faculty at Oakland Community College, Orchard Ridge Campus, in 1967. Since that time, Mr. Tazian has served the College with great distinction and pride. In 2011, Mr. Tazian and his family established the Kegham Tazian Endowed Scholarship (the “Fund”) to promote the pursuit of fine arts at OCC. With the creation of the Fund, Mr. Tazian seeks to reward those students who have demonstrated a dedication to the arts and academic excellence, values he has long promoted during his tenure at OCC.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours count toward eligibility.

MUST have demonstrated scholastic achievement with a minimum 3.3 GPA.

MUST be enrolled full-time (i.e., minimum 12 credit hours per semester).

MUST submit a portfolio of at least 8 representative artworks.

MUST be working toward the Associate in Arts degree with a concentration in Fine Arts/Visual (FAV.AA) at the Orchard Ridge campus.

MUST reside in Oakland County.

MUST be used for tuition, books and art supplies.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Keith & Inez Dixon Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate student who is a sophomore (including transfer students) at the University of Michigan-Ann Arbor. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA or better. Due date varies. Renewable. more...

Keith And Vuriel Kohlmann Phi Theta Kappa Memorial Endowed Award
Created by the family and friends in memory of Keith and Vuriel Kohlmann, this award provides financial assistance to Phi Theta Kappa students at Macomb Community College. Phi Theta is the International Honor Society of the Two-Year College.
Applicant must submit an essay:
– Describing his/her career goal and their educational plan to achieve it
– How has Phi Theta Kappa made an impact on your life
– Why do you volunteer?
• * A thank you letter must be sent to the Kohlmann family through the Macomb Community College Foundation Office before the award is disbursed.
Must be a member in good standing with Phi Theta Kappa
Registered for a minimum of 6 credit hours for both the Fall and Winter Semesters (if registered for less that 6 credits, rationale may be provided along with an outline of how you will complete your educational goals).
Volunteer a minimum of 20 hours in the academic calendar year and record hours through the Student Development Transcript
Must participate in at least one Phi Theta Kappa program a semester
Applications for award are available in the Student Life and Leadership offices. The applications must be submitted to the Student Life and Leadership offices by the second Friday in April
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://www.macomb.edu/future-students/campus-life/student-life/index.html more...

Knauf Family Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families who do not qualify for need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness, achieve their goals, and become fully engaged citizens.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Preference will be given to veterans or students majoring in special education, criminal justice, health sciences, women and gender studies, psychology, political sciences, or communications
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Knights Of Columbus-Michigan State Council Scholarship
The Knights of Columbus-Michigan State Council Scholarship is available to full-time graduate and undergraduate students at Madonna University. You must be an education major with intentions to become a teacher of learning disabled children. You must also have a minimum GPA of 3.2 to be considered for this award. more...

Koning Family Health Sciences Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families who do not qualify for federal need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness, achieve their goals, and become fully engaged citizens.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate enrolled in programs of Radiation Therapy, Diagnostic Medical Sonography, or Kirkhof College of Nursing
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).

Kristin M. Zoller Cooper Bsn '94, Msn '02 Nursing Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist single student parents pursuing a BSN or MSN degree in nursing and reduce the financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth. To qualify recipients:
Must be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be a single student parent
Must be accepted and enrolled in BSN or MSN program in the Kirkhof College or Nursing
Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress according to the Kirkhof College of Nursing and the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
First preference will be given to BSN students
In the event there are no single parent students who qualify, preference will be given to enrolled nursing student parents that meet the qualifications.
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications listed above. more...

Kuenzi Memorial Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Western Michigan University who are majoring in Geoscience. Selection based on academic achievement. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Kulesza Family Healthcare Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families who do not qualify for federal need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the costs of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority, and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness achieve their goals, and become fully engaged citizens.
Recipients for this scholarship shall have been accepted, or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be at least a junior and enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more)
Must have a declared major of Allied Health Sciences or Biomedical Science
Must be meeting satisfactory academic progress standards
Financial need shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Kyle Grant '12 Memorial Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist students pursuing careers in forensics with the costs of their education at GVSU.
To qualify students must:
- be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU
- be an undergraduate senior
- enrolled for 12 or more credit hours with a 3.0 or higher CGPA
- demonstrate interest in forensics and indicate how their major will prepare them for a career in forensics
- majors include but are not limited to: biomedical science, cell & molecular biology, chemistry, biology, medical lab sciences, criminal justice and computing and information systems
-shall be maintaining satisfactory academic progress (SAP) according to the norms established by the University and the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
Financial need may be considered and will be demonstrated by the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Lacks Enterprises Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide assistance to students with their costs of their education, with first priority given to qualified dependents of employees of Lack Enterprises.
Students must have been accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU

Incoming freshmen must have a high school GPA of 2.5
Current GVSU students must have a GPA of 3.0 or greater
Preference given to students majoring in the fields of Engineering and/or Business
Priority consideration will be given to qualified dependents (children or spouses) of Lacks Enterprises’ employees.

Laker Baseball Alumni Leadership Award
This award is intended to reward a member of the GVSU Varsity Baseball team who has taken the additional responsibilities of leadership on and off the field by mentoring younger team members, being accessible to teammates who need advice, or doing what it takes to help teammates or the team reach its goals.
Candidates must be on the GVSU Varsity Baseball Team
Must maintain satisfactory academic progress
Must be full-time student
Must have completed at least one year on GVSU varsity Baseball Team
Application Process: No formal application required, candidates will be identified by GVSU Baseball Coach and Committee. more...

Lakers Go Abroad! Scholarship
$2,000 Study Abroad Scholarship for incoming undergraduate Freshmen
More than 100 incoming Freshmen will be selected each year to receive this $2,000 scholarship, which can be used towards a GVSU approved study abroad program anytime during their 4 years at GVSU. Study abroad is the opportunity to study outside of the United States while earning GVSU credit.
To apply, write a compelling essay (200-500 words) about where you would want to study abroad and why. We encourage you to include how studying abroad would impact you on a personal, professional or academic level. The essay will be the primary consideration for awarding the scholarship, so the committee encourages you to put thought and time into it.
Over 100 scholarships awarded per year.
Eligibility Information:
*Available only to new incoming Freshman undergraduate applicants
*Scholarship requires full-time enrollment and GVSU must be first institution attending after high school
*Awardees are still eligible for additional study abroad scholarships
*To access scholarships after enrollment, awardee must maintain Satisfactory Academic Progress at Grand Valley
*Scholarship must be used within four years after initial enrollment at GVSU, and may only be used on a GVSU-approved, for-credit study abroad program
Applications must be submitted by January 15 for consideration. more...

Lakeshore Human Resource Management Association Annual Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to reduce the financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth.
Recipients of this scholarship must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Be an undergraduate enrolled for 6 credit hours or more in the Human Resources Management program
Have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or better
Be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress according to norms established by the University
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Larry Fields Award In Respiratory Therapy
This award is established by the family of Marianne Bloomfield Wicka in gratitude to Larry Fields, an inspiring teacher in the Respiratory Therapy Program at Macomb Community College. Marianne was a non-traditional student who graduated with high honors from the Respiratory Therapy Program in 1974. She attributed much of her academic achievement to Mr. Field, who actively encouraged her to submit a paper to the Mead Johnson Foundation, for which she won the grand prize. After graduation, Marianne went on to a successful 24-year career as a respiratory therapist at Bi-County Hospital until retirement at age 70. Mr. Fields was the third Program Coordinator for the Respiratory Therapy Program at Macomb Community College. He began his career in 1970 and retired in 2010. He was an outstanding instructor and was well respected by many.
successfully complete the critical thinking paper in the Respiratory Therapy Program
be nominated by the Professor of the critical thinking paper in the Respiratory Therapy Program
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://www.macomb.edu/future-students/programs/respiratory-therapy.html more...

Financial need will be given preference and will be demonstrated by Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable more...

Laura K. Osaer, D.O. Memorial Endowed Scholarship For The Sciences
Established in memory of Laura K. Osaer, D.O. a bright, driven student whose love, compassion and generosity for others was immeasurable. Her life was tragically cut short by a car accident during her final year of medical school. In April 2020, Laura was posthumously awarded her medical degree by The Michigan State University College of Osteopathic Medicine. A lifelong resident of Macomb County, Laura took courses at Macomb Community College during high school and participated in Science Olympiad tournaments hosted annually on Macomb’s campus. Family and friends established this scholarship to share in her memory to continue her legacy of helping others and supporting a student who is passionate about science and learning.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
pursuing a degree in a medical or scientific field
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
exhibit community service
provide a 250-word essay including the following: community service activities with an explanation of how you plan to serve your community upon graduation, and experience participating in Science Olympiad (optional)
preference given to students that have participated in Science Olympiad
award is for tuition, fees and books, and other educational expenses more...

Preference will be given to students who are a single-parent with custodial care of one or more children under the age of eighteen or students who were raised in a single-parent household. Preference will be given to Monroe County, Michigan residents. Selection will be based upon the recipient’s “academic promise”. Preference will be given to students who have faced adversity in their life and are pursuing their educational goals to create a better future for themselves and their families. more...

Law Enforcement Education Program (Leep)
The Law Enforcement Education Program (LEEP) Award is sponsored by the Police Officers Labor Council (POLC) to provide annual financial assistance to pre-service Oakland Police Academy students upon completion of the police academy program.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a pre-service student accepted to the Oakland Police Academy.

MUST have completed the Oakland Police Academy, passed the Michigan Commission on Law Enforcement Standards (MCOLES) certification test; and met the MCOLES
employment standards to become certifiable as a law enforcement officer in Michigan.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
All eligible students will be notified by Police Academy staff of the award and the application process.
In-service/department-sponsored students are not eligible to apply.
The LEEP award is based upon highest overall achievement of non-sponsored applicants. more...

Lee S. Peel Speech Endowed Scholarship
This fund will recognize the academic achievement of OCC Students in Speech, theater and Forensics. Mr. Peel believed that these areas contributed greatly to scholars seeking a fulfilled life.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be registered at Oakland Community College.

MUST be enrolled part-time with 6 credits or more per semester.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST be actively involved in the OCC Forensic Program.

MUST be used for tuition, books and/or other educational expenses

MUST have demonstrated qualities of forensic competence via written documentation from a former forensic teacher, an example speech that is accepted by the current OCC Forensic coach, or the recommendation of
the current OCC forensic coach.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who are actively involved with the Forensic Team. more...

Leslie And Del Corey Family Endowed Scholarship Fund For Veteran & Military Services
The Leslie and Del Corey Scholarship Fund was established in 2017 by Leslie Corey in memory of her husband, Del Corey. Del joined Macomb Community College in 1965 and retired after 30 years of dedicated service in 1995. Del was a veteran, a teacher, a writer, a poet and a friend to all. He served in the Army, 82nd Airborne 1953-1956, during the Korean Conflict. He was forever grateful to the military GI Bill, which without that support; he likely wouldn’t have had a college degree. This scholarship is available for veteran and military services students at Macomb Community College.
preference given to a Macomb County resident
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.5 each semester of award
award is for tuition, fees, books and other educational expenses
applicants must provide a brief summary of their educational goals and how this scholarship will impact them more...

Lila E. Wasson Endowed Memorial Scholarship
The Lila E. Wasson Endowed Memorial Scholarship was established to honor the memory of Lila E. (Jenkins) Wasson. The scholarship recognizes scholastic achievement, encourages continued progress, and provides assistance to students in financing their education.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST enrolled at least part-time (six credit hours or more) at any OCC campus

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST submit a personal statement explaining why they are passionate about education.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given first to prior applicants, and then to new applicants who have completed at least six (6) credit hours at OCC, who demonstrate financial need as determined by the College, and who demonstrate a passion for education.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Lillian B. & Bruce E. Wright Memorial Scholarship

Lily & David Broner Annual Scholarship
Lily Broner taught economics at the Highland Lakes campus from 1982 to 2002. This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward achieving their educational goals. It will be administered according to the following provisions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours at OCC. Transfer credit hours count toward eligibility.

MUST be working toward a Business degree (Accounting – ACC.ABA, Business Administration – BUS.ABA, International Commerce – ICM.INT.AA, or Business Management – MGT.BUS,AAS).

MUST be in good academic standing with a GPA of 2.8 or higher.

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources & Scholarships.

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write thank-you letter

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Lynn Mcnamara Blue '86 Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage promising students to continue their studies at GVSU and to encourage them to utilize the many services provided to ensure student success. Examples of these services include mentoring programs, advising, tutoring, counseling and work-study employment.
Recipients of this scholarship must be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be undergraduate entering their junior year and be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more)
Must have a cumulative GPA between 2.8 and 3.2 on a 4.0 scale
Preference given to those on a path to graduate in four years
Financial need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).

Macomb County Student Of The Week Scholarship
This scholarship is intended to assist students from Macomb County who were recognized as Student of the Week.
All majors qualify
Seniors must have a 3.0 cumulative GPA and an ACT score of 23 or greater or SAT score of 1140 or greater
Students qualify if they are a senior from Macomb County that has been recognized as Student of the Week by Macomb County. Please contact your high school with questions.
Application Process: Just as the merit scholarships, your admissions application to GVSU serves as your application for this scholarship.
Renewal Criteria: Three additional years if the recipient enrolls for and completes an average of 15 credit hours each semester and maintains a 3.0 gpa. more...

Macomb Student Immediate Relief Fund
Created to provide financial assistance for unexpected emergencies such as housing, utilities, food, child care, health care, books, and transportation to Macomb Community College students.
For credit students: Half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award. Applicant must have recently completed a semester at Macomb and/or be currently enrolled in good academic standing (e.g. not on academic probation).
For non-credit students: Enrolled in workforce training program that result in employable skills.
For additional information, please call the Student Options for Success office at 586.447.8609 or email mail:
sos@macomb.edu more...

Macomb Student Study Abroad Scholarship
The Macomb Student Study Abroad Fund supports the goal of Macomb students to travel outside the United States of America in order to broaden socio-cultural awareness and gain global understanding. Monies awarded can be used toward travel costs, tuition, and other related expenses.
travel must be connected to an academic program, a Macomb study abroad program, or a Macomb Multicultural International Initiatives (MMII—approved activity. For more information, go to www.macomb.edu/MMII

at the time of application, students must have successfully completed two semesters or 15 credit hours at Macomb with a 2.0 cumulative GPA

students may be asked by the selection committee to present or share their travel experiences with the college community
include an unofficial student transcript with your application
Applications are due by Feb. 28 each year.
To obtain a Macomb Student Study Abroad Application, please contact the MCC Foundation at 586-445-7302 and foundation@macomb.edu. more...

Madeline Siehling Statistics Pathway Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to help widen the pathway to graduation for students from middle income families who do not qualify for federal need-based aid and are ineligible for many of the government programs intended to help defray the cost of tuition and fees. Support from the Grand Valley community will impact the University’s highest priority and help students from middle income families to avoid indebtedness, archive their goals, and become fully engaged citizens.
Recipients must be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be undergraduate juniors or senior student enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more)
Must be a Statistics major
Must have a cumulative GPA of 3.3
Financial need will be given preference and will be demonstrated by Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed with reapplication provided the recipient(s) continues to meet the qualifications listed above This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

Madison Heights Lodge 551 Endowed Scholarship
This fund is established by the Northwood Ancient-Craft Lodge 551 of Free and Accepted Masons of Madison Heights to encourage achievement and continued progress and to provide assistance to students in financing their training at the Oakland Fire Training Institute or the Oakland Police Academy at Oakland Community College.
Criteria
This award will alternate annually between applicants from the Oakland Police Academy and the Oakland Fire Training Institute. To be eligible for this award, applicants must:
MUST Be enrolled in either the Oakland Police Academy or the Oakland Fire Training Institute at Oakland Community College.

MUST Have demonstrated financial need (determined by the OCC administrators of the Academy or the Institute)

MUST have demonstrated leadership qualities (determined by the OCC administrators of the Academy or the Institute)

MUST be available to meet the donors at an informal dinner in their honor at the donors’ lodge, within six months of graduation, on a date that is mutually agreeable for the
lodge and the recipient.

MUST be used for tuition, books, uniforms and/or equipment

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to residents of Madison Heights or Royal Oak, Michigan, or cadets whose employment is pending with the Madison Heights or Royal Oak Police or Fire Departments. In the absence of such candidates, preference will be given to residents of other Southeastern Oakland County or Southwestern Macomb County communities. more...

Margaret Anderson Scholarship
Established by the S. Gary Spicer, Sr. Foundation, this scholarship is to honor Margaret Anderson for her dedication to teaching Economics at Macomb Community College. Margaret attended Macomb Community College and received her Associate Degree in General Studies in 1992 and an Associate Degree in Applied Science in 1993, then went on to earn her Master’s in Economics. Margaret was a pioneer as she entered the non-traditional role for women becoming the first female Economics adjunct faculty member at Macomb in 2004. Margaret continues to teach and mentor her students to achieve their educational and career goals. This scholarship will assist Macomb Community College students who wish to pursue their studies in Economics, Business, or Finance.
must be a resident of Macomb County
must have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours at Macomb Community College
open to students pursuing their studies in Economics, Business, or Finance at Macomb Community College
preference given to students enrolled in or that have taken an Economics course at time of application
minimum GPA 3.0 upon application
award is based on financial need, FAFSA required
award is used for tuition, fees, books, and college-related expenses
award is renewable upon reapplication if above qualifications are maintained more...

Margie & Don Arsen Endowed Scholarship
Together, Don and Margie Arsen have worked on and established important programs to advance education. These included Teacher of the Year; Select 50, honoring 25 seniors from Waterford Kettering and Waterford Mott high schools; the Margie Arsen Early Childhood Education Fund; the Globetrotters project, rewarding the most improved students at a Detroit public school; and a program to honor the top 10 students at Waterford Durant High School. This endowed scholarship is established in celebration of the Arsens’ lifelong commitment to advancing our community through education.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a graduate of the Waterford Schools.

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition, books or other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

They must be an undergraduate accepted and enrolled in the Kirkhof College of Nursing and shall be making Satisfactory Academic Progress

Preference will be given to candidates who have participated in any health related pre-college programs or federal pre-college programs such as TRIO or Upward Bound.
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is non-renewable more...

Applicant must be enrolled in a health occupation program (e.g., certified nurse aide, practical nursing, phlebotomy technician, or respiratory therapy) or a health-related science curriculum (e.g., biology, chiropractic, chemistry, dentistry, medicine, nursing, occupational therapy, optometry, pharmacy, physical therapy, or physics) at MCCC. Mark A & Elizabeth C. Murray Study Abroad Scholarship
The Mark A. & Elizabeth C. Murray Scholarship for Study Abroad is intended to support students who wish to study outside of the United States but without this fund would otherwise not be able to afford to do so.
Students must be enrolled full-time as degree-seeking students and making satisfactory academic progress. Recipients must be taking for credit coursework outside of the United States of America
Must demonstrate need for financial assistance with travel expenses (airfare, passports, etc.) and show that international study for them would be impossible without such assistance
Filing a FAFSA will help demonstrate financial need. Must have a current FAFSA form on file with GVSU’s Financial Aid office, in order to help demonstrate appropriate financial need
Students must also be planning on participating on an approved for-credit Study Abroad program that involves overseas study for no fewer than 8 weeks
Must have 14 GVSU credit hours and 2.8 GPA or higher more...

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to Nursing Students or students pursuing a degree in a medical related field.
Preference will be given to residents of Farmington/Farmington Hills.

Marney Houseman Macadam Voice Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to reward exceptional voice students by assisting them with the cost of their education at Grand Valley State University (GVSU).
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled as degree seeking students at GVSU.
They must be an undergraduate with 55 or more earned credit hours and enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in Bachelor of Music (voice performance), Bachelor of Music Education (vocal), or Bachelor of Art (vocal emphasis)
Must have a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 or greater and shall be making satisfactory academic progress according to the norms established by the University
Preference will be given to candidates who demonstrate their focus on and concentration in vocal performance
Renewal Criteria: Scholarship is not automatically renewed. If renewed a student may receive the scholarship for up to 4 semesters.

Mary Federlein Memorial Annual Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the family of Mary Federlein. Ms. Federlein was a Mary Federlein, was a daughter, a sister, a wife, a mother, a widow, a grandmother, and a great grandmother during her lifetime. She was born in 1912, died in 2011. She spent most of her life as a single woman breaking barriers in her personal struggle to survive as a single parent at a time when many opportunities and doors were closed to women. She was not a “feminist” and would have denied it, but she was the quintessential advocate in providing a better life for her family.
She along with her mother, an immigrant, owned a business and purchased a home as self-employed single women. She also obtained employment in a large company in spite of being a single mother. Today we take these things for granted, but in her time these were major accomplishments for women on their own.
This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward achieving their educational goals. It will be administered according to the following provisions.
 
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
• MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College (transfer credits included)
• MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits
• MUST have a declared program of study
• MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher
• MUST demonstrate financial need
• MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor
• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
• MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
• MUST be a U.S. Citizen
• MUST have placement into English 1510
• MUST have enrolled in or successfully completed CNS 1150
• MUST be returning to education due to life-changing transitions; including but not limited to economic hardship, underemployment, no employment, single parenthood, divorce
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Mary Jane Dockeray Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist graduating high school seniors from public or private school in the Kent, Muskegon, and Ottawa Intermediate School Districts with an interest in pursuing a career in science.
To qualify students must:
*be a graduate of a public or private school in the Kent, Muskegon, or Ottawa Intermediate School Districts
*enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*have an interest in pursuing a career in science
Application Process: Candidates for this scholarship will complete an application provided by the Financial Aid Office and the Regional Math and Science Center. The application will include submission of a personal essay, a high school transcript, and two recommendations in support of the applicant. https://www.gvsu.edu/rmsc/mary-jane-dockeray-scholarship-24.htm
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Michael David Golds Endowed Success Scholarship
Michael Golds was a talented young man who was diagnosed with ADHD after several years of struggle with the effects of this disorder. He became a successful student at OCC through the assistance of the Project BOLD program. This scholarship is the result of the efforts of his parents, Dr. Jack and Barbara Golds, to keep his memory alive and in appreciation for the role Project BOLD played in his life. more...

Michigan Women Psychologists Endowed Scholarship
The Michigan Women Psychologists Endowed Scholarship was established to offer financial assistance to students attending Oakland Community College Highland Lakes Campus. The award will cover tuition and other educational expenses.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST demonstrate a financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST designate Highland Lakes as your “home” campus

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed (up to 3 times) if the recipient still meets the criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability.
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and financial need. Due date, award amount and number of awards may vary. Contact the College of Technology for more information. more...

Milderd & Charles Kaye Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for full-time undergraduate students enrolled at Wayne State University who are majoring in Accounting. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Mildred And John Krnacik Endowed Scholarship
Established by Mildred and John Krnacik, retired Macomb English faculty member and retired Macomb administrator, to provide scholarship assistance to students intending to seek a four-year degree in English language and literature, biology or chemistry.
enrolled in English or American literature, biology or chemistry courses at Macomb Community College
completed 24 hours of college credit, 12 of which were earned at Macomb Community College
minimum GPA 3.5 each semester of award
full-time enrollment (12 credit hours or more) each semester of award
intend to transfer to a four-year institution to complete a degree majoring in English language and literature, biology or chemistry
two letters of recommendation from Macomb faculty members, including one from the student’s instructor in English, biology or chemistry
submit an essay on “Where I Plan to Be in my Career Fifteen Years from Now” more...

Mildred B. Matthews Scholarship In Art History
Annual award for undergraduate student attending Oakland University in Michigan majoring in Art History. Applicant must be in good standing, have been enrolled in in classes at Oakland University for two consecutive (fall/winter) semesters, have completed 20 credit hours in art history prior to application and demonstrate citizenship within the department or field. Due date varies. more...

Mildred C. Storch Endowed Scholarship
The Mildred C. Storch Endowed Scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students enrolled in a business curriculum.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours at Oakland Community College.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0.

MUST be enrolled in the Business Administration program (BUS.ABA)

MUST be a U.S. citizen.

MUST attend full-time

MUST be a resident of Oakland County.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Military Order Of The Purple Heart Service Foundation Endowed Scholarship
Established by the Military Order of the Purple Heart Service Foundation to provide funding for veterans and their spouses.
copy of marriage license if spouse is applying
must be an honorably discharged veteran of the U.S. Armed Forces or spouse of an honorably discharged veteran. If the veteran dies, the spouse remains eligible unless the spouse remarries a non-veteran
veteran’s military discharge form (DD214, member 4 or WD AGO 53-55)
minimum GPA 2.0 each semester of award
applicants who receive Veterans Educational Benefits are not eligible
copy of Michigan driver’s license or document verifying home address
awards are made on a semester basis; applicants can reapply for future semesters, pending funds available more...

Mmpa Scholarships At Michigan State University
Scholarship for undergraduate students at Michigan State University enrolled in the Institute of Agricultural Technology in the Dairy Management Program. Applicants must be members of the MMPA or children of members, enrolled full-time, have a minimum 2.0 GPA, do placement training somewhere other than the family farm, and pursue a career in dairy farming. Due date may vary. Renewable. Contact the financial aid office or the Association for more information and/or application. more...

Monroe County Community College Alumni Scholarship
Providing scholarship(s) for a student nominated in writing by one MCCC Alumni Association member in good standing at the time of nomination. The applicant must maintain part-time (6 credit hours per semester) enrollment at MCCC during their scholarship year. An essay discussing why the applicant should be selected to receive this scholarship including their educational and professional goals and other information to help determine financial need must accompany application. more...

Monroe Exchange Club A.C.E. Scholarship
Providing a scholarship to a Monroe County, Michigan resident. Applicant must have a well defined course of study and be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours per semester for Fall and Winter semesters). Additional consideration may be given to Monroe Exchange Club Junior Exchange Program participants, and preference is given to graduates of Ida, Jefferson, Monroe, and St. Mary’s Catholic Central High Schools.
The A.C.E. Award was created to recognize high school seniors who have redirected their lives through a dramatic change in their attitude and academic performance. The recipient of this scholarship will be further nominated by the Monroe Exchange Club for the Michigan District Exchange Club’s A.C.E. Award. If the student is selected at the District level, s/he will receive an additional $1,000 scholarship and become eligible for consideration by the National Exchange Club for a $10,000 award as the national winner. more...

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have financial need

MUST use for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Nadia E. Boulos, Phd, Rn Endowed Scholarship
In June 2011, Nadia E. Boulos, PhD, RN and Dean of Nursing and Health Professions and Technologies retired from Oakland Community College after 25 years. This scholarship was named to recognize and celebrate her years of leadership, achievement, and service to the nursing profession.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 20 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST have a minimum of 3.0 GPA


MUST be enrolled part-time

MUST be accepted into the Nursing program

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses (books, scrubs, etc. per students’ discretion)

MUST write an essay based on an annual theme.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Nathan Warshaw Endowed Memorial Fund
The Nathan Ben Warshaw Endowed Scholarship was established to encourage continued progress in the Chef’s Apprenticeship Program and provide assistance to students in financing their culinary education.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward eligibility.

MUST be enrolled in the Chef’s Apprenticeship Program curriculum with a minimum GPA of 2.0.

MUST have demonstrated leadership and a love of cooking.

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

New Chance Scholarship Fund
The donor established the New Chance Scholarship, because she experienced the challenge of supporting herself while pursuing her higher education. She values her time at Oakland Community College and the quality and affordability of the education it offers. She would like to help current OCC students in similar life circumstances to achieve their goals through this scholarship.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a resident of Oakland County.

MUST have demonstrated minimum high school GPA of 3.0 or a minimum cumulative OCC GPA of 2.0


MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be a U.S. Citizen.

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who have struggled to return to higher education due to circumstances such as domestic violence, divorce, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, or difficult life-changing transitions.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

New Horizon Landscape Scholarship

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST designate Orchard Ridge campus as your “home” campus

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
