Nina Zevlever And Fira Friedman Memorial Scholarship For Working Students
This scholarship was established in memory of Nina Zevlever and Fira Friedman to provide financial assistance to Macomb Community College students enrolled in a STEM-related career program. While not having the opportunity to attend college themselves, both Nina and Fira instilled the value of education in their respective children and grandchildren. To commemorate their lives dedicated to helping others, this scholarship is intended to assist dedicated students juggling work and school responsibilities achieve their educational goals.
half-time enrollment (6 credits or more) each semester of award
must have completed at least 12 credit hours at Macomb Community College
enrolled in a STEM program
preference given to students working full-time. Letter from student’s employer verifying full-time work status is required
minimum 3.3 GPA required. Award based on merit. Applicant with the highest GPA will be given preference
award is for tuition, fees, and other educational expenses
award can be used toward credit or non-credit courses more...

Nmc Divisional Scholarship

Nn Autocam Precision Components Group Engineering Scholarship
This scholarship is designed to encourage students who are interested in practical engineering and educate young people about the changes in the advanced manufacturing field that have taken place over the last 20 years. By providing scholarship support to students from Michigan who may have limited exposure to manufacturing, they hope to raise awareness among college aged populations about advanced manufacturing and ultimately improve the image of manufacturing that is portrayed in popular culture.
Must be entering your sophomore year at GVSU

Must be enrolled full-time in the Seymour and Esther Padnos College of Engineering and Computing
Must declare a major in engineering
Must maintain a cumulative grade point average of 3.0 and be making satisfactory academic progress
Must be a Michigan Resident
Renewal Criteria: Renewable
Scholarships will support a junior for a total of 2 years (6 semesters)
Finalists will be contacted by faculty and staff of the Engineering Scholarship Committee for an interview, and asked to sign a release to share your resume with Autocam. In addition to the scholarship, Autocam encourages students to apply for internship and co-op opportunities at Autocam. Autocam may contact you about future opportunities with their company. more...

Noel H. And Elizabeth R. Dentner Scholarship
Providing scholarship for tuition and fees for full-time (at least 12 billable contact hours) students during Fall and Winter semesters. Applicant must have a 2.75 or greater GPA, must submit a personal statement discussing educational and professional goals, and must be a Monroe County, Michigan resident. Scholarship is renewable for a second year. Student will be nominated by a Summerfield High School counselor. If no nomination is made, the scholarship may be awarded to a graduate of a Monroe County public high school who meets all other requirements. Financial need may be considered. more...

Noordhoorn Family Endowment
The Noordhoorn Family Endowment was established in appreciation of Oakland Community College’s role in bringing about significant changes in the lives of its students through its academic programs.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
• MUST be enrolled in the General Studies curriculum at least part-time (6 credit hours).
• MUST have completed at least 25 hours of instruction at Oakland Community College that will be counted toward eligibility when the student transfers to a four year college or university.
• MUST have a minimum cumulative grade point average of 3.25. This g.p.a. must be earned in credits hours that are eligible to transfer to four year college or university.
• MUST be used for tuition and books
• MUST plan on transferring to an accredited four year college or university.
• MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.
• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
• MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to students with Highland Lakes Campus as their home campus. more...

O'rilley Endowed Scholarship
This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College to scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward achieving their educational goals. It will be administered according to the following provisions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST be a U.S. citizen

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships.

MUST be used for tuition, books, and other educational expenses

MUST write thank-you letter to donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be enrolled in the Dental Hygiene (DHY) program.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


MUST demonstrate financial need

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST submit a brief statement (one-page or less) regarding the reasons for applying for this scholarship.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to students who have designated Highland Lakes as their “home” campus

Occ Foundation Endowment
An all-volunteer Board of Directors governs the OCC Foundation. Directors are recruited from business, civic, and education leaders in Oakland County and the region, and elected to three-year renewable terms. The Board of Directors provides this scholarship and some have their own endowments, to make sure that students’ receive an affordable and accessible education.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST have a minimum cumulative 2.5 GPA


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition and fees

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Occupational Therapy Assistant Student Leadership Organizational Endowed Scholarship
Established by Macomb Community College Occupational Therapy Assistant (OTA) Student Leadership Organization in memory of fellow students and alumni of the OTA program. The scholarship is offered to students in the OTA program to help them achieve their academic and professional development goals as a future Occupational Therapy Assistant.
• must have completed one semester in the MCC OTA program
• minimum GPA 3.0 or higher
• essay requirements are based on application for one or both awards and should describe applicant’s educational and career goals including an explanation that reflects the student’s intentions and needs
o if applying for one award, a minimum 750 word essay is required
o if applying for both award, a minimum 1500 word essay is required
• academic award is for tuition, fees, books and other educational expenses
• professional development award is for expenses related to attending the AOTA annual conference
• one $500 academic scholarship and one $250 professional development scholarship will be awarded annually based on funds available. The same applicant is eligible to receive both awards
• If you are not selected to be awarded, please re-apply for the following academic year more...

Otis M. Smith Scholarship
Annual award for female residents of Wayne, Oakland or Macomb counties, Michigan who are single mothers that wish to attend Wayne State University, the University of Michigan, or the Catholic University Law School in Washington, D.C.. Applicants must have demonstrated financial need; show efforts to contribute to household and educational expenses through employment or strong effort to gain employment; have exemplary character and leadership; and demonstrate academic ability to successfully complete post-secondary education. Priority is given to full-time students, but part-time students may also be considered. Nonrenewable. more...

Pamella And Daniel G. Devos Musical Theatre Scholarship
This scholarship was created to support upper-level GVSU students majoring in the arts.
Candidates must be entering undergraduate junior (55 credit hours) standing or above
Must be accepted as a degree-seeking student in the Bachelor of Music Vocal Performance, Bachelor of Music Education or Bachelor of Arts in Dance major curricula
Must demonstrate a focus on and concentration in musical theater performance

Transfer students must be accepted by GVSU, the Department of Music and Dance for enrollment and recipients must be attending the University to be eligible to receive this scholarship

Established to provide financial assistance to Macomb Community College students seeking education and training in careers related to metal fabrication. Established by donors to build the future workforce for the manufacturing and maintenance industries.
• open to incoming freshman or currently enrolled students in good standing
• award is for tuition, fees and other educational expenses
• optional: Letter of recommendation
• optional: Essay explaining how this scholarship will impact your education and career goals. Including any financial need or challenges.
• must be in enrolled in one of the associate degrees or certificate programs in manufacturing and maintenance listed below:
Welding basic and advanced
Machine Repair
Maintenance Technician
Millwright
Quality Technology Fundamentals
Sheet Metal Model Maker more...

Parent Family Endowed Scholarship
Oakland Community College faculty members, Dr. Marvin E. Parent and his son Jeffrey S. Parent, established the Parent Family Endowed Scholarship to recognize student scholastic achievement and to encourage continued progress at Oakland Community College. This fund was also established to forever honor the loving memory of Samuel H. Parent and Carlene Parent.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 and a maximum of 90 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours count toward eligibility.

MUST be enrolled full-time.

MUST have demonstrated scholastic achievement with a minimum 3.5 GPA.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students working toward the Associate in Science degree (ASC.ASC).
Preference will be given to student who demonstrated qualities of leadership.
Preference will be given to students who designate Auburn Hills, Royal Oak or Southfield campus.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Patricia Fitzsimmons Kellogg Endowed Scholarship
The scholarships awarded from this fund will help students in the Early Childhood Education program at OCC, who, like Patricia Kellogg, dedicate their lives to creating safe and encouraging places for all young children to grow. While Mrs. Kellogg never lived in Oakland County, or Michigan, her wishes live on with her children, one a former resident of Oakland County. The scholarship will cover tuition and other educational expenses including childcare.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
• MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours at Oakland Community College Transfer credit hours count toward eligibility.
• MUST demonstrate scholastic achievement with a 2.5 GPA or higher.
• MUST be enrolled in the Early Child Education (ECE.AAS) major.
• MUST demonstrate financial need as determined by Student Financial Resources & Scholarships.
• Must write a thank-you letter to the donor.
• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
• MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Patrick Baldwin Endowed Scholarship
Patrick Baldwin was a former student of Oakland Community College who lost his life to depression. Patrick was a wonderful young man. He made friends easily and was always there with a ready smile on his face and a helping hand. Patrick was a multi-talented individual, he excelled at whatever he set himself to. He was artistic, athletic, and had a wicked sense of humor. The world lost him far too soon when he succumbed to the depression he had been fighting so valiantly.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have experienced suicide in their family.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST be in the Mental Health/Social Work program or be a self-sponsored “First Responder” student.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to applicants who demonstrate financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources & Scholarships.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Paul B. Henry Congressional Internship Award
The Henry Internship places a GVSU student in the Washington, D.C. offices of one of Michigan’s U.S. Representative or Senators during the spring/summer session. The Paul B. Henry Foundation pays for a scholarship of $2,000 for travel and living expenses, and Henry Interns receive a tuition waiver for up to 6 credits.
To be eligible, students must have completed a minimum of 55 credits by the end of Winter semester and are expected to report about their experiences to the GVSU community during the next academic year. Any major may apply more...

Performing Music Scholarship - Band
Providing scholarship assistance for a full-time student enrolled in a minimum of twelve (12) credit hours per semester fall and winter and maintain a cumulative 2.2 GPA. Applicants must perform a solo or an etude, and provide a pianist where accompaniment is required; play five of the scales listed in the MSBOA Proficiency I or II guidelines; and play a short selection of sight reading (music provided) for the audition before the Director of the Monroe County Community College. Band Recipient must participate in the MCCC Band during their scholarship period. Recipient must be a Monroe County, Michigan resident. more...

Performing Music Scholarship - Choir
Providing scholarship assistance for a full-time student enrolled in a minimum of twelve (12) credit hours per semester fall and winter and maintain a cumulative 2.2 GPA. Applicants must perform a prepared solo and some sight singing for the audition before the Director of the Monroe County Community College Agora Chorale. Recipient must participate in the Agora Chorale during their scholarship period. Recipient must be a Monroe County, Michigan resident. more...

Philip Peter Versluis Criminal Justice Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is provide encouragement and financial support to criminal justice students.
Recipients must be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be undergraduate Junior or Senior
Must be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more)
Declared major in Criminal Justice or Legal Studies
Must have cumulative GPA of 3.2 or higher
Must be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress standards according to the University
Preference will be given to students from Kent, Ottawa, Muskegon, and Allegan counties
Financial need will be given preference and will be demonstrated by Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient(s) continues to meet the qualifications listed above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

The donors desire is to help the Trust steward the legacy of Phillip and Elizabeth Filmer.

To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST reside in Oakland County.

MUST have completed a minimum of 32 credit hours of instruction at OCC, including transfer credit hours.

MUST demonstrate scholastic achievement with a minimum 2.5 GPA.

MUST be enrolled part-time.

MUST demonstrate financial need as determined by the OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships.

MUST be working toward an Associate Degree: Applied Science(AAS), Arts (AA.AA), Business Administration (BUS.ABA), General Studies (GEN.AGS), or Science(ASC.ASC)

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students age 25 or older. more...

Photography Scholarship
The Photography Scholarship is intended to recognize scholastic achievement and exceptional talent in the photographic arts, and to enable students at both the Royal Oak and Orchard Ridge campuses to continue their education in photography during the academic year.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours at Oakland Community College.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


MUST be enrolled in the Photography curriculum.

MUST designate Royal Oak or Orchard Ridge as home campus.

MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. citizen.

MUST submit a portfolio of 4 to 6 photographs; matted prints (darkroom or inkjet).

MUST must write a brief summary of how this scholarship will assist with completing their educational goals.
Must demonstrate financial need (as determined by the OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships). Students receiving Federal direct loans or work-study will not be considered for the scholarship.

MUST be used for tuition, books, course materials and supplies, and transportation expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
A jury shall be made up of faculty members from the RO and OR photography departments for each respective campus (2 from Analog Photography and 2 from Digital Photography) to select the recipients of this award according to College policies and procedures.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Phạm Đình Thám Dominic Memorial Scholarship (Pham Dinh Tham)
The purpose of this scholarship is to assist Vietnamese students with the cost of their education at GVSU.
To qualify, students must:
*have been accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate
*be enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in any course of study
*have a cumulative grade point average of at least 2.85
*declare their racial/ethnic origin as Asian/Pacific Islander and be of Vietnamese descent
Financial Need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may not be renewed. more...

Plant Services Personnel Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to qualified descendants of physical plant service (PSP) employees who are Maintenance/Grounds/Service (MGS) and Police Staff employees and retirees.
Must meet GPA and ACT standards set for admission by GVSU

Must be enrolled full (12 credits) or part-time (6 credits) in good academic standing.
Be a biological, adopted or stepchild of an employee with one and one half years or more of seniority in a permanent position currently working for GVSU in MGS or Police Staff
Be nominated by a single employee or a couple without children with one and a half or more years of seniority in MGS or Police Staff. A single individual, or a couple without children, may nominate cousins, siblings, nephews, or nieces, one time in any five year period. A letter from both the nominee and employee will be required with the application or renewal application detailing the duration and closeness of the relationship.
Be a grandchild of an employee or retiree with five or more years of seniority with MGS or Police Staff.
Be a child/grandchild or a voluntarily terminated or a laid-off employee with at least one and one half years or more of seniority for children to qualify and five years or more of seniority for grandchildren.
Be a child/grandchild of a deceased employee with at least one and one half years or more of seniority for children and five years or more of seniority for grandchildren to be eligible.
Financial need is not required.
Renewal Criteria: Recipients must reapply every year to be eligible for scholarship. more...

Plante & Moran Accounting Scholarship
This fund is established for students at Oakland Community College to scholastic achievement, encourage their continued progress, and provide financial assistance toward achieving their educational goals. It will be administered according to the following provisions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
MUST have completed a minimum of 24 credits at Oakland Community College (transferred credits count toward eligibility)

MUST be enrolled full-time (12 credits or more)

MUST be seeking an Associate Degree in Accounting (ACC.ABA)

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.25


MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. citizen

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write thank-you letter to donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Plante Moran Accounting Scholarship
Plante & Moran PLLC established a scholarship for undergraduate GVSU accounting students. To be eligible, students must have an interest in a career in public accounting and a desire to work in the Midwest; strong work ethic, leadership skills, and interpersonal skills. Strong personal qualities, such as a high level of enthusiasm, integrity, professionalism, and reliability. Recipients are expected to demonstrate good scholarship, interpersonal skills, and continued involvement in the community.
Students must be full-time undergraduates and Accounting majors
Must demonstrate good interpersonal skills and continues involvement in the business community
Must have overall GPA of 3.3 (overall and in major)
Must have completed ACC 310
Application Process: To apply for this scholarship complete the School of Accounting Scholarship Application. more...

Pocohontas Scholarship

Polc Richard R. Weiler Police Academy Scholarship
On August 13, 1993, Richard Weiler started the union organization known as the Police Officers Labor Council (POLC). Subsequently, scholarships were awarded by the POLC through the Law Enforcement Education Program (LEEP) to prospective public safety candidates to continue their education. Now, in his honor, in an effort to assist future public safety candidates, the POLC has established this scholarship.
Applications will be reviewed by Macomb’s Police Academy scholarship committee and one police cadet will be awarded from each academy class as the scholarship committee deems worthy.
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://macomb.academicworks.com/opportunities/flexible.html" more...

Police Officers & Firefighters Survivor Tuition Scholarship
Annual award for Michigan residents, who are the child or spouse of a Michigan police officer or firefighter killed in the line of duty, and are undergraduate students attending the University of Michigan-Ann Arbor. Applicants must have demonstrated financial need. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. Renewable. more...

Polish Heritage Society Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to students from West Michigan who are of Polish decent. Scholarships will be awarded based on the following criteria:
Must be a full-time student with a minimum 2.75 GPA

All recipients must be of Polish decent, and provide a brief statement (signed and dated) delineating their heritage
Financial need will be taken into consideration
All applications must be received by the Financial Aid Office by March 15
GVSU will provide the Polish Heritage Society with the applications. The Polish Heritage Society will select the recipients, and notify the Financial Aid Office of the dollar amount that the recipient will be awarded. This will be done within one month of receiving the list of scholarship candidates. more...

Professor Henry W. Anderson Culinary Arts Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Established in memory of Professor Anderson, who was instrumental in the initial planning of the culinary arts facility at Macomb’s Center Campus. He began the culinary program in 1967 and served as baking and management instructor until he retired in 2001. He had a desire for student success and a passion for baking.
student must be entering second semester in the Macomb Culinary Institute
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
award is for tuition and educational expenses
brief biography describing education and career goals in culinary arts and /or hospitality industry
two letters of recommendation must accompany the application. Recommendation letter cannot be from a
Macomb Community College culinary arts instructor more...

Providence Hospital Endowed Nursing Scholarship
The Providence Hospital Endowed Nursing scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed between 12 and 90 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST Be accepted into the Nursing Program (NUR.AASX, NUR.RNE.AASX, NUR.TPN.AAS or NUR.AAS) at Oakland Community College.

MUST have a minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA


MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST provide documentation (i.e. letters of reference, news clippings, copies of certificates or awards) of demonstrated leadership skills and community involvement.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Recreation Leadership Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to recognize and reward student leaders who are involved in recreational sports, programs, services, and activities, who demonstrate a high degree of leadership aptitudes, initiative, and dedication to University recreation.
Recipients must be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU.
Must be enrolled full-time (at least 12 credit hours) in any course of study.
Must have a cumulative 2.5 GPA or higher.
Preference will be given to students involved in recreational sports, programs, or services offered through Campus Recreation or related programs.
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship is non-renewable. more...

Recreation Leadership Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to recognize and reward student leaders who are involved in recreational sports, programs, services, and activities, who demonstrate a high degree of leadership aptitudes, initiative, and dedication to University recreation.
Recipients of this scholarship shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

The Regents Scholarship is available to new students at Eastern Michigan University. Freshmen must have a minimum 3.7 GPA and a minimum 25 ACT/1150 SAT score. Transfer students must have at least a 3.7 GPA. You must also live in the university residence halls for the first two years if you receive this renewable award. more...

Richard & Nancy Thompson Endowed Scholarship
The Richard and Nancy Thompson Endowed scholarship was established to honor the sixth College Chancellor and his wife, Richard and Nancy Thompson. It is also to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed between 12 and 90 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College are eligible for scholarship funds through the Oakland Community College Foundation. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST be at least part-time

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be ineligible for financial aid but demonstrate evidence of financial need

MUST be used for tuition and educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to adult students working half-time or more, with family responsibilities and no employer-provided support more...

MUST be enrolled in the Police Academy at Auburn Hills campus

MUST be the top (agency sponsored) marksman in his/her class.

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Richard Berkfield, Jr. & Karen Swift Berkfield Endowed Scholarship
Richard and Karen Berkfield both value education as a way to change a person’s life for the better. Education is a means to enhance literacy, raise personal expectations and create prosperity.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST not have already completed an Associate’s or higher degree.

MUST have demonstrated qualities of leadership or community service (résumé required).

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources and Scholarships.

MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. Citizen.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Richard Wheeler First Responder Memorial Scholarship
This scholarship will benefit dependents of first responders who have fallen while putting their lives on the line for our communities, families and friends. To be eligible the student must:
Be a spouse or surviving child of the fallen who served as a first responder. This would include firefighters, paramedics and police
Be a Michigan resident as defined by the Grand Valley residency policy
Be admitted as a degree seeking undergraduate student
Annually file the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Be attending Grand Valley full-time
Be meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress
Renewal Criteria: Can receive for a maximum of 8 semesters more...

Robert And Lillian Tegel Endowed Scholarship
Established in 2015 by Lillian Tegel in memory of her husband, Robert J. Tegel. Robert (“Bob”) Tegel was a metal pattern maker, who got his start in the skilled trade through training at Henry Ford Trade School in the 1950’s. Because of his training, and his strong work ethic, Bob obtained employment that not only enabled him to provide for his family, but also utilize his talents and creativity. The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to Macomb Community College students enrolled in the Applied Technology & Apprenticeship Program, who emulates the work ethic and creativity of Bob Tegel.
half-time enrollment (6 credits or more) in Engineering & Advanced Technology each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.0 each semester of award
preference to Macomb County residents
applicant must provide a brief summary of their educational and career goals (up to 200 words)
letter of reference from a prior/current teacher
award is for tuition, books, fees, and educational expenses more...

Robert Austin Memorial Scholarship
Robert (Bob) Austin was employed as an adjunct faculty member at Oakland Community College at the Highland Lakes Campus, teaching Accounting and Finance. After he retired from the family business, he continued teaching and began tutoring accounting students in the Access and ASC Departments at the OCC Orchard Ridge campus.
Criteria
To be eligible for this scholarship, applicants:
MUST have completed 12 credit hours or more at OCC.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. Citizen.

MUST be pursuing a degree in Accounting or Finance

MUST designate Highland Lakes or Orchard Ridge as “home campus.”

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to students who provide documentation of leadership skills, to students who are 25 years or older, and to students employed for three years or longer who are returning to school to further their career. A written explanation of your situation is required. more...

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
_Preference given to the lowest GPA._ more...

Robert Roelofs Memorial Scholarship
The Robert Roelofs Endowed Memorial scholarship was established to honor the memory of third College President (Chancellor), Robert Roelofs. It is also to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses (including transportation)

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to a student taking classes in one of these technical fields; Automotive (AUS.AAS), Construction Management (CMN.AAS), Engineering/Technology or Manufacturing (EMIT) more...

Rolland C. Thayer Iii Memorial Endowed Firefighters
Rolland was born November 26th 1957 at Pontiac General Hospital. He was a resident of Waterford, as a child and graduated at Kettering High School in 1975. July 3rd 1983 Rolland hired on to the Pontiac Fire Department and retired after 25 years of service. He loved his job along with the Brotherhood. Rolland was a very vivacious person and loved life, his family and friends.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a current student in the Basic Fire Academy of the Oakland Fire Training Institute of Oakland Community College.

MUST meet all general and physical requirements of the Oakland Fire Academy and have submitted an application to the Oakland Fire Academy.

MUST be available to meet the donors at the fire academy graduation ceremony and/or the OCC Foundation’s Annual Scholarship Luncheon.

MUST agree that if the student does not complete the Basic Fire Academy, the scholarship is forfeited.

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership or community service (as determined by the OCC Administrators of the Fire Training Institute)

MUST demonstrate financial need (as determined by the OCC Administrators of the Fire Training Institute)

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST send a thank-you note to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Ronald J. Buchanan And Linda G. Buchanan Endowment Scholarship
Ronald and Linda Buchanan established this scholarship to continue their legacy of helping students learn. Mr. Buchanan was a tutor nearly 20 years at the Auburn Hills campus. This scholarship reflects their dedication to education and to Oakland Community College.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST designate Auburn Hills campus as your "home"campus

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST demonstrate financial need (as determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST be a U.S. Citizen or eligible non-U.S. citizen

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Roof Family Foundation Scholarship
Scholarship to be used for tuition, fees, books and supplies. Applicants must be a first time in any college (FTIAC) student who enrolls in an occupational program with the intent to complete a program of study at Monroe County Community College and immediately enter the workforce. Recipient must be a full-time student at MCCC during their scholarship year. Full-time enrollment is defined at twelve (12) billable contact hours or more during the fall and winter semesters. The scholarship will be awarded equally between two (2) consecutive school years and divided between each the fall and winter semesters of each year. The scholarship will be awarded to a first year incoming student who is a resident of Monroe County, Michigan, a United States citizen and a graduate of a Monroe County, Michigan high school. Preference should be given to a graduate of Dundee Community Schools, Dundee, Michigan. The recipient must have at least a 2.8 GPA. The scholarship will be renewed for a second year if the recipient has earned a minimum of twenty-four (24) billable contact hours and has maintained at least a 2.8 GPA. more...

Rosie & Samuel "Sam" Geeter Memorial Endowed Scholarship
The family and friends of the Geeter family established scholarships honoring the Rosie & Samuel “Sam” Geeter. * Rosie and Samuel “Sam” Geeter *were the proud parents of 17 children. They met and married in their home state of Mississippi prior to relocating to Michigan, where Rosie was a stay-at-home mom and Sam worked for General Motors for many years. While they both barely had a formal high school education, they knew the importance of a good education and instilled this love of learning in all of their children.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed at least 12 credit hours at Oakland Community College (transfer credits count toward eligibility)

MUST have a minimum GP A of 2.5


MUST demonstrate financial need as determined by Student Financial Resources & Scholarships

MUST be working toward the Associate in Business Administration degree (BUS.ABA)

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students pursuing a degree in Business Administration with a Business Management option (MOT.BUS.AAS)
Preference will be given to residents of the City of Pontiac
Preference will be given to graduates of Pontiac Central High School (or Pontiac High)
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

This program connects students with a variety of community and public benefit organizations to help them with living expenses while pursuing higher education. Services include:
Public Benefits Application Assistance
College and Community Resource Referral
Financial Strategies and Money Management
Emergency Assistance Fund

Sarah Weiner Keidan Endowed Paralegal
The Sarah Weiner Keidan Endowed Paralegal Program Scholarship was established in honor and memory of Sarah Weiner Keidan who was instrumental in seeking and acquiring American Bar Association approval/accreditation for the Paralegal Program. Sarah Weiner Keidan served as Director of the Program from 1990 to 2001. She also was dedicated to OCC as a professor of Political Science (for more than three decades) as well as an individual interested in furthering the College’s continuing commitment toward providing a quality education to its students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants must:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community

MUST have a minimum GPA of 3.5


MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST be enrolled either full or part-time

MUST be enrolled in the Paralegal Program

MUST designate Orchard Ridge as home campus

MUST demonstrate qualities of leadership and an interest in a Paralegal career (Requires written documentation of demonstrated skills; either an essay, resumé or letter(s) of recommendation.

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

School Of Accounting Scholarship Application
Students enrolled in the BBA with an accounting major or the MSA or MST program with an overall cumulative GPA of 3.2 and an Accounting GPA of 3.5 or higher and who have completed ACC 310 are invited to apply for scholarships offered through the School of Accounting. Complete this scholarship application to be considered for all of the School of Accounting Scholarships available (listed below).
Richard H. Giles Memorial Scholarship
H. James Williams Scholarship
GVSU Accounting Alumni Scholarship
BDO USA International Accounting Scholarship

School Of Business Administration Alumni Association Endowed Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate and graduate students enrolled at Wayne State University who are majoring in Business Administration. Selection based on academic achievement, leadership, character, contribution to the School of Business Administration, and potential. Undergraduate students must have a minimum 2.7 GPA in business courses. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

School Of Business Alumni Affiliate Scholarship
Annual award for undergraduates who are juniors and seniors attending Oakland University in Michigan and have declared a major in the School of Business Administration. Applicants must have completed 59 credits and have a minimum 3.0 GPA. Due date and number of awards varies. more...

School Of Management Student Research Scholarship
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending the University of Michigan-Flint. Applicants must complete a student research application form and submit a written statement outlining the proposed research project: its goals, value, progress to-date, and any other potential funding sources. Applicants must submit a letter of recommendation from a UM-Flint faculty member sponsoring the student research. Due date, number of awards and award amount varies. more...

Scott D. Vance Memorial Math Annual Scholarship
The Scott D. Vance Memorial Math scholarship was established as a memorial to Scott Vance. Scott was a student, tutor, and supplemental instructor at OCC in the Math department.
*Criteria *
To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
MUST be in good standing at Oakland Community College.

MUST compete in the competitive Student Math League Exam.

MUST read a biography of Scott.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST send a thank-you letter.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Scott D. Vance Memorial Math Endowed Scholarship
The Scott D. Vance Memorial Math scholarship was established as a memorial to Scott Vance. Scott was a student, tutor, and supplemental instructor at OCC in the Math department.

Scott D. Whitener Memorial Scholarship

Scott M. Dykstra Oliver Products Company Engineering Scholarship
This scholarship was created with the desire to provide opportunities for other engineering students to achieve their education and a career in engineering.
Candidates must have applied by February 1 and be accepted. First year students may be considered.
Students must be enrolled as a full-time undergraduate with a minimum of 12 credits pre-Engineering or declared engineering student in the School of Engineering.
Must have completed at least 6 units of HS math and science courses and have a 3.0 cumulative.
First year students must have a math sub score 27 ACT/ 665 SAT and composite score 25 ACT/ 1210 SAT.
Must have a cumulative 3.0 GPA either in high school (if first year student) or in another accredited college or university (transfer student) and must be a degree-seeking
Renewal Criteria: May be renewed for a max of (8) semesters if student meets the qualifications required by the Padnos School of Engineering more...

Scottish Arts Scholarship - Alma College
The Scottish Arts Scholarship is available to students demonstrating a high level of skill in Highland dancing or piping at Alma College. An audition is required to be eligible for this award. more...

Second Chance Grant
The Second Chance Grant was established to give adult learners an opportunity to receive financial assistance to achieve their educational goals, even if not eligible for federal financial assistance. Grant criteria are as follows:
returning to Macomb Community College after leaving for three or more years
cumulative GPA below 2.0
complete the Student Options for Success Intake form (indicate 2nd Chance Grant in comments)
meet with a counselor to develop a plan of action to meet your educational goals
financial need (FAFSA required)
maximum 6 credit hour enrollment each semester of award
award is for tuition, fees and books
renewable based on application each semester
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://www.macomb.edu/future-students/student-resources/counseling-academic-advising/student-options-success.html more...

Second District American Legion Monroe County Annual Scholarship
The funds from this scholarship will provide support for veterans and/or their children attending MCCC on a full-time basis and to be used for tuition, fees, books and supplies. Applicant must have received an honorable discharge and submit a copy of the veteran’s DD-214 to the Financial Aid Office. The applicant must be a Monroe County, Michigan, resident, must be graduating from high school and entering their first year of college at MCCC. more...

Seidman College Of Business Study Abroad Scholarship (Spring/Summer, Fall And Academic Year)
This scholarship is part of the Seidman College of Business Study Abroad Scholarship program. It provides financial support and recognition to business students who study in a foreign country.
Full-time undergraduate or full-time/part-time graduate business majors
Must have completed a minimum of 12 credits at GVSU

Study abroad application must be accepted by the Padnos International Center
Good academic standing / Strong academic credentials
Must demonstrate financial need
Students must be willing to promote study abroad when they return to GVSU
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
Note: This application serves as the application for Seidman Study Abroad Scholarship, Fred A. Bell Business Scholarship and Paul and Sue Spindler Accounting Study Abroad Scholarship.
This scholarship has multiple opportunities. Please apply for the scholarship posting for the semester you will be studying abroad. more...

Seidman College Of Business Study Abroad Scholarship (Winter)
This scholarship is part of the Seidman College of Business Study Abroad Scholarship program. It provides financial support and recognition to business students who study in a foreign country.
Winter Semester Study Abroad: Apply by November 1
Spring/Summer and Fall Semester Study Abroad: Apply to the Seidman College of Business Study Abroad Scholarship (Spring/Summer, Fall and Academic Year). Application period opens November 1 through March 1.
Full-time undergraduate or full-time/part-time graduate business majors
Must have completed a minimum of 12 credits at GVSU

Study abroad application must be accepted by the Padnos International Center
Good academic standing / Strong academic credentials
Must demonstrate financial need
Students must be willing to promote study abroad when they return to GVSU
Renewal Criteria: Non-renewable
This scholarship has multiple opportunities. Please apply for the scholarship posting for the semester you will be studying abroad.
Note: This application serves as the application for Seidman Study Abroad Scholarship and Fred A. Bell Business Scholarship. more...

Selma Rankins Memorial Scholarship
The scholarship is to be used for tuition, fees and books. Students applying must intend to pursue a career in education. The scholarship will be awarded to a student who is a resident of Monroe County, Michigan, a United States citizen and a graduate of a Monroe County, Michigan high school. Preference will be given to a graduate of Monroe Public Schools, Monroe, Michigan. Recipient must have and maintain at least a 2.5 GPA. Financial need will be considered. more...

Senator Gil Di Nello Memorial Endowed Scholarship
This scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, to encourage academic growth, and to encourage and to support those students who take an interest in civic and political affairs of Macomb County.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
recipients may reapply on a yearly basis
applicants must submit an essay on the student’s views on the role of local/county government in state lawmaking. The essay should also include the applicant’s personal goals and their role in community service
applicants must provide proof that they are a registered voter in Macomb County
recipients will be selected on the basis of their statement, commitment to achieving their educational goals and compliance with scholarship criteria
financial need is not a requirement
award is for tuition, fees and books more...

Sgt. David Falk Memorial Endowed Scholarship
Established in memory of Sgt. David Falk, this scholarship provides financial assistance to students participating in the internship program at Macomb Community College.
full-time enrollment (12 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
completed one internship
award is for tuition and fees

Sgt. James S. Collins, Jr. Memorial Scholarship
Our son, Sgt. James S. Collins, was killed in Kirkuk, Iraq on August 28, 2007. Jim was in the Marine Corp for 6 years serving at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba and all over the world on the Carriers Nassau and Theodore Roosevelt. After leaving the Marines, Jim earned a criminal justice degree from Lake Superior State and attended the OCC Police Academy. After his graduation from the academy, the call of the military was too strong to resist and he became a full time Army reservist. Jim was serving with the 303rd Military Police Unit out of Jackson, MI at the time of his death. We wanted to honor his memory in this special way. Because Jim was so proud to serving in an MP unit, we feel he would have loved knowing that his name will be on a scholarship that will help young men and women serve their communities as CJ or police professionals.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be a pre-service (self-sponsored) graduate based upon the following.

MUST be enrolled in the Police Academy

MUST have excellent overall performance and academic performance

MUST have financial need

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to Southfield Lathrup High School graduate and to military veterans more...

Sgt. Patrick J. O'rourke Memorial Scholarship
The Sgt. Patrick J. O’Rourke Memorial scholarship will financially assist Criminal Justice students and perpetuate Sgt. O’Rourke’s memory for the benefit of his family, friends, and his brothers and sisters in Police service.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5


MUST be a U.S. citizen

MUST be enrolled in the Criminal Justice (CRJ.OPA.CA,CRJ.LAW.AAS, CRJ.COR.AAS, CRJ.GEN.AAS OR CRJ.PET.AAS) program at the Oakland Police Academy

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Shadko Family Endowed Scholarship
The fund is established by the Shadko family to recognize scholastic achievement, to encourage continued progress and to provide assistance to students in financing their education at Oakland Community College. Dr. Jacqueline Shadko, former President of the Orchard Ridge campus and her brother Frederick Shadko understand the importance of education and through this scholarship will ensure that students have the support to succeed.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completer 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College.

MUST have Orchard Ridge as their home campus.

MUST have a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA is required.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST use awards for tuition and educational expenses.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Shane Alan Wright Endowed Scholarship
The Shane Alan Wright Endowed scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a between a minimum of 6 and 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who have successfully completed or are currently participating in a recognized substance abuse recovery program. A statement indicating the program and the applicant’s participation status should be included with the application. more...

Sherman Throop Memorial Toyota Scholarship

Sherrel Jamesha Finley Memorial Scholarship
Established in memory of Sherrel J. Finley. Sherrel was a 2018 graduate of Macomb Community College, where she studied Business Management. Sherrel passed away unexpectedly prior to her college commencement ceremony, one of her major life’s goals. Sherrel became an avid student and found a passion working with young children, believing that early development and education was critical to the success of our youth. Despite challenges and barriers in her education, Sherrel’s sense of purpose, motivation and strong sense of self, helped her excel. Sherrel will be remembered for her strength in overcoming obstacles and her belief in the importance of early childhood education in building a strong foundation for future success. This scholarship will be used to assist students who are facing challenges in their life in accomplishing their educational and professional goals.
• minimum 2.0 or higher GPA
• provide a 250-word essay describing a challenge the applicant is currently facing or has overcome in their life and how this award will help them achieve their educational goals
• awards is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses
• students are able to reapply for this scholarship more...

Small Biz 4 Equality Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to encourage and assist student enrolled in the School of Communications who identify as LGBTQIA+ or allies, with the cost of their education.
To qualify, you must:
*be an undergraduate
*enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in the School of Communications
*be making Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP)
Preference will be given to students who identify as LGBTQIA+ or demonstrate a passion for LGBTQIA+ advocacy.
Financial aid may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal – May or may not be renewed with reapplication. This scholarship may be awarded for a maximum of eight semesters. more...

Small Family Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to students who demonstrate a commitment to completing their degree with little to no debt by working their way through college. To be eligible students must:
Be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU

Be an undergraduate junior or senior
Be enrolled for 12 credits or more
Have a 3.0 or higher GPA

Be making Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) as determined by the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
Preference will be given to students who have worked to contribute to the cost of their education and can demonstrate continuous work experience during their educational experience at GVSU.
Financial need may be considered and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication for a maximum of 4 semesters as long as the recipient continues to meet the qualifications. more...

Social Justice Scholars Annual Scholarship (Occ)
The OCC Social Justice Scholars Annual Scholarship was established to honor the memory of Mr. George Perry Floyd Jr. (October 14, 1973-May 25, 2020), whose tragic death not only called critical attention to the persistence and significance of racial injustice in this country but also inspired and propelled a worldwide movement aimed at exposing and deconstructing systemic racism, among other goals.
This scholarship is intended to recognize OCC students who engage in activism on behalf of social justice causes and to support their educational attainment in preparation for a life of advocacy and service. more...

Soldan Family Endowed Book Scholarship
The Soldan Family Endowed Book scholarship was established by a former OCC counselor, Larry Soldan. As a counselor, Mr. Soldan found that many students receive tuition scholarships and then discover they cannot afford to buy the required books. This endowment is meant to assist those students.
(*NOTE: * If awarded a “book” scholarship, you must submit all textbook receipts before the end of current semester to receive scholarship. Failure to do so will forfeit your award. Scholarships are non-transferrable and must be used for the semester awarded.)
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 3 credit hours at Oakland Community College.

MUST have earned a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0


MUST have demonstrated financial need

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for textbooks only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students with Orchard Ridge specified as their “home” campus.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Sorensen Biology Scholarship

Southfield/Oak Park Academic Recognition (Soar) Endowed Scholarship
Southfield/Oak Park Academic Recognition (SOAR) Endowed Scholarship
“Education is for improving the lives of others and for leaving your community and world better than you found it.”
~ Marian Wright Edelman, founder and president emerita of The Children’s Defense Fund
This powerful quote encapsulates an important purpose of education: to advance one’s self educationally so that one might in turn uplift and better one’s community. The Southfield/Oak Park Academic Recognition (SOAR) Endowed Scholarship was established to support the postsecondary attainment of graduates of Southfield and Oak Park high schools. The ultimate vision for this scholarship is that recipients, upon completion of their studies at Oakland Community College, will deploy their education in service to their community, and thus “leave their community and the world better than they found it.” more...

Spalink Memorial Missions Scholarship
Scholarship for upper-division students attending Calvin College whose career goals are in a missionary vocation. Selection based on academic achievement and financial need. Preference given to students affliated with the Christian Reformed Church. Nonrenewable. more...

Spanish Department Travel-Study Abroad Awards
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Western Michigan University who are majoring in Spanish and will be studying abroad. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA in major and minimum 3.25 CGPA and completed two Spanish courses with one at the 300-level at the time of acceptance of award. Deadlines and award amounts may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Specialist Andrew Waits 101St Airborne Division Endowed
This scholarship is established in memory and honors Specialist Andrew Waits, member of the 101st Airborne Division (Air Assault), 1/502 Inf 2 BCT, A Co., Ft. Campbell, KY; killed in action in Baghdad, Iraq on Thursday, April 13, 2006. This fund is established to recognize the top marksman in the Police Academy by assisting students in financing their education at Oakland Community College, and is to be administered according to the following provisions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be in the Police Academy at the Auburn Hills Campus

MUST be the top marksman in his/her class
The Director of the Police Academy will notify the Foundation of the top marksman in each class

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

This scholarship is designed to provide financial assistance to Macomb Community College students pursuing a transfer program to a four year college/university…with a major in Music Education, Voice or Performance.
student must have a major in Music Education, Voice, or Performance
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.5 or higher and must maintain this GPA each semester of award (a minimum GPA of 3.0 or above is required in Music courses)
award is for tuition, fees, books and other educational expenses
award is renewable based on commitment to educational goals, compliance to scholarship criteria and availability of funds
student must demonstrate strong vocal talent as well as performance skills that engage and entertain
student must submit a resume which includes: a brief personal history, music experience and education and career goals
scholarship applications will be reviewed and recipient(s) selected by the college Director of Choral Activities more...

Stephen Thomas First Responders Scholarship (Msgcu)
“People helping people” is the philosophy that Michigan Schools and Government Credit Union (MSGCU) embraces. As a community credit union, MSGCU believes strongly in supporting first responders in our communities.
The scholarship is named in honor of a Michigan Schools and Government Credit Union Board Member, Stephen Thomas. Mr. Thomas served on the MSGCU Board for 21 years and was an MSGCU member for more than three (3) decades. He was a Vietnam War Veteran, a retired Sergeant of the Macomb County Sheriff’s Department, and he retired as the Administrator of the Special Investigation Unit for Michigan Basic Property Insurance Association.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled at the Police or Fire Academy at OCC


MUST be a pre-service student

MUST have minimum cumulative GPA of 2.0


MUST submit a 250-word essay describing career goals, community service, and how advancing their education will help prepare them for their career choice

MUST be 18 years old on or before September 1st of the current academic year

MUST write thank-you letter to donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Stephen Thomas First Responders Scholarship (Offered By Michigan Schools And Government Credit Union)
This scholarship is named after former Michigan Schools and Government Credit Union Board Member Stephen Thomas. Mr. Thomas served on the MSGCU Board for 21 years and was an MSGCU member for more than three (3) decades. He was a Vietnam War Veteran, a retired Sergeant of the Macomb County Sheriff’s Department, and retired as the Administrator of the Special Investigation Unit for Michigan Basic Property Insurance Association. “People Helping People” is the philosophy that Michigan Schools and Government Credit Union (MSGCU) embraces. As a community credit union, MSGCU believes strongly in supporting first responders in our communities. This scholarship will provide financial assistance to Macomb Community College students enrolled in the Police and Fire Academies at Macomb Community College.
must be enrolled in the Fire Training or Police Academy
must be a pre-service student
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.0 or higher
provide a 250 word essay about your career goals, community service and how your educational plan helps prepare you for this career choice
selection will be made by the Managers of the Fire and Police Academies
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://macomb.academicworks.com/opportunities/flexible.html" more...

Student-Athlete Study Abroad Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide a scholarship in spring/summer semester for student-athletes who have financial need and have not had the opportunity to pursue study abroad previously.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be an undergraduate NCAA student-athlete enrolled for 3 credit hours or more in an officially sponsored academic program abroad, approved by GVSU’s Padnos International Center, which involves a course that counts towards their GVSU degree.
*be meeting satisfactory academic progress (https://www.gvsu.edu/financialaid/satisfactory-academic-progress-sap-17.htm)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may not be renewed.
*Financial need is required, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application fro Federal Student Aid (FAFSA). more...

The Study Abroad Photography Scholarship, established in 2011, is intended to support students who wish to study outside of the United States.
Must be enrolled with full-time status as a degree-seeking student
Participate in an approved for-credit Study Abroad program
Submit an application through the Padnos International Center
Financial need may be considered more...

Study Abroad Scholarship
The Mission of Global Education Committee Study Abroad Scholarship Fund is to provide students various means for developing awareness, knowledge and appreciation of other nations and cultures with the purpose of increasing their understanding of international differences and similarities, cultural diversity, international human needs and resources, and to help meet the Vision Statement of the College.
*In addition to the apply-to questions and qualifications, students must show proof of acceptance into a study abroad program approved by the Global Education Committee. International students are encouraged to apply. Preference will be given to applicants who have not previously received an award. * more...

Susan & Dennis Fiems Endowed Textbook Scholarship
Susan and Dennis Fiems worked at Oakland Community College for a combined total of 52 years. Together, they served the College community in a variety of ways. This scholarship reflects their love of books and their desire to help others.
(*NOTE: * If awarded a “book” scholarship, you must submit all textbook receipts before the end of current semester to receive scholarship. Failure to do so will forfeit your award. Scholarships are non-transferable and must be used for the semester awarded.)
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a demonstrated cumulative GPA of 2.0


MUST have the Highland Lakes Campus designated as their “home” campus

MUST have demonstrated financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for textbooks only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Susan Murdock/Sandra Langeland Annual Scholarship
The Susan Murdock/Sandra Langeland Annual scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum 2.5 GPA*

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST be an Oakland county resident

MUST have Highland Lakes as your designated “home campus”

MUST have financial need

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST use for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Suyoga "Good Opportunity" Annual Scholarship
Since joining the full-time faculty at OCC in 1991, Suba Subbarao has distinguished herself in and out of the classroom as a dedicated and innovative educator, committed to the success of her students. The Suyoga “Good Opportunity” Scholarship, so named to honor her heritage of placing the highest value on learning, is the latest expression of that commitment. She has created this scholarship in gratitude for the blessings she has received, and to show students the doors that education can open for them.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be taking classes at the Auburn Hills Campus

MUST have a GPA of 2.7 or higher

MUST provide a letter of reference from an OCC instructor, an employer, or a non-family member describing the applicant’s commitment to learning

MUST be used for tuition, books and other educational expenses.

MUST be enrolled in a program of study.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who have struggled to enter or return to higher education due to domestic violence, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, single parenthood, difficult life-changing transitions, or similar circumstances; and
Preference will be given to students who are reentering the workforce after such a period of no employment or under-employment due to family circumstances such as caring for children or aging parents.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

The Arlene Treanor Native Plants Internship
Before submitting this application, you must have arranged for an internship with a faculty sponsor, your academic advisor, and an agent of the business or agency where you will work. See the Biology website for additional information regarding internships.
This internship award will be available to students who are at a wholesale or retail plant nursery or landscaping business and the purpose of the internship shall be to learn about and participate in use of native plants in landscaping.
Must be a Biology or Natural Resource Management major
Must be an entering sophomore, junior, or senior at GVSU

Selection will be based upon the students’ academic records, the appropriateness of the proposed activities to the purposed of the award, and the quality of the proposal.
A faculty sponsor is required
You will be expected to present your internship results to the Biology Department by means of a presentation at one of the following: Student Scholarship Day, a poster placed in Henry Hall, a seminar or a presentation at an event sponsored by the Waddell-Treanor Native Plants Endowment. more...

This scholarship is awarded to students who want to conduct research in native plants and their use in gardening, landscaping, ecosystem restoration eradication of undesirable invasive species or conservation of native species of plants in Michigan.

Be enrolled full time
Transfer candidates must be accepted by Grand Valley State University for enrollment, and recipients must be attending the University to be eligible to receive this award

DeWitt Barrels has partnered with Grand Valley State University to offer this scholarship to students pursuing careers in the preservation and restoration of natural resources.
Candidates must be a full-time degree-seeking Junior or Senior who has earned 55 or more credit hours
Must be studying Natural Resources Management
Must be making Satisfactory Academic Progress
Candidates must demonstrate their intention to enter a career involving preservation or restoration of our natural resources. No particular course path is required to apply, the sciences are likely to lead to a career in an environment science or natural resource field.
Must demonstrate financial need and must file FAFSA

Transfer candidates must be accepted to GVSU to apply
Renewal Criteria: Scholarships may be renewed without reapplication for a max of (4) semesters more...

The Schmidt/Workman Graduate Student Athlete Fellowship
The purpose of this fellowship is to assist former GVSU student athletes with their graduate degree endeavors after their eligibility as a GVSU student athlete is exhausted. The fellowship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier in completing their graduate degree in a timely fashion.
Must be accepted or currently enrolled at GVSU

Must have earned a bachelor’s degree at GVSU

Must have exhausted their athletic eligibility
Must be enrolled in any graduate program for at least 9 credit hours or more directly proceeding their undergraduate program
Must be in good academic standing and meeting Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP) as determined by the Office of Financial Aid & Scholarships
Financial need will be considered and shall be demonstrated by Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient(s) continues to meet the qualifications listed above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 5 semesters (including summer). more...

MUST have completed at least 8 credit hours of instruction at OCC. Transfer credit hours count toward eligibility.

MUST be enrolled in the English as a Second Language (ESL) program.

MUST take ESL classes at the Royal Oak/Southfield campus.

MUST write a personal statement explaining how the scholarship would help.

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...
