The Society of Manufacturing Engineering Engineers Grand Rapids Chapter 38 Scholarship is dedicated to the education of future manufacturing professionals in west Michigan. The scholarship provides students in the west Michigan area with a cash award ranging from $250 to $1,000 to pursue their education in fields related to manufacturing. To be eligible you must be:
graduating from high school, or a current first year college/university student
enrolled in a manufacturing related discipline at GVSU

The Suresh Family Endowed Scholarship Fund
We, the Suresh family, have seen first-hand the value that OCC offers to this community; our children and I have all attended a few OCC courses to help us assess our career paths, as well as pursue outside interests. I have come to realize that inspiration can come from any source (mentor, teacher, or friend), in any form (encouragement, challenge, or despair), and through any medium (story, book, or video). Therefore, I hope that this scholarship will not only enable the recipient to attend OCC, but will also inspire the recipient to take the step towards their career goal.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours count toward eligibility.

CANNOT have already completed an Associate’s or higher degree.

MUST have demonstrated scholastic achievement with a minimum 2.5 GPA.

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by the OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships.

MUST be enrolled in an Engineering/Manufacturing and Industrial Technology program.
(Currently includes Architecture (ACH), Automobile Servicing (AUS/CAR), Computer Aided Design and Drafting Technology (CAD), Computer Support Engineering Technology (CSE), Electrical Trades Technology (ETT),
Environmental Systems Technology (ENV), Machine Tool Technology (MTT), Nanotechnology in Materials Science (NNO), Robotics (ROB), Technological Sciences (TSC), and Welding (WEL).)

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given first to disabled veterans, then veterans, then students with dependent children. more...

To be eligible for this award, the applicant:
• MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

• MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement
• MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

The Townsend Family Math Annual Scholarship
The Townsend Family Scholarship was created to assist students in funding their college education. Life can often get in the way of an education. Others shared that educational opportunity with Townsend family members and it is important to pass on the legacy of education. There is no greater value than investing in one’s education and it is important that the opportunity is available to all who need assistance. When life is facing students, we want them to know that there are others who care, who believe in their potential and have faith in their ability to overcome all obstacles.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have a minimum cumulative 2.5 GPA


MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be pursuing a Math or Science (ASC) degree

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

The Young Black Making A Difference (Ybmad) Scholarship
The Young Black Making a Difference (YBMaD) scholarship program is designed to assist financially needy, academically competitive students who identify as African American. These scholarships are part of the non profits ongoing commitment to education.
YBMaD offers two scholarships $250 each, to students who have kids and are from communities who face limited access to educational career opportunities.
Eligibility:
Applicant must identify as a student parent with parenting responsibilities (including but not limited to child support, care visits, academic support, guardianship etc.).
Applicant must have a current minimum GPA 2.5 (i.e. good academic standing).
Currently enrolled college student who has at least one parent of African American or Black Caribbean heritage.
Selection priority is given to applicants who have kids.
Scholarship recipients must enroll in and attend a two or four-year accredited college or university or vocational/technical school. Verification of enrollment is required. Scholarship funds will be paid via check directly to the accredited institution in which the student is enrolled. Scholarship funds will not be paid directly, nor reimbursed, to an award recipient.
Eligible students must submit a complete application and attach all of the required documentation or their application will not be reviewed.
Application Process: Application and instruction for submission is available for download by clicking ‘visit’ at the bottom of the page.
Contact Information: 
1139 Grand Bluffs Dr. SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49534
616-482-9291 more...

Thomas A. & Cheryl L. '91,'98 Butcher Non-Traditional Student Scholarship
This scholarship will assist non-traditional students who have no parental support to count toward the cost of their education and would benefit greatly from additional scholarship support. Non-traditional students include students who did not begin pursuing a bachelor’s degree immediately following high school graduation and/or may have family or work responsibilities to balance in addition to their studies at Grand Valley. To be eligible for this scholarship:
Recipients shall have been accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU).
They must be an undergraduate junior or senior and enrolled for 12 credit hours or more in any course of study
Must have a cumulative grade point average of (3.0) or greater on a 4.0 scale
Preference will be given to non-traditional students who may be balancing work or family responsibilities in addition to pursuing a degree
Financial need may be considered, and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above. This scholarship may be awarded to an individual for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

Thomas P. Sullivan, D.D.S Memorial Endowed Scholarship
To ensure that the legacy of Thomas P. Sullivan continues to enrich the lives of others, his family and friends established this scholarship. Dr. Sullivan, as he was affectionately called, had a fulfilling 40 career as a dentist in Bloomfield Hills, MI. When he retired, he remained active on his 70-acre farm and as a volunteer. He served as a Treasurer, Vice Chair and then Chair of the Oakland Community College Board of Trustees. He would also serve as a Board of Director on the OCC Foundation Board. In both roles, he was a dedicated leader who unified the Boards with vision of meeting community needs and improving student success in a financially sustainable institution.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 12 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be enrolled in the Dental Hygiene (DHY) program.

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


MUST demonstrate financial need

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST submit a brief statement (one-page or less) regarding the reasons for applying for this scholarship.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to students who have designated Highland Lakes as their “home” campus
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Thomas R. Mill Memorial Endowed Scholarship For The Public Service Institute
This scholarship was established by family, friends, and colleagues of Thomas Mill to continue his legacy of public service. Tom began his service to Macomb County as a public safety officer for the city of Fraser. He then served as a firefighter/paramedic for the city of Roseville Fire Department before retiring as Deputy Chief of Emergency Medical Services (EMS) and Training. During this time, Tom also served as Adjunct Faculty for the Macomb Community College police and fire academies. In 2000, he accepted a full-time position with Macomb’s Public Service Institute in the Emergency Medical Services department and served in this role until he retired in 2017. Tom left a lasting impact on the students he taught and the community he served. This scholarship will provide financial support to students training to become future police officers, firefighters, paramedics, and emergency medical technicians within our community.
enrolled in Police Academy, Fire Academy, Paramedic, or EMT program at Macomb Community College
demonstrates academic ability with a minimum 2.5 GPA at the time of application
two letters of recommendation that speak to the applicant’s character and commitment to public service
preference given to military veterans and adult learners re-training for a public service career
award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses.
For Information on How to Apply, click on the following link:
https://macomb.academicworks.com/opportunities/flexible.html" more...

Tom “Wakes” Waelchli Memorial Baseball Scholarship
This scholarship is in memory of Tom “Wakes” Waelchli, who passed away suddenly on April 20, 2020. After receiving his master’s degree from Wayne State University, Tom went on to live his life immersed in his number one passion: Baseball. Wakes coached baseball for Macomb’s athletics program since 1985. His love for the game took him around the world to coach, play and mentor. Family and friends established this scholarship in memory of Coach Wakes, to continue his legacy and passion for Macomb’s baseball program through scholarships for their student athletes.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 2.0 each semester of award
current athlete on the Macomb Monarchs baseball team at Macomb Community College
letter of recommendation from coach
250-word essay about your future career and athletic goals including those planned for attaining at Macomb Community College
award is for tuition, fees, and books more...

Tony Serra Automotive Technician Scholarship
This scholarship was established by the Tony Serra Highland Nissan dealership to provide financial support to Macomb students studying in the Automotive Technology program. This scholarship will impact the future success of Macomb students by offering a gateway into their careers as an automotive technician.
enrolled in Macomb’s Automotive Technology Program as a full or part-time student
250-word essay/personal statement describing why you want a career in automotive repair
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
award is for tuition, fees, books and other educational expenses
Note to applicants: Upon successful completion of Macomb’s Automotive Technology Program and a passing score on the ASE (Automotive Service Experience) certification test, the scholarship recipient is guaranteed an entry level position with Tony Serra dealership and will be reimbursed for the ASE testing/certification costs. more...

Van Hoy Family Endowed Scholarship
The Van Hoy Family Endowed scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed between 12 and 90 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST have a cumulative 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST demonstrate financial need.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference given to single heads of households.
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Vaughn Hayes Memorial Endowed Scholarship
The Vaughn Hayes Memorial scholarship was established to honor the memory of Vaughn Hayes and recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours of instruction at Oakland Community College. Transfer credit hours are counted toward the maximum eligibility.

MUST have a minimum cumulative 2.5 GPA


MUST be enrolled in an Engineering/Manufacturing and Industrial Technology program.
(Currently includes Architecture (ACH), Automobile Servicing (AUS/CAR), Computer Aided Design and Drafting Technology (CAD), Computer Support Engineering Technology (CSE), Electrical Trades Technology (ETT),
Environmental Systems Technology (ENV), Machine Tool Technology (MTT), Nanotechnology in Materials Science (NNO), Robotics (ROB), Technological Sciences (TSC), and Welding (WEL).)

MUST have demonstrated financial need (determined by OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships).

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Vince & Joe’s Gourmet Market Culinary Scholarship
In 1983, first generation brothers, Vince and Joe Vitale, along with their wives, Mimma and Maria, proudly opened a gourmet market with the vision and promise of delivering a premier specialty food store to Macomb County. Today, a second generation of family members shares this tradition of quality, service and value for its customers in both Clinton and Shelby Township. To honor their commitment to the community, the Vitale family has pledged to support the students at the Macomb Culinary Institute at Macomb Community College through the establishment of this Culinary Scholarship.
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
award is for tuition, fees, books, and other educational expenses
students should submit an essay on their goals and community commitments and activities
if selected, the recipient(s) agrees to work with Macomb’s Career Services office and Vince & Joe’s Gourmet Market to discuss internship/career opportunities more...

Applicants must also show qualities of leadership by providing written documentation of demonstrated community service, and may include letters of support past activities.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 6 credit hours at Oakland Community College

MUST be enrolled in the Nursing program

MUST have a minimum 3.6 cumulative GPA


MUST demonstrate financial need (as determined by the OCC Office of Financial Assistance and Scholarships)

MUST be used for for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Votus Scholarship For Children Or Spouses Of Deceased Military Or Veterans
The veteran of the United States (VOTUS) Scholarship was established by Sandi Jones in 2017, with gratitude and in memory of the family members who served during World War II: Robert B. Jones (US Army Air Corps), husband; Linton L. Lambert (US Army), father; Edward H. Henning (US Army), uncle; Ralph O. Henning (US Army), uncle; and Harold Gellert (US Navy), uncle; and to all who gave their lives so that we can sleep nights knowing we are free and safe. With thanks and in honor of Lawrence L. Lambert (US Air Force), brother, and to all active and veteran military who gave themselves, the people of Macomb salute you. The scholarship is available for veterans of the United States or for the spouses and/or children of deceased military members or veterans of the United States meeting at least the following criteria:
half-time enrollment (6 credit hours) or more
minimum GPA 2.5 (high school or college)
award is for $1,000 per year for tuition, fees and books and other educational expenses
applicants must provide a brief summary of their educational goals and how this scholarship will impact them more...

W.K. Kellogg Foundation Doctoral Fellowship In Health Policy
Scholarship for African American, Mexican American, Native American, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian and mainland Puerto Rican students permanently residing in the US who are graduate students at an AAMC or AOA-accredited Medical School pursuing studies in Public Health, Health Policy, or Social Policy. Students must be accepted to Brandeis University Heller Graduate School, Columbia University Mailman School of Public Health, Harvard University School of Public Health, Johns Hopkins University School of Hygiene and Public Health, Frederick S. Pardee RAND Graduate School, University of California-Los Angeles, University of Michigan School of Public Health, or the University Pennsylvania. Number of awards may vary. A most recent copy of the 1040, 1040A, or 1040EZ tax forms must be included with application packet. more...

Financial need may be considered

Waterford Eagles #2887 Scholarship
The Fraternal Order of Eagles is an international non-profit organization dedicated to philanthropic and service efforts which shape communities across the United States and Canada. Since 1898, the Eagles have been responsible for the creation of Mother’s Day and the protection of senior citizens through the Social Security program.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College.

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits.

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher.

MUST be a U.S. Citizen

MUST demonstrate financial need.

MUST be enrolled in a program of study.

MUST be used for tuition and books

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST be a resident of Waterford OR a member of the Fraternal Order of Eagles Waterford #2887 or an immediate family member of a member of the Fraternal Order of Eagles Waterford #2887.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

West Side Challenge Scholar Endowed Scholarship
The purpose of this scholarship is to provide financial assistance to graduates of Union High School.
To qualify students must:
*be accepted for or currently enrolled at Grand Valley State University (GVSU)
*be a graduate of Union High School in Grand Rapids, Michigan
*be an undergraduate junior or senior enrolled for 12 credit hours or more
*have a 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
Preference will be given to students who successfully complete the Grand Rapids Community Foundation Challenge Scholars program.
Financial need is required and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship may be renewed without reapplication provided the recipient continues to meet the qualifications stated above for a maximum of four semesters. more...

Through this scholarship, the Pullins family wants to show appreciation to the profession which gave her such great care in her final days, by helping future nurses achieve their educational and professional goals.

half-time enrollment (6 credit hours or more) each semester of award
minimum GPA 3.0 each semester of award
must submit a 250-word essay on “How you will promote compassion in your career as a nurse?
award is for tuition, fees and other educational expenses
recipient agrees to meet with donor more...

The purpose of this scholarship is to provide encouragement and financial support to physics students.
Recipients must be accepted and currently enrolled at GVSU

Must be an undergraduate junior or senior
Must be enrolled full time with a declared Physics major
Must have a cumulative GPA of a 3.2 or higher
Must be maintaining Satisfactory Academic Progress according to standards of the University
Preference will be given to candidates from Kent, Ottawa, Muskegon and Allegan counties
Financial need will be considered and will be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
Renewal Criteria: May be renewed without reapplication as long as recipient continues to meet renewal requirements for a maximum of 4 semesters. more...

The William and Judith Stuart Endowed scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST have a minimum of 12 credit hours at Oakland Community College.

MUST have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0


MUST be enrolled full-time (12 credit hours or more_) or part-time (_at least 6 credit hours)

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST be used for tuition only

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...

Women Of Oakland University Critical Difference Scholarship
Annual award for non-traditional student who is an undergraduate attending Oakland University in Michigan. Applicants must be a single head of household whose education has been interrupted for at least one year. Candidates must have earned 16 credits at the university level with a minimum 2.5 GPA. more...

Women Of Oakland University Critical Difference Scholarship
The Women of Oakland University Critical Difference Scholarship is available to students at Oakland University who are single heads of households and have had their education interrupted for at least one year. You must have earned at least 16 credits at the university level and have a minimum 2.5 GPA to be eligible for this award. more...

Women Of Wayne Incentive Program For Part-Time Students
Scholarship for part-time, female undergraduate, post-degree, and graduate students attending Wayne State University. Selection based on academic achievement and potential. Award is applied to tuition fees. Number of awards may vary. Due date: Fall Semester-June 15th; Winter Semester-October 15th; and Spring/Summer Semester-February 5th. Contact the Women of Wayne Alumni Association for more information. more...

Women Of Wayne Incentive Scholarship Program For Part-Time Students
Scholarship for part-time, female, undergraduate students attending Wayne State University. Applicants must have a minimum 3.0 GPA and financial need. Students must file the FAFSA. Number of awards and award amount may vary. more...

Womencenter Annual Scholarship
The Womencenter Annual scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students who struggle to return to education related to difficult life-changing circumstances.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
CANNOT be receiving financial aid at the time of application.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST demonstrate need and have struggled to return to education related to circumstances such as domestic violence, divorce, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, or difficult life-changing transitions.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who are reentering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment due to family circumstances such as caring for children or aging parents.
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Womencenter Endowed Scholarship
The Womencenter Endowed scholarship was established to recognize scholastic achievement, encourage continued progress, and provide financial assistance to students.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
CANNOT be receiving financial aid at the time of application.

MUST have completed a minimum of 8 credits at Oakland Community College

MUST be currently enrolled at OCC for at least 3 credits

MUST have a 2.5 GPA or higher

MUST have a declared program of study

MUST demonstrate need and have struggled to return to education related to circumstances such as domestic violence, divorce, economic hardship, lack of spousal support, or difficult life-changing transitions.

MUST write a thank-you letter to the donor.

MUST be used for tuition and other educational expenses

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Preference will be given to students who are reentering the workforce after a period of no employment or under-employment due to family circumstances such as caring for children or aging parents.
Oakland Community College Foundation scholarships are offered to currently-enrolled OCC students without regard to race, gender, gender identity, color, ethnicity, or national origin, regardless of the scholarship’s title. For example, scholarships sponsored by women’s organizations are offered without a preference or restriction based on sex, are open to all genders, and are awarded without regard to the sex of the applicant. more...

Writing And Leadership Scholarship
To reduce the financial pressure on students and their families and make a Grand Valley education accessible to students from all backgrounds. This need-based scholarship will ensure that financial need does not become a barrier to intellectual and personal growth. This scholarship will assist writing majors who demonstrate leadership on campus and in their fields.
To qualify recipients must:
- be accepted for or currently enrolled at GVSU
- be an undergraduate senior
- be enrolled for 12 credits or more
- have a declared major in writing
- be maintaining satisfactory academic progress (SAP) according to the norms established by the University and the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
Financial need is required and shall be demonstrated by the completion of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).
This scholarship is not renewable. more...

Wshf Student Financial Assistance Award
Scholarship for undergraduate students attending Wayne State University who are majoring in Nursing. Selection based on academic achievement and financial need. Due date and number of awards may vary. more...

Wwmt Communications Scholarship
Scholarship for juniors or seniors attending Western Michigan University who are majoring in Television Broadcast. Applicants must have a minimum 3.5 GPA. Due date and number of awards may vary. Nonrenewable. more...

Yarema-Przymusinski Family Health Professions Annual Scholarship
Lori Przymusinski, R.N., MSN established the Przymusinski Family Health Professions Scholarship in 2018. Lori and her husband Dean are grateful for the opportunities OCC has opened for them. These scholarships are an expression of that gratitude, and of their desire to help OCC students succeed in the health professions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled in one of the following Health Professions or Medical Technologies curriculum or majors:
Diagnostic Medical Sonography (OMS.APP);
Radiologic Technology (RAL.APP);
Respiratory Therapy (RSP .APP); or
Surgical Technology (SUR.APP)


MUST be in good academic standing with a minimum GPA of 2.0 or better

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources & Scholarships

MUST write thank-you letter to donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student more...

Yarema-Przymusinski Family Health Professions Endowed Scholarship
Lori Przymusinski, R.N., MSN established the Przymusinski Family Health Professions Scholarship in 2018. Lori and her husband Dean are grateful for the opportunities OCC has opened for them. These scholarships are an expression of that gratitude, and of their desire to help OCC students succeed in the health professions.
Criteria
To be eligible for this award, applicants:
MUST be enrolled in one of the following Health Professions or Medical Technologies curriculum or majors:
Diagnostic Medical Sonography (OMS.APP);
Radiologic Technology (RAL.APP);
Respiratory Therapy (RSP .APP); or
Surgical Technology (SUR.APP)


MUST be in good academic standing with a minimum GPA of 2.0 or better

MUST have demonstrated financial need as determined by OCC Student Financial Resources & Scholarships

MUST write thank-you letter to donor

MUST NOT be an OCC employee or family member receiving tuition reimbursement

MUST NOT be a College guest student, high school guest student or high school dual enrolled student
Renewal criteria: This scholarship can be renewed if recipient still meets criteria. Renewal is subject to funding availability. more...
